Das gleiche gilt bei versteckten Mängeln, die nicht innerhalb von acht Werktagen ab Entdeckung angezeigt werden.

 

10.5             Kann Jedox einen Mangel nicht innerhalb einer angemessenen, vom Kunden zu setzenden Frist, die mindestens drei Versuche der Mangelbeseitigung ermöglicht, beheben, so kann der Kunde den Vertrag außerordentlich kündigen.

 

10.6             Kann nach einer Mängelanzeige des Kunden eine Vertragswidrigkeit nicht festgestellt werden, hat der Kunde die im Zusammenhang mit der Prüfung entstandenen Kosten zu ersetzen, wenn die unberechtigte Mängelanzeige auf ein Verschulden des Kunden zurückzuführen ist.

 

10.7             Soweit ein Dritter Schutzrechte bzgl. der vertragsgegenständlichen Leistungen gegenüber Kunden geltend macht, wird Jedox nach ihrer Wahl und auf ihre Kosten die vertragsgegenständlichen Leistungen entweder ändern oder ersetzen, so dass eine Schutzrechtsverletzung für den Kunden nicht mehr gegeben ist.

 

10.8             Der Kunde unterrichtet Jedox unverzüglich schriftlich, falls Dritte Schutzrechte (z.B. Urheber- oder Patentrechte) an den vertragsgegenständlichen Leistungen gegen ihn geltend machen. Der Kunde ermächtigt Jedox, die Auseinandersetzung mit dem Dritten allein zu führen. Solange Jedox von dieser Ermächtigung Gebrauch macht, darf der Kunde von sich aus die Ansprüche des Dritten nicht ohne die Zustimmung von Jedox anerkennen; Jedox wehrt dann die Ansprüche des Dritten auf eigene Kosten ab und stellt den Kunden von allen mit der Abwehr dieser Ansprüche verbundene Kosten frei, soweit diese nicht auf pflichtwidrigem Verhalten des Kunden (z.B. der vertragswidrigen Nutzung) beruhen.

 

10.9             Für Schäden aufgrund von Mängeln haftet Jedox nur in den in Ziff. 11 und 12 genannten Grenzen. Diese Beschränkung gilt nicht, soweit Jedox einen Mangel arglistig verschwiegen hat.

 

10.10         Der nach den Supportbedingungen gemäß Ziffer 2.1 dieser SaaS-Bedingungen vereinbarte Support schränkt die nach dieser Ziffer 10 bestehenden Gewährleistungsrechte des Kunden nicht ein.

 

 

11.          Haftung, Haftungsausschluss

 

11.1            Jedox haftet entsprechend den Vorschriften des Produkthaftungsgesetzes sowie in den Fällen zu vertretenden Unvermögens und zu vertretender Unmöglichkeit. Ferner haftet Jedox für Schäden nach den gesetzlichen Bestimmungen in den Fällen des Vorsatzes, der groben Fahrlässigkeit, bei Übernahme einer Garantie sowie bei einer von Jedox zu vertretenden Verletzung von Leben, Körper oder Gesundheit. Verletzt Jedox im Übrigen mit einfacher Fahrlässigkeit eine Pflicht, deren Erfüllung die ordnungsgemäße Durchführung des Vertrages erst ermöglicht und auf deren Einhaltung der Kunde regelmäßig vertrauen darf, oder eine Pflicht, deren Verletzung die Erreichung des Vertragszwecks gefährdet (insgesamt „Kardinalpflichten“), ist die Ersatzpflicht von Jedox auf den vertragstypischen, vorhersehbaren Schaden begrenzt; Ziff. 4.2 - Haftungsbegrenzung bei Lieferverzögerung - bleibt unberührt. In allen anderen Fällen der Haftung sind Schadensersatzansprüche wegen der Verletzung einer Pflicht aus dem Schuldverhältnis sowie wegen unerlaubter Handlung ausgeschlossen, sodass Jedox insoweit nicht für entgangenen Gewinn oder sonstige Vermögensschäden des Kunden haftet.

 

11.2                  Im Falle eines Datenverlustes ist die Haftung von Jedox in den Fällen einfacher Fahrlässigkeit auf den Wiederherstellungsaufwand bei vorhandener Datensicherung beschränkt.

 

11.3                  Soweit die Haftung von Jedox aufgrund der vorstehenden Bestimmungen ausgeschlossen oder beschränkt ist, gilt dies auch für die persönliche Haftung der Angestellten, Arbeitnehmer, Mitarbeiter, Vertreter und Erfüllungsgehilfen von Jedox.

 

12.          Verjährung

 

Vorbehaltlich Satz 3 verjähren alle Haftungsansprüche gegen Jedox nach einem Jahr. Die Frist für die Verjährung beginnt mit dem in § 199 Abs.1 BGB benannten Zeitpunkt. Die Regelungen des Satz 1 und 2 gelten nicht für eine Haftung von Jedox aufgrund Vorsatz und grober Fahrlässigkeit, bei einer von Jedox zu vertretenden Verletzung von Leben, Körper oder Gesundheit sowie bei der einfach fahrlässigen Verletzung von Kardinalpflichten und einer Haftung nach dem Produkthaftungsgesetz und aus einer Garantie.

13.          Datenschutz

 

13.1            Die Datenschutzpraxis von Jedox steht im Einklang mit dem Bundesdatenschutzgesetz (BDSG) sowie dem Telemediengesetz (TMG). Ab dem 25.05.2018 entspricht der Datenschutz von Jedox auch der Europäischen Datenschutzgrundverordnung (DSGVO).

 

13.2            Kundendaten inklusive personenbezogene Daten des Kunden werden auf rechtmäßige Weise, nach Treu und Glauben und nur für festgelegte, eindeutige und legitime Zwecke erhoben. Jedox befolgt die Prinzipien der Datenminimierung, der Richtigkeit, der Integrität und Vertraulichkeit, wie sie in der DSGVO gergelt sind. Der Kunde verpflichtet sich, diese Daten soweit gesetzlich erlaubt stets auf dem aktuellen Stand zu halten und Jedox unverzüglich alle relevanten Änderungen mitzuteilen.

 

 

13.3            Jedox gibt keine personenbezogenen Kundendaten an Dritte weiter. Ausgenommen hiervon sind Dienstleistungspartner, soweit dies zur Ermittlung des Entgelts und zur Abrechnung mit dem Kunden erforderlich ist.

 

 

13.4            Jedox stellt sicher, dass Kundendaten ausschließlich für technischen Support, Cloud Operations und Consulting Teams zugänglich sind, die einen direkten Zugang zu den personenbezogenen Daten brauchen, um Jedox Obliegenheiten nach diesem Abkommen und den entsprechenden Datenschutzgesetzen zu erfüllen. Jedox stellt sicher, dass in diesen Fällen die in diesem Abkommen geregelten Geheimhaltungsvorschriften verbindlich sind.

 

13.5            Der Kunde hat ein Recht auf Auskunft aller Informationen über seine personenbezogenen Daten sowie ein Recht auf Berichtigung, Sperrung und Löschung seiner gespeicherten Daten, sowie auf alle weiteren in der DSGVO geregelten Rechte.

 

13.6            Der Kunde ist nicht berechtigt, im Rahmen dieses Vertrages personenbezogene Daten zu speichern und zu verarbeiten. Eine zusätzliche Vereinbarung zur datenschutzkonformen Beauftragung ist daher nicht erforderlich. Für den Fall, dass der Kunde plant doch im Rahmen dieses Vertrages personenbezogene Daten speichert und verarbeitet, informiert der Kunde Jedox unverzüglich und schließt mit Jedox einen Auftragsdatenverarbeitungsvertrag bevor es zu einer Verarbeitung oder Speicherung von personenbezogenen Daten im Rahmen dieses Vertrages kommt.

 

14.          Veröffentlichte Inhalte, Nutzung der Software

 

14.1            Der Kunde ist verpflichtet, die von ihm ins Internet eingestellten Inhalte als eigene oder fremde Inhalte zu kennzeichnen und seinen vollständigen Namen und seine Anschrift darzustellen. Darüber hinausgehende Pflichten, insbesondere Informationspflichten, können sich aus dem Fernabsatzrecht, den Bestimmungen des Telekommunikationsgesetzes sowie des Telemediengesetzes ergeben. Der Kunde verpflichtet sich, dies in eigener Verantwortung zu überprüfen und zu erfüllen.

 

14.2             Der Kunde verpflichtet sich, keine Inhalte zu veröffentlichen, welche Dritte in ihren Rechten verletzen oder sonst gegen geltendes Recht verstoßen. Dem Kunden ist es insbesondere untersagt, Bilder, Texte, Grafiken und Links oder andere Daten oder Inhalte einzustellen und/oder zu verbreiten, die gegen Rechtsvorschriften verstoßen, die fremde Schutz- oder Urheberrechte oder sonstige Rechte Dritter verletzen. Das Hinterlegen und/oder öffentlich Zugänglichmachen von extremistischen oder gegen die guten Sitten verstoßenden Inhalten sowie Texten oder Dateien mit Gewaltdarstellungen, pornografischen, diskriminierenden, rassistischen, verleumderischen oder sonstigen rechtswidrigen Inhalten oder Darstellungen ist unzulässig. Jedox ist berechtigt, den Zugriff des Kunden für den Fall zu sperren, dass hiergegen verstoßen wurde. Das Gleiche gilt für den Fall, dass der Kunde Inhalte veröffentlicht, die geeignet sind, Dritte in ihrer Ehre zu verletzen, Personen oder Personengruppen zu beleidigen oder zu verunglimpfen. Das gilt auch für den Fall, dass ein tatsächlicher Rechtsanspruch nicht gegeben sein sollte. Der Kunde ist für die von ihm bereitgestellten Daten und Inhalte selbst verantwortlich. Jedox überprüft die Daten und Inhalte weder auf ihre Richtigkeit, noch auf Virenfreiheit oder auf virentechnische Verarbeitbarkeit hin.

 

14.3            Dem Kunden ist es untersagt, (a) im Rahmen dieser SaaS-Bedingungen rechtsverletzende, ehrenrührige bzw. sonstige rechtswidrige und/ oder unerlaubte Inhalte zu speichern oder zu versenden (b) hier zur Verfügung gestellte Leistungen und Systeme zu nutzen, um böswillige Codes oder sonstige Sabotageprogramme zu speichern oder zu versenden,

(c)   die Integrität oder Leistungsfähigkeit der hier zur Verfügung gestellten Leistungen und Systeme zu beeinträchtigen bzw. zu stören,

(d)   sich unbefugten Zugang zu den mit den hier zur Verfügung gestellten Leistungen zusammenhängenden Systemen oder Netzen zu verschaffen sowie

(e) Spam-, Massen- oder sonstige unerwünschte Nachrichten in Verletzung geltender Gesetze zu verschicken.

 

14.4            Bei Nichtbeachtung ist Jedox berechtigt den Zugriff zu sperren.

 

15.           Entgelt, Fälligkeit, Zahlungsverzug

 

15.1            Soweit nichts anderes vereinbart wurde, bestimmt sich das Entgelt für die Nutzung der Standardsoftware im Rahmen der „Jedox Cloud“ während der Mindestlaufzeit nach der aktuellen Preis- und Konditionenliste von Jedox zuzüglich Umsatzsteuer. Nach Ablauf der Mindestlaufzeit gilt bei einem neuen Vertragsabschluss, soweit nichts anderes vereinbart, jeweils das in der aktuellen Preis- und Konditionenliste von Jedox für die Mindestlaufzeit genannte Entgelt zuzüglich Umsatzsteuer, sofern nicht eine neue Mindestlaufzeit vereinbart wird.

 

15.2            Das Entgelt wird, sofern nicht anders vereinbart, für die vereinbarte Mindestlaufzeit im Voraus am 3. Werktag der vereinbarten Mindestlaufzeit fällig. Nach Ablauf  der Mindestlaufzeit wird,   sofern der Vertrag nicht beendet wurde, das Entgelt für die jeweils folgende Laufzeit immer im Voraus am 3. Werktag der jeweiligen Laufzeit fällig.

 

15.3             Für die vom Kunden im Falle des Zahlungsverzugs zu zahlenden Verzugszinsen gilt Ziff. 6.4 entsprechend.

 

16.           Laufzeit und Kündigung

 

16.1             Die Laufzeit des Vertrages richtet sich nach dem in dem Angebot festgelegten Zeitraum (im Folgenden „Mindestlaufzeit“ genannt). Nach Ablauf der Mindestlaufzeit verlängert sich der Vertrag jeweils automatisch um die Zeit der Mindestlaufzeit, maximal jedoch um 24 Monate (im Folgenden „Verlängerungszeitraum“ genannt), wenn er nicht von einer der Parteien mit einer Frist von 90 Tagen zum Ende der Mindestlaufzeit oder eines Verlängerungszeitraums schriftlich gekündigt wird. Wird im Angebot keine Mindestlaufzeit festgelegt, gilt eine Mindestlaufzeit von 12 Monaten als vereinbart.

 

16.2             Das Vertragsverhältnis beginnt mit Übermittlung der Zugangsdaten an den Kunden.

 

16.3             Ein Kündigungsrecht des Kunden wegen Nichtgewährung des Gebrauchs gem. § 543 Absatz 2 Satz 1 Nr.1 BGB ist ausgeschlossen, sofern nicht die Herstellung des vertragsgemäßen Gebrauchs als fehlgeschlagen anzusehen ist.

 

16.4             § 545 BGB wird ausgeschlossen.

 

16.5             Der Vertrag kann darüber hinaus von jeder Vertragspartei ohne Einhaltung einer Frist aus wichtigem Grund schriftlich gekündigt werden. Ein wichtiger Grund, der Jedox zur Kündigung berechtigt, liegt insbesondere vor, wenn der Kunde die Rechte von Jedox dadurch verletzt, dass er die Software über das nach diesem Vertrag gestattete Maß hinaus nutzt und die Verletzung auch nach einer Abmahnung von Jedox nicht innerhalb angemessener Frist abstellt oder wenn der Kunde eine Rechnung trotz Mahnung mit angemessener Fristsetzung nicht zahlt. Für den Kunden kann ein wichtiger Grund in einer erheblichen Unterschreitung der vereinbarten Verfügbarkeit der Software liegen; hiervon ist regelmäßig bei einem Unterschreiten um mehr als 10% auszugehen.

 

16.6             Die Kündigung hat schriftlich zu erfolgen.

 

16.7             Mit Beendigung des Vertrages – gleich aus welchen Rechtsgrund- entfallen alle hiermit gewährten Rechte.

 

 

III.      Abschließende Bedingungen

 

17.           Subunternehmer

 

Jedox ist berechtigt, die vertragsgegenständlichen Leistungen durch Dritte als Unterauftragnehmer (Subunternehmer) zu erbringen, sofern es sich bei den jeweiligen Subunternehmern um hinreichend fachkundige Personen handelt.

 

18.           Geheimhaltung

 

18.1             Der Kunde verpflichtet sich, über alle ihm während dieses Vertragsverhältnisses bekanntgewordenen vertraulichen Informationen Stillschweigen zu bewahren und diese Kenntnisse nicht, insbesondere nicht für eigene geschäftliche Zwecke, zu verwenden. Als vertrauliche Informationen, gelten alle Informationen, die nur einem eng begrenzten Personenkreis bekannt sind, nicht offenkundig sind, nach dem (ausdrücklichen oder konkludenten) Willen von Jedox geheim gehalten werden sollen und an deren Geheimhaltung Jedox ein berechtigtes oder wirtschaftliches Interesse hat.

 

18.2             Die Geheimhaltung erstreckt sich nicht auf solche Kenntnisse, die jedermann zugänglich sind, die ohne Verletzung einer Geheimhaltungspflicht offengelegt sind oder werden, die der Kunde aufgrund Gesetztes oder aufgrund behördlicher oder gerichtlicher Anordnung offenlegen darf oder muss, oder deren Weitergabe für die Firma ersichtlich ohne Nachteil ist.

 

18.3             Die Pflicht zur Geheimhaltung besteht für fünf Jahre über das Vertragsende hinaus.

 

 

19.           Referenzkunden

 

Jedox darf den Kunden unter Nennung des vollen Firmennamens und unter Nutzung des Firmenlogos in Marketingmaterialien (einschließlich Webseiten) als Referenzkunden benennen.

 

20.           Erfüllungsort, anwendbares Recht, Gerichtsstand, Vorrangklausel, Änderungsklausel

 

20.1             Sofern nichts anderes vereinbart ist, ist Erfüllungsort der Geschäftssitz von Jedox.

 

20.2             Für diese SaaS-Bedingungen und die gesamten Rechtsbeziehungen zwischen Jedox und dem Kunden gilt das Recht der Bundesrepublik Deutschland unter Ausschluss sämtlicher kollisionsrechtlicher Bestimmungen sowie des UN-Kaufrechts.

 

20.3             Soweit der Kunde Kaufmann im Sinne des Handelsgesetzbuches, juristische Person des öffentlichen Rechts oder öffentlich-rechtliches Sondervermögen ist, ist ausschließlicher Gerichtsstand für sämtliche Rechte und Pflichten der Vertragsbeteiligten aus Geschäften jeder Art - auch für Wechsel- und Scheckstreitigkeiten - der Geschäftssitz von Jedox. Entsprechendes gilt, wenn der Kunde keinen allgemeinen Gerichts- stand im Inland (Bundesrepublik Deutschland) hat, nach Vertragsabschluss seinen Wohnsitz oder gewöhnlichen Aufenthalt aus dem Inland (Bundesrepublik Deutschland) verlegt oder sein Wohnsitz oder gewöhnlicher Aufenthaltsort zum Zeitpunkt der Klageerhebung nicht bekannt ist.

 

20.4             Bei Widersprüchen zwischen den SaaS-Bedingungen und den Supportbedingungen gehen die Bestimmungen der SaaS-Bedingungen vor.

 

20.5             Diese SaaS-Bedingungen können zwischen dem Kunden und Jedox durch entsprechende Vereinbarung wie nachfolgend beschrieben geändert werden: Jedox übermittelt dem Kunden die geänderten Bedingungen vor dem geplanten Inkrafttreten in Textform (z.B. E-Mail) und weist den Kunden auf die Neuregelungen sowie das Datum des geplanten Inkrafttretens gesondert hin. Zugleich wird Jedox dem Kunden eine angemessene, mindestens vier Wochen lange Frist für die Erklärung einräumen, ob der Kunde die geänderten Bedingungen für die weitere Inanspruchnahme der Leistungen akzeptiert. Erfolgt innerhalb dieser Frist, welche ab Erhalt der Nachricht in Textform zu laufen beginnt, keine Erklärung, so gelten die geänderten Bedingungen als vereinbart. Jedox wird den Kunden bei Fristbeginn gesondert auf diese Rechtsfolge, d.h. das Widerspruchsrecht, die Widerspruchsfrist und die Bedeutung des Schweigens hinweisen.

 

 

 

D

General Terms and Conditions for the Sale of Standard Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content of Jedox AG, Registered Office in 79098 Freiburg, Germany

(as of December, 2017)

 

I.              Introductory Provisions

 

1.             General, Definitions, Scope of Contract

 

1.1           Offers and deliveries of Jedox AG (“Jedox”) relating to the sale of perpetual licenses of Standard Software and/ or Jedox Software Content (in the following “Software”), present or future, made in relation to the persons or entities listed in clause 1.3 herein take place solely on the basis of the present General Terms and Conditions of Business for the Sale of Software ("License Terms "). Jedox does not recognize any of General Terms and Conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than the License Terms of Jedox.

 

1.2           “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

1.3         These License Terms shall only apply to persons who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity ("entrepreneurs") at the conclusion of the agreement. They do not apply to natural persons who conclude the agreement for a purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity (“consumers”).

 

2.             Subject of Contract, Conclusion of Contract

 

2.1           The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly, the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2           The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

2.3           The content of any contractual relationship and the scope of delivery are governed solely by written confirmation of order of Jedox; however, in the event of a binding offer on part of Jedox and its acceptance within the specified period, the contractual relationship is governed by the written offer of Jedox. Collateral agreements, verbal statements given by any employees or agents as well as changes or amendments to confirmed contracts (including changes to the products) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing to be effective; such written confirmation provided via fax or email shall be sufficient.

 

3.             Product Descriptions, Offer and Quotation Documents, Reservation of Right to Make Modifications

 

3.1           Product descriptions on Jedox’s homepage, with test programs, in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not create any warranty as to quality, nature or description of any Jedox product.

 

3.2           Jedox reserves the right to ownership of and title over, copyrights and intellectual or industrial property rights (including the right to register any such rights) in all Jedox’s offer and quotation documents, in particular in test programs, illustrations and cost estimates. The documents listed above must be immediately returned to Jedox at Jedox’s request if an offer by Jedox is not accepted.

 

3.3           Jedox reserves the right to make technical changes and modifications, provided that the usual use of the products or such use provided for under the contract, is not significantly or detrimentally impaired and the customer may reasonably be expected to accept such changes.

 

II. Conditions for the sale of Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content

 

4.             Delivery Period

 

4.1           Delivery periods are only binding if Jedox expressly confirmed them in writing.

 

4.2           Delivery of Jedox software (= provision of service) is handled through electronic transmission of the license key to the email address provided by customer on the order document (quotation). Alternatively, customer may request to receive license key by fax or letter. The respective, current version of Jedox standard software can be downloaded from Jedox’s website; the respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

4.3           In case of delay in delivery, the delivery period shall be duly extended in the event of force majeure and any and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after the conclusion of the contract and for which Jedox is not responsible, provided that such impediments have an effect on the provision of the service owed. This shall apply even if these delaying circumstances occur at upstream suppliers of Jedox. Jedox will inform the customer as soon as possible of any such impediments. If the impediment persists for longer than three months, or if it is established that it shall persist for longer than three months, Jedox as well as the customer may rescind the contract.

 

4.4           If Jedox is in default of delivery due to simple negligence, Jedox’s liability for damages due to the delay in delivery, which may be claimed in addition to the delivery, shall be limited to 0.75% of the value of the delivery for every full week of default, up to a maximum of 5% of the total value of the delivery. If the customer claims damages instead of the delivery in the said cases, this claim shall be limited to 15% of the total value of the delivery. The limitation of liability according to the above sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply in the event of default due to intent or gross negligence or in the event of injury to life, body or health or in the case of a transaction that depends on the compliance with a fixed date.

 

 

5.             Prices, Terms of Payment, Customer's Ability to Pay, Value Added Tax

 

5.1           Unless agreed otherwise, the prices shown in Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions plus statutory value added / sales tax and shipping costs apply.

 

5.2           Unless agreed otherwise, Jedox’s invoices shall be due for payment in full without deductions or set-offs within 30 days of the date of invoice. Payment is deemed to have been made from the point at which Jedox obtained unrestricted access to the amount ("Receipt of Payment").

 

5.3           Checks shall be accepted if agreed between the parties and shall be considered to be payment only once they have been unconditionally credited to Jedox. Any costs and expenses incurred thereby, in particular, bank, discount and other expenses, inclusive of any value added tax thereon, shall be paid by the customer and shall be immediately due for payment.

 

5.4           Set-offs or reductions of the amount payable for counter claims or retention of payment with the effect of a set-off by the customer is only permitted if the legal claims are recognised by Jedox, uncontested and due for decision by a court or recognized by force of law. This is not applicable if claims of customer are grounded on rectification of a defect or costs for completion of delivery.

 

5.5           From the commencement of the default, Jedox may demand interest of nine (9) % p.a. above the current base interest rate. The parties reserve the right to prove and claim that the damages actually incurred were significantly higher or lower. Jedox’s right to demand default interest amounting to four percentage points p.a. over the respective base interest rate, at least five (5) % p.a., from the due date in the case of a mutual commercial transaction remains unaffected.

 

5.6           If after the conclusion of the specific contract, it becomes apparent that the payment claim of Jedox will be endangered by the inability of customer to perform, Jedox shall be entitled to refuse its performance under the contract, including performance any preparatory acts. The right to refuse performance shall cease to exist once payment has been made or customer provides security for payment. Jedox can set a reasonable time limit for provision of such security. After expiration of such reasonable time limit, Jedox may rescind the contract.

 

5.7           For international deliveries within the European Union, customer shall furnish its VAT identification number which is used for income tax purposes in the importing country prior to the contractual delivery date. In the event that such VAT information is not provided or is provided incompletely, Jedox reserves the right to charge the applicable value-added tax to customer.

 

6.             Reservation of Ownership Rights

 

       The ownership of the products and the rights of customer shall pass to the customer only after payment in full of the purchase price as specified in clause 5.

 

II. Conditions for the allocation of Software

 

7.             Customer's Rights related to the Software

 

7.1         If Jedox delivers standard software to the customer against payment of a one-off charge for any length of time, the customer shall receive the non-exclusive right, unlimited in duration, to duplicate the software to the extent such duplication is necessary for loading, viewing, running, transferring or saving the software contemporaneously on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum number of users as agreed in the contract ("Agreed Use"). The customer agrees to abide by the provisions relating to Agreed Use and agrees not to make the software available to additional users. Special, separate licenses can be purchased for test, backup or development systems.

 

7.2         To the extent that the standard software transferred free of charge has been licensed as Open Source software, the rights and obligations of the customer shall be those provided in the Open Source license which the software is licensed under. The relevant Open Source license agreement is included in the software.

 

7.3         To the extent that the software transferred free of charge is not Open Source software ("Freeware"), the customer shall have the non-exclusive, non-transferable right, not limited in time, to duplicate the software to the extent necessary to load, demonstrate, run, transfer or save the software ("Agreed Use for Freeware"). The Customer shall only use the software according to this Agreed Use. The Customer is not permitted under any circumstances, without Jedox’s written consent, to sell the software or to transfer the software to third parties free of charge.

 

7.4         The customer has the right to decompile, edit or duplicate the software to the extent  that  this  is  necessary  to  establish  the interoperability of the software with other programs or to eliminate errors or bugs in the software. This applies, however, only where Jedox failed upon request to make the relevant, necessary information accessible to the customer within an appropriate time period. The customer is not entitled to decompile, translate, edit, arrange or rework the software in any other manner beyond the above authorization.

 

7.5         The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

 

7.6         In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

7.7         The operation of the software by third party businesses due to outsourcing requires Jedox’s prior consent.

 

7.8         The customer is not entitled to generate copies or partial copies of the software on other media. This does not apply to the generation of a backup copy. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the words "Backup Copy".

 

7.9         The customer is entitled to sell software purchased from Jedox to third parties only if:

 

a)             it fully gives up the use of the software and destroys any existing copies of the software;

 

b)            it notifies Jedox of the name and address of such third party; and

 

c)             such third party gives to Jedox its consent to be bound by these License Terms for Domestic Business Transactions in writing.

 

If the customer violates this clause, customer shall owe Jedox a contractual penalty of half the amount that the third party would have had to pay under Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions to obtain the software from Jedox, or half the purchase price agreed with the customer, whichever is greater.

 

7.10      The customer is not under any circumstances whatsoever entitled to permanently or temporarily rent, lease or otherwise make the software available to third parties. The customer's employees are not third parties for the purposes of this License Terms, as long as they use the software within their relationship of employment existing and according to the contract.

 

7.11      Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

7.12       The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

8.             Lack of Conformity of the Goods or Documentation with Contract, Notice of Defects, Limitation Period

 

8.1.    To the extent that Jedox transfers standard software, unlimited in time, against payment of a one-time fee, the following applies:

 

8.            1.1        The customer shall, if this is customary according to the ordinary business operations, inspect the product without delay and report any and all defects in writing, indicating the type and scope of the defect. The report must be received by Jedox within eight working days of the delivery in the case of obvious defects or within eight business days of the discovery in the case of concealed defects. If the report does not fulfil said requirements, the product will be deemed approved. If the customer does not indicate the defects without delay, the termination or withdrawal rights of the customer are excluded. The same applies for hidden defects if it is not indicated within eight (8) business days after delivery.

 

8.1.2       If, after the customer has given notice of lack of conformity, no actual lack of conformity of the product is found, the customer shall reimburse Jedox for the costs and expenses Jedox incurred in connection with the examination and inspection of the goods, provided that the unjustified report of defects is attributable to the fault of the customer.

 

8.1.3       Rights due to defects in quality can only arise if the product has a defect in quality at the time of transfer of risk. No rights due to defects in quality shall arise in the case of improper use or treatment of the product, unsuitable environment or operating conditions, defects caused by changes performed by the customer, insufficient maintenance, etc. If questions regarding the use of the delivered licenses occur, customer shall in particular consult the respective documentation or the information in the Jedox Knowledge Base (https://knowledgebase.jedox.com).

 

8.1.4       Subject to the provisions of clause 8.1.3, the customer may, at Jedox’s discretion, demand supplementary performance in the form of elimination of the defect (rectification) or delivery of a product without any defects (replacement). The expenses required for the supplementary performance shall be borne by the customer if they are higher due to the fact that the product has been transported to a location other than the delivery address of the customer, unless the transport corresponds to its intended use. If Jedox is unwilling or unable to provide rectification/replacement, especially if such is unduly delayed for reasons for which Jedox is responsible, the customer shall, at its own discretion, be entitled to rescind the contract or reduce the purchase price if it cannot be expected to accept further supplementary performance attempts. In the case of a minor defect, the rescission of the contract by the customer is subject to Jedox’s approval.

 

8.1.5       Once the customer exercises its right to rescind the contract, its right to use the licensed software shall end. In such case, the customer shall remove the software from all storage media and destroy all copies of the software and notify Jedox of this in writing.

 

8.1.6       Subject to sentence 2 of this paragraph, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is one year. In the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible and in cases of intent and gross negligence, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is two years.

 

8.1.7       Jedox’s liability for defects of the goods shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 10.

 

8.2         Test programs or software provided by Jedox on a temporary basis and free of charge are considered to be on loan, and in particular liability and liability for faulty product are governed by the legal provisions related to lent goods.

 

8.3         In case of the granting of the use of software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.2 and 7.3, the rights of the customer with regards to defects of the product as such are determined in accordance with the legal provisions regulating gifts.

 

9.            Legal defects

 

9.1           In as far as Jedox transfers Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

9.1.1       If the product is encumbered by a legal defect, the customer may demand a method of using the product that is not subject to any legal objection or provision of an equivalent product free of such defects. Jedox retains the right to determine which alternative product this may be.

 

9.1.2       The customer agrees to notify Jedox without delay and in writing if any third parties assert industrial or intellectual property rights (e.g. copyright or patent rights) in the product against customer. The customer authorises Jedox to pursue the dispute with the third party on behalf of customer. For as long as Jedox makes use of such authorisation, the customer shall not be permitted to acknowledge any such third party claims without the consent   of Jedox; Jedox shall defend against such third party claims at its own expense and indemnify the customer in relation to all costs arising from such defense to the extent that such cost do not arise from of the customer’s breach of obligations (e.g. use of the product in violation of the contract).

 

9.1.3       For damages resulting from legal defects of the products, the liability of Jedox shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 10.

 

9.2           In case of the granting of the software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.1.2 and 7.1.3, the rights of the customer with regards to legal defects are determined in accordance with the legal provisions regulating gifts.

 

10.         Limitation of Liability

 

10.1        In as far as Jedox transfers Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

10.1.1     Jedox shall be liable in accordance with the regulations of the German Product Liability Act (ProdHaftG) and in cases of inability and impossibility for which Jedox is responsible. Moreover, Jedox shall be liable for damages according to the statutory provisions in cases of intent, gross negligence, if Jedox provided a guarantee and in the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible. Apart from this, if Jedox, through simple negligence, breaches a duty whose fulfilment is essential to the proper performance of the contract and on whose fulfilment the customer may rely or a duty whose breach endangers the achievement of the purpose of the contract, Jedox’s compensation duty shall be limited to the typical foreseeable damage; clause 4.3 concerning the limitation of liability in the event of late delivery remains unaffected. In all other cases of liability, compensation claims due to the breach of a duty from an obligation and due to tort are excluded, so that Jedox is not liable for lost profit or other monetary damage incurred by the customer.

 

10.1.2     If the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’s liability in cases of simple negligence shall be limited to the recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

10.1.3     If Jedox’s liability is excluded or limited due to the aforesaid provision, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

10.2        In case of a transfer of software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.2 and 7.3, Jedox is only liable for intent or gross negligence.

 

11.     Limitation Period

Subject to sentence 3 all liability claims against Jedox expire by limitation after one year. The time limit for the liability limitation commences on the date specified in section 199 subsection 1 of the German Civil Code (BGB). The regulations specified in sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply to Jedox's liability on account of malicious intent and gross negligence, injury to life, body and health for which Jedox is responsible, as well as on account of simple, negligent violation of cardinal obligations, bodily injury and as a result of a warranty.

 

 

 

III.   Concluding Provisions

 

12.       Compliance Audit of Contract Terms

12.1      Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox shall in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license agreements and terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) business days before such an inspection unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

12.2      If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually.

 

 

 

13.       Confidentiality

 

13.1         The parties hereto each undertake to treat in strict confidence all items (e.g. software, documentation, information) received from or that become known via the other party before the conclusion of or in the performance of the contract and that are protected by law, that include business or operational secrets or that are described as being confidential - during and beyond the term of the contract for five (5) more years - unless they become known to the public without infringement of the duty to maintain confidentiality. The parties shall keep and safeguard all such items such that third parties are completely denied access to them.

 

13.2         The customer agrees that it shall make the contractual products available only to those of its employees and other third parties that require such access to perform their respective tasks. The customer agrees to instruct such persons on the need to maintain secrecy and confidentiality with respect to such items.

 

13.3         Jedox shall process customer's data required for the transaction in accordance with any pertinent data protection laws and regulations. Following successful provision of the services, we shall be entitled to cite the customer as a reference customer.

 

 

 

14    Place of Performance, Jurisdiction, Governing Law

 

14.1         Unless specifically agreed otherwise, the place of performance is Freiburg i. Breisgau, Germany.

 

14.2         These License Terms for Domestic Business Transactions and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer shall be governed by the law of the Federal Republic of Germany, under exclusion of the UN Convention on the International Sale of Goods (CISG).

 

14.3         If the English legal meaning differs from the German legal meaning of this agreement and its terms, the German meaning shall prevail. If the customer is a merchant as defined in the German Commercial Code (HGB), a legal entity under public law, or a fund under public law, the location of the registered office of Jedox shall be the venue for all rights and obligations of the contracting parties from all types of transactions, including actions on bills of exchange and checks. The same shall apply if the customer does not have any general domestic venue (in the Federal Republic of Germany), if they relocate their domicile or place of residence abroad (outside of the Federal Republic of Germany) after the conclusion of the contract, or if their domicile or place of residence is not known when the charges are filed

 

 

 

E

 

General terms and conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of standard software of Jedox AG with domicile in D-79098 Freiburg, Germany ("Jedox“ or "we“)

(As of: December 2017)

 

 

I.    Introductory provisions

 

1.   General, Definitions, scope of application

 

1.1   Our offers and deliveries to, and other services concerning the provision of subscription licenses of the Standard Software and/ or Jedox Software Content (hereinafter “Software”)  - including future ones  - for persons specified in subsection 1.2 are exclusively performed on the basis of the following general terms and conditions ("On-Premises Subscription General terms and conditions“). Conflicting terms and conditions, or alternative terms and conditions of the customer not included in our license agreement will not be accepted.

 

1.2   Our on-premises Subscription general terms and conditions apply only        to persons who, upon conclusion of the agreement act in the course of their trade, business or profession ("entrepreneurs“) and, in the event of a domestic business transaction, to domestic legal entities under public law or a domestic separate fund under public law. They shall not apply to natural persons concluding the agreement for purposes that cannot be attributed to their trade, business or profession ("consumers “).

 

1.3   “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

1.4   Our on-premises Subscription general terms and conditions apply to the on-premises use (see subsection II below) of Jedox standard software. The provision of services provided to entrepreneurs (cf. subsection 1.2) shall be governed by an additional agreement and shall be based on the “General Terms and Conditions of Business for the Provision of Services in Domestic Business Transactions/ transactions abroad of Jedox AG Registered Office in 79098 Freiburg”.

 

2.   Object of agreement, conclusion of agreement

 

2.1 The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2 The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

 

2.3 We make the software specified in the order confirmation or offer available to the customer for the use on his own hardware or for the use on his external platform for the duration of the agreement against payment for his own business. We perform support services as contractually agreed and defined in the "General terms and conditions for software support agreements" in domestic and foreign business transactions of Jedox AG with domicile in D-79098 Freiburg, Germany“ ("Support terms“); warranty rights of the customer according to subsection 8 shall remain unaffected; the installation, operation and maintenance of the software however remain under the sole responsibility of the customer.

 

2.4 The specifications and information given in the product catalogues and on our homepage shall only be legally binding if the agreement expressly refers to them.

 

2.5 Solely relevant for the content of the contractual relationship as well as the scope of both delivery and performance shall be our binding offer after its timely acceptance. Collateral agreements, verbal statements by employees or representatives as well as changes of confirmed orders (including changes to delivery items) require our written confirmation to be effective; it may be communicated by fax or electronic media.

 

3.   Product descriptions, offer documents, reservation of right of modification

 

3.1 Product descriptions on our homepage based on test programs, in catalogues, brochures etc. are no quality guarantees.

 

3.2 As far as its offer documents, in particular test programs, illustrations and quotes are concerned Jedox reserves all proprietary rights, copyrights and industrial property rights (including the right to register these rights). The aforementioned documents shall upon request be immediately returned to Jedox if our offer is not accepted.

 

3.3 Jedox reserves the right to technical changes provided that the customary use of the contractual object or its use as agreed is not materially and adversely affected and the changes are not unreasonable for the customer.

 

4.   Delivery, delivery period, delay in acceptance

 

4.1 After conclusion of the agreement we will make the software available to the customer via download (On- Premises Subscription) or integrated in an external Cloud (Subscription as a Service). The respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

4.2 The delivery period is reasonably extended - even within a delay - in the event of force majeure and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after conclusion of the agreement for which Jedox is not responsible insofar as these impediments have a demonstrable effect on the fulfillment of the contractually agreed performance. This also applies if said circumstances occur at preliminary suppliers. Jedox will inform the customer about the beginning and end of such impediments as soon as possible. In case that the impediment lasts for more than three months or if it is certain that it will last for more than three months both the customer and Jedox may withdraw from the agreement.

 

II. Provisions for the on-premises subscription use

 

5.     Rights and duties of customer

5.1   The customer receives the non-exclusive, non-transferrable, non-sublicensable temporary right limited to the duration of the agreement to use the Jedox software, as well as the right to duplicate it to the extent required for the installation, loading, display, and operation or storage of the software on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum contractually agreed number of users (intended use). The customer shall use the software only as intended and will not make the software available to additional users. Special, separate licenses can be agreed upon or purchased for test, backup or development systems. Sections 69d subsection 1 and subsection 3 of the German Copyright Act (UrhG) shall remain unaffected. The customer is not entitled to be provided with, or use, the source code of the software.

 

5.2   The customer is not entitled to decompile the software unless it is permissible according to section 69e of the German Copyright Act (UrhG). The customer is in addition not entitled to edit, translate, rework or duplicate the software unless this is required for the intended use, in particular to remedy a defect of the software. This shall however only apply on condition that we have not made the information required for this available to the customer upon request within a reasonable period of time, or if we are in arrears in remedying the defect, reject the rectification unjustifiably  or are incapable to remedy the defect for reasons outside our responsibility. The customer may not commission third parties with the aforesaid measures who are competitors of Jedox unless he proves that the danger of disclosure of operation and trade secrets is excluded.

 

5.3   The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

 

5.4   In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software, Software Content or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

5.5   Third-party operation of the software by way of outsourcing requires our permission.

 

5.6   The customer is not entitled to make copies or partial copies of the software on another data storage device. This does not apply to the making of a backup copy. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the note "backup copy".

 

5.7   The customer is not entitled to transfer the software provided to him to third parties, or to transfer copies of the software to third parties. The customer is in particular not permitted to sell, rent or otherwise sublicense the software, or to display or disclose it to the public unless it is absolutely necessary for the intended use, operation and maintenance of the software.

 

5.8   In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions all rights of use granted in connection with the on-premises subscription use agreement shall immediately become ineffective and automatically revert to us. In this case the customer is obliged to immediately and completely terminate the use of the software, to delete all copies installed on his systems as well as to delete or return all backup copies to us which he may have made.

 

5.9   The customer has to ensure that the system requirements are met.

 

5.10 The customer is obliged to inform us upon request about the number, data storage device and the repository of all copies (e.g. backup copies) the customer has received.

 

5.11 The customer shall also be obliged to save all data including the external data files (e.g. data bases and configuration data) appropriately to the level of risk, at least once a day and to store them in a place that corresponds to security standards customary in the trade to which neither the software transferred by us nor other components of the server systems used by the customer have writen access.

 

5.12 Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

5.13     The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

6.     Remuneration, due date, default in payment, turnover tax for foreign deliveries

6.1   Unless otherwise agreed the remuneration for the granted use during the minimum term is computed on the basis of the current version of our list of prices and conditions plus turnover tax. After expiry of the minimum term and provided that a new agreement is concluded the remuneration listed in the current version of our list of prices and conditions shall apply for a one-year term plus turnover tax unless a new minimum term is agreed upon.

 

6.2   Unless otherwise agreed the remuneration for the agreed minimum term is due in advance on the third working day of the agreed minimum term. After expiry of the agreed minimum term, and unless the agreement is terminated, the remuneration for each subsequent 12-months period shall always be due in advance on the third working day of each 12-months period.

 

6.3   Upon default interest in arrears to the amount of nine percent per year above the relevant base rate may be charged. The contractual parties are free to furnish proof of a higher or a substantially lower damage. Our right to already charge default interest to the amount of five (5) percent upon default in a reciprocal trade transaction shall remain unaffected.

 

6.4.   Checks will only be accepted after a corresponding arrangement between the parties and are considered a valid payment only after the amount has been credited without reservation. All costs arising thereof, in particular bank, discount and other charges plus V.A.T. must be borne by the customer and are due without delay.

 

6.7   Any offsetting or retention of payment with the effect of an offsetting is only permitted when counterclaims by the customer have been acknowledged by Jedox, are undisputed, ready for a decision or have become res judicata.

 

6.8   In case of foreign deliveries to countries within the European Union the customer is obliged to communicate his V.A.T. identification number in good time prior to the delivery date agreed under contract as evidence of their obligation to purchase taxation in the importing country. In the event that this information is not furnished in time and in full Jedox reserves the right to charge the applicable V.A.T.

 

7.     Term and notice of termination

7.1   The term of the agreement is subject to the period stipulated in the offer (hereinafter "minimum term"). In the event that no minimum term has been agreed upon a minimum term of twelve (12) months shall apply. Afterwards the on-premises subscription use agreement is automatically extended by the minimum term period, however by no more than 24 months ("extension period"), unless it is terminated by one of the parties to the agreement within a period of ninety (90) days at the end of a minimum term or extension period.

 

7.2   The on-premises subscription use agreement can in addition be terminated in writing by any of the parties without observance of a notice period for material breach. For the purposes of the agreement, a material breach entitling Jedox to immediately terminate the agreement without judicial formality and without prejudice to any damages, exists in particular if the customer violates rights of Jedox by using the software beyond the scope agreed upon in the agreement and does not stop the violation within a reasonable period after a warning notice by Jedox.

 

7.3   Notice of termination must be made in writing.

 

7.4   The right of the customer to use the software expires upon termination of the agreement. In this case the customer is obliged to remove the software from all storage devices, to delete all copies of the software, as well as to send us a signed deletion notice.

 

8.     Maintenance, warranty

8.1   We warrant that the contractually agreed quality of the software is maintained over the duration of the on-premises subscription use agreement and that no third-party rights conflict with the contractual use of the software.  We shall remedy defects in quality and defects in title that may arise within a reasonable time period after receipt of the customer's notice of defects.

 

8.2   The customer must immediately notify us in writing in the event that software defects have been discovered. In the case of quality defects time and circumstances of the occurrence of the defects must be indicated.

 

8.3   If, within eight working days, the customer does not notify us of defects that are known to him or obvious the customer's rights to a reduction of the remuneration or to terminate the agreement on the basis of the defects are excluded.

 

8.4   Warranty rights of the customer are excluded if the customer makes changes to, or commissions any third party to make change in the software without our consent unless the customer provides evidence that the changes have consequences for the analysis and removal of the defect which are acceptable for us and did not cause the defect. Customer rights due to defects shall remain unaffected provided that the customer is entitled to make changes, in particular in exercising the right to correct defects on his own consent, that the changes are adequate and appropriate, and they are traceably documented.

 

8.5   We are entitled but not obliged to continuously develop the software and to make additional features or extensions of the software available to the customer by way of updates. We are entitled to adjust the technical requirements correspondingly. Prior to the installation of updates the customer has to make sure that his systems meet the updated system requirements.

 

8.6   We will make our best effort to inform the customer prior to the provision of updates, whose installation is required for a smooth operation of the software, about the update, system requirements and the date of the provision. The customer is obliged to install updates himself within a period of four weeks from the provision of the update. This may also require an update of the required third-party software including the operating system. Jedox undertakes to inform the customer accordingly.

 

8.7   The support agreed in accordance with the support terms and conditions pursuant to subsection 2.2 of these on-premises subscription terms does not restrict the warranty rights of customer according to this subsection 8.

 

9.     Limitation of liability

 

9.1   We are liable in accordance with the regulations of the German Product Liability Act as well as in cases of culpable incapacity and culpable impossibility. Jedox shall in addition be liable for damages according to the legal provisions in cases of malicious intent, gross negligence, acceptance of a warranty, as well as injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible. If Jedox otherwise  violates an obligation due to simple negligence whose fulfillment is a prerequisite for the proper execution of the agreement and the compliance to which the customer regularly trusts and can trust, or an obligation whose violation puts the achievement of the contractual purpose at risk, the obligation to pay compensation of Jedox shall be limited to the foreseeable damage which is typical for the agreement. In all other cases of liability claims for damages due to the violation of contractual obligations and through impermissible acts are excluded, as a result of which Jedox shall not be liable for loss of profit or other financial losses of the customer.

 

9.2   In the event of a data loss Jedox's liability in cases of simple negligence shall be limited to the expense for a recovery using existing data backups. If the customer uses an external Cloud provider, Jedox shall in no event be liable for a data loss caused by the provider.

 

9.3   Insofar as the liability of Jedox is excluded or limited due to the aforementioned provisions this also applies to the personal liability of office employees, factory workforce, staff members, legal representatives and agents.

 

10.   Limitation period

 

        Subject to sentence 3 all liability claims against Jedox expire by limitation after one year. The time limit for the liability limitation commences on the date specified in section 199 subsection 1 of the German Civil Code (BGB). The regulations specified in sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply to Jedox's liability on account of malicious intent and gross negligence, injury to life, body and health for which Jedox is responsible, as well as on account of simple, negligent violation of cardinal obligations, bodily injury and as a result of a warranty.

 

11.  Advice and support for the installation or implementation of the Software

 

11.1 In connection with the on-premises subscription use of the Software we provide consulting and support services during the installation or implementation process as required by the customer. The customer commissions Jedox for these services in the form of performance days, see clause 1.3.

 

11.2 The customer undertakes to support us in providing our consulting and support services by adequate cooperation. The customer shall in particular inform us in writing or by sending us a corresponding text on his own accord on the features of his IT systems which must be observed in the performance of support services and to take organizational security measures to prevent loss of data, system failures and other impediments of his systems due to our support services.

 

 

III.    Final provisions

 

12.   Right to audit regarding observance of contractual conditions

 

12.1 Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox shall in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license agreements and terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) working  days before such an inspection unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours  of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

12.2 If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually.

 

13.   Confidentiality

 

13.1 The contractual parties undertake to treat all items received or disclosed by the other contractual partner (e.g. software, documents and information) that are legally protected or contain business or trade secrets as confidential even after the termination of the agreement unless they become public knowledge without violation of the secrecy obligation. The contractual parties will store and secure these items in such a way that third parties access is excluded.

 

13.2 The customer will give only those employees and other third parties access to the delivered items who require such access in the performance of their service obligations. The customer shall instruct these persons on the necessity to treat the delivered items as confidential. The customer shall inform us without delay about any requests of disclosure by third-parties, judicial or administrative authorities in written or electronic form and support us in the effort to prevent that confidential information is disclosed.

 

13.3 We shall process the data of the customer required in the business transaction in compliance with the relevant data protection regulations. We may cite the name of the customer along with the full company name and his logo on our marketing materials (including Websites) as a reference customer.

 

13.4 Except for subsection 18.3 the aforementioned regulations do not provide any basis for intellectual property rights of. All rights of use granted under this agreement shall remain unaffected by the above-mentioned regulations.

 

13.5 The obligation to maintain secrecy shall remain in force for another five years after termination of the agreement.

 

14.   Place of fulfillment, applicable law, place of jurisdiction, supremacy clause

 

14.1 Unless otherwise agreed the place of fulfillment shall be  the company domicile of Jedox in Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany.

 

14.2 The law of the Federal Republic of Germany shall apply for these on- premises subscription terms and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer. Any collision rules as well as the UN Convention on the Sale of Goods (CISG) are excluded.

 

14.3 Insofar as the customer is a businessperson in the meaning of the German Commercial Code, a legal person subject to public law or special public law fund, the exclusive place of jurisdiction for all rights and obligations of the contractual parties from any kind of business - including disputes over bills of exchange and checks - shall be the company domicile of Jedox. The same applies if the customer does not have a general place of jurisdiction domestically (Federal Republic of Germany), relocates his domicile or usual place of residence (outside  the Federal Republic of Germany) after conclusion of the agreement, or if his residence or usual place of residence is not known at the time proceedings are instituted. We are however also entitled to institute legal proceedings against the customer at his general place of jurisdiction.

 

14.4 In the event of inconsistencies between these on-premises subscription terms and conditions and the support terms and conditions the provisions of the on-premises subscription terms and conditions shall have priority.

 

15.   Escape clause

 

            These on-premises subscription terms and conditions can be changed between the customer and Jedox by way of a corresponding arrangement as follows: Jedox sends the customer the changed terms before they shall take effect in writing (e.g. via e-mail) and separately informs the customer about the new regulations as well as the date when they are to take effect. Jedox will at the same time grant the customer a reasonable, at least four-week deadline to declare if he accepts the changed conditions for a further use of the contractual services. In the event that no declaration is made within this time period which commences with the receipt of the written notification the changed conditions are deemed to be accepted. At the beginning of the time period Jedox will separately inform the customer about the legal consequences of his actions or inactions, i.e. the right to object, the time limit for filing an objection, and the legal effect of his silence.

 

 

 

F

 

General terms and conditions for the use of standard software over the internet with “Jedox Cloud” (“Software as a Service”, abbreviated “SaaS”) of Jedox AG domiciled in D-79098 Freiburg, Germany (“Jedox” or “we”)

(As of: December 2017)

 

I. Introductory provisions

 

1.             General, scope of application

 

1.1               Offers and deliveries to, and other services against payment for entrepreneurs (cf. subsection 1.2) - including future ones - related to the use of software of Jedox AG (hereinafter "Jedox") in the context of the "Jedox Cloud" are exclusively performed on the basis of these general terms and conditions for the use of standard software over the internet („Software as a Service “, abbreviated "SaaS“) (hereinafter "SaaS terms“). Conflicting terms and conditions, or alternative terms and conditions of the customer not included in these SaaS terms, will not be accepted. 

 

1.2                The SaaS terms shall apply only to persons who, upon conclusion of the agreement, act in the course of their trade, business or profession ("entrepreneurs"), and in the event of a domestic business transaction to domestic legal entities under public law or a domestic separate fund under public law. They do not apply to natural persons concluding the agreement for purposes that cannot be attributed to their trade, business or profession ("consumers").

 

2.             Object of agreement, conclusion of agreement

 

2.1                We offer the customer the possibility to use the software specified in the order confirmation or offer over the internet against payment for the duration of the agreement („Software as a Service “). If agreed we shall also perform support services especially in relation to  the commissioning/ implementing of the software and as stipulated in the "General terms and conditions for software support agreements in domestic and international business transactions of Jedox AG" with headquarters in D-79098 Freiburg“ („Support terms“). The surrender of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement.

 

2.2                The availability of the software is governed by subsection 9 of the SaaS terms.

 

2.3                We furthermore offer the customer the possibility to use “Software Content” which means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

2.4                The provision of Software Content is regulated in the General Terms and Conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of standard software of Jedox AG.

 

2.5                The specifications and information given in the product catalogues and on the homepage operated by Jedox shall only be legally binding parts if the agreement expressly refers to them.

 

2.6                The contractual relationship between the parties shall be governed by the accepted offer and the SaaS Terms. Collateral agreements, verbal statements by employees or representatives, as well as changes of confirmed orders (including changes to delivery items) require written confirmation by Jedox to be effective (e.g. electronic transmission).

 

3.             Product descriptions

 

3.1                Product descriptions on the Jedox homepage or in catalogues, brochures etc. are no quality guarantees.

 

3.2                As far as Jedox offer documents, in particular test programs, illustrations and quotations, are concerned Jedox reserves all proprietary rights, copyrights and industrial property rights (including the right to register these rights). The aforementioned documents shall upon request be immediately returned to Jedox if an offer is not accepted.

 

3.3                Jedox reserves the right to technical changes provided that the customary use of the contractual object or its use as agreed is not materially and adversely affected and that the changes are not unreasonable for the customer.

 

4.            Delivery, delivery period and delay in acceptance

 

4.1                Jedox makes the software available for use by the customer by sending the customer the required access data for identification and authorization via e-mail.

 

4.2                The delivery period is reasonably extended - even in the event of a delay - in case of force majeure and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after the conclusion of the agreement for which Jedox is not responsible insofar as such impediments have a demonstrable effect on the fulfillment of the contractually agreed performance. This also applies if said circumstances occur at preliminary suppliers. Jedox will inform the customer about the beginning and end of such impediments as soon as possible. In case that the impediment lasts for more than three months or if it is certain that it will last longer than three months both customer and Jedox may withdraw from the agreement.

 

5.            Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise the prices listed in the current list of prices and conditions of Jedox shall apply plus V.A.T. as required by law as well as forwarding expenses.

 

6.             Terms of payment, creditworthiness

 

6.1                Jedox executes the invoicing annually and in advance for the respective subsequent 12-months' period.

 

6.2                Unless otherwise agreed invoices are due for payment 30 days from the date of the invoice without any deductions. Payments will be considered as made when Jedox can dispose of the entire amount without recourse (receipt of payment).

 

6.3                Checks will only be accepted after a corresponding arrangement between the parties and are considered a valid payment only after the amount has been credited without reservations. All costs arising thereof, in particular bank, discount and other charges plus V.A.T. must be borne by the customer and are due without delay.

 

6.4                Any offsetting or retention of payment with the effect of an offsetting is only permitted when the counterclaims by the customer have been acknowledged by Jedox, are undisputed, ready for a decision or have become res judicata.

 

6.5                Upon default of payment default interest to the amount of nine (9) percent per year above the relevant base interest rate can be charged. The contractual parties are at liberty to provide evidence of a higher or of a substantially lower actual damage. Our right to already charge default interest to the amount of five (5) percent upon default in a reciprocal trade transaction shall remain unaffected.

 

 

6.6                In the event that it becomes apparent after conclusion of the agreement that the payment claim of Jedox is at risk due to a lack of solvency on the part of the customer Jedox is entitled to refuse performance and performance preparation activities. The right to refuse performance expires if the payment has been effected or security has been provided for such payment. Jedox can grant the customer a reasonable time limit for the payment or the provision of a security. If Jedox does not receive any payment or security after expiry of this time limit, Jedox is entitled to terminate the agreement.

 

6.7                In case of foreign deliveries to countries within the European Union the customer is obliged to communicate his V.A.T identification number in good time prior to the delivery date agreed under contract as evidence of their obligation to purchase taxation in the importing country. In the event that this information is not furnished in time and in full Jedox reserves the right to charge V.A.T. as applicable.

 

 

II.    Terms for the use of standard software as SaaS against payment

 

7.             Rights of customer, use

 

7.1                The customer receives the non-exclusive, non-transferrable, non-sublicensable temporary right limited to the duration of the agreement to use the Jedox software as defined in the offer by remote access over the internet. The software is not assigned to the customer. The customer is entitled use the software for his purposes, to process and store his data.

 

7.2                The customer is not entitled to any further rights, e.g. to change or duplicate the software and/or to use the software for purposes not mentioned in this agreement. The customer is not permitted to reverse engineer, decompile, copy, disassemble, duplicate the software, or use any part of the software to generate a separate application. In addition, the customer is not allowed to generate any other derivative work on the basis of the software, in particular a rival product or service, or to copy features, functions or graphics.
