7.3                Furthermore, the customer is not entitled to distribute, sell, rent, sublicense, license the rights granted under this agreement or to make them otherwise available to third parties unless it is a named user. The term named user refers to all persons named by the customer upon conclusion of the agreement for the use of contractual services.

 

7.4                In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

 

7.5                In the event that the contractual use of the software is impaired by third-party property rights without the fault of Jedox the latter is entitled to refuse performances that are affected by these. Jedox shall immediately inform the concerned customer and will find a suitable way to give the customer access to its data. In this case the customer is not obliged to pay for the non-performance. Other claims or rights shall remain unaffected.

 

7.6                The router output to the internet of the data center used by Jedox is the transfer point for contractual services.

 

7.7                The software, the computer performance required for the use over the internet, as well as the storage capacity for data required for the use over the internet (RAM and HD) will be made available by Jedox or by one of the subcontractors commissioned by Jedox. The individual performance ratings depend on each Customer offer.

 

7.8                Jedox transfers the access data for identification and authorization to the customer that is required for the use of the software. The customer is not permitted to transfer the access data to third parties unless it is a user who was named to Jedox and taken into account in the calculation of the fee. The customer shall be responsible for all activities ensuing from the unauthorized use of access data. In the event that such unauthorized use by third parties has occurred or is suspected the customer shall immediately inform Jedox by sending an e-mail to legal@jedox.com. New additional users will be reported to Jedox before they start their activities so that the user fee can be adjusted accordingly.

 

7.9                Customer access to the internet is not subject of the contract. The good working order of the internet access, including transmission lines as well as his own computer, remains under the sole responsibility of the customer.

 

7.10             The recording, processing and use of data entered by the customer while using the software remains under the sole responsibility of the customer.

 

7.11             Trademark rights, copyrights and trade secret and/or other intellectual property rights of Jedox remain the property of Jedox. The customer shall immediately notify Jedox in the event that third parties assert industrial property rights in relation to the software against him.

 

7.12            Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

7.13             The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

 

8.             Obligations of customer

 

8.1                The customer shall use the software, as well as the provided storage and computing capacity, only in accordance with the SaaS terms. The installation of other software is not permitted. The same applies to the storage of data that is not directly connected with the use of the contractual software.

 

8.2                The customer is required to adequately support Jedox in the performance of the service.

 

8.3                The customer is obliged to observe the customary and recognized safety standards. This also includes regular data backups by the customer on media of his own, data protection with reasonable technical and economic effort against interference from unauthorized persons, as well as the use of the latest anti-virus programs. In any case backups must be made prior to changes carried out by the customer as well as prior to maintenance works which will be announced in advance by Jedox.

 

8.4                The customer will protect all data against any third-party access. Codes and passwords must be changed prior to their first use as well as in regular intervals. Codes and passwords must be changed immediately if there is a reason or cause to suspect that third parties have accessed them.

 

8.5                The customer guarantees that the information transferred to Jedox by him is true and up to date at all times. The customer is obliged to update information immediately in the event of any changes to ensure a trouble-free use.

 

8.6                The customer is obliged to verify in advance that the contractual services correspond to the contractual requirements. If that is not the case Jedox must be notified without delay. In this case the customer must communicate all relevant information to Jedox. In addition, the customer shall also take care that his hardware and software, as well as internet connection, fulfill the minimum requirements for the contractual use of contractual services. The customer must observe all requirements set by Jedox in relation to the contractual services.

 

8.7                The use of the software outside the Federal Republic of Germany may under certain conditions be restricted by other national legal provisions. The customer is obliged to comply with such provisions and bears all costs that may arise in connection with the use of the software, such as customs duties, taxes, or other dues or fees.

 

8.8                In the event of serious violations against customer duties Jedox shall be entitled to block the account of the customer at his expense. This does not release the customer from his payment obligations against Jedox.

 

8.9       Additional costs and disadvantages resulting from the violation of the duties mentioned above must be borne by the customer.

 

9.             Availability

 

9.1                Unless otherwise explicitly agreed by the parties, the contractual services will be available ninety eight percent (99 %) of the time, based on an annual approach.

 

9.2                Failures as well as impairments of the availability rate and/or the provision during a regular maintenance period and/or during maintenance and support, installation or realization works scheduled with the customer, as well as during disconnections or shutdowns scheduled with the customer during such times shall not be deemed as unavailability within the meaning of subsection 9.1 above.

 

9.3                Periods during which contractual services are not, or are not in parts or fully, available due to technical or other circumstances that are outside the sphere of influence of Jedox (e.g. force majeure, malfunctioning in the telecommunication lines, or third-party faults) shall not be deemed unavailability within the meaning of subsection 9.1 above.

 

9.4                Likewise, periods during which Jedox temporarily limits the availability of contractual services due to

 

•                     an urgent threat of the data, the hard and/or software infrastructure or the data, the hard and/or software infrastructure of the customer because of external hazards (e.g. viruses, port-hacking, attacks by Trojans), or

 

•                     a substantial threat to the security of network operation or the maintenance of network integrity

 

are not to be deemed as unavailability within the meaning of subsection 9.1 above.

 

9.5                Jedox will during the unavailability time, also within the meaning of subsections 9.2-9.4, take the legitimate interests of the customer into account as far as possible. Whenever possible the customer will be informed by Jedox without delay. Jedox shall make every reasonable effort to restore availability.

 

9.6                Unless otherwise expressly agreed between the parties the responsibility of Jedox for the components required in the provision of contractual services (Jedox Cloud) ends at the router outlet of the data center used by Jedox.

 

9.7                The customer shall immediately notify Jedox of any disturbances in availability. If the disturbance is real, the availability shall be deemed impaired only from the time of notification. No disturbances in the aforementioned sense are impairments of data transmission caused by the local IT system of the customer or by a disturbance in the connection of the customer to the agreed transfer point (e.g. line failure or line fault of other providers or telecommunication companies).

 

10.           Defects

 

10.1             Liability without fault for defects that were already present upon conclusion of the agreement is excluded.

 

10.2             A defect shall be deemed to exist if the suitability for contractual use is nullified or not insignificantly reduced. The contractual use is conclusively defined by any agreed specifications. In the event that the suitability for contractual use is nullified the customer shall be exempted from payment of the remuneration until the defect is remedied. In case of a partial unsuitability the remuneration is reduced to a reasonable amount until the defect is remedied.

 

10.3             The customer undertakes to immediately inform Jedox in writing (E-Mail is sufficient) in the event that defects of the software are found. In case of material defects this must be done by way of a detailed description of the time and the particular circumstances of the occurrence of the defect to allow Jedox to reproduce, analyze and remedy it.

 

10.4             If the customer does not immediately report defects that are known to him or that are obvious the customer's rights to reduce the agreed price or terminate the agreement for defects are excluded. The same applies to hidden defects unless they are reported to Jedox within eight working days from their discovery.

 

10.5             In the event that Jedox is unable to remedy the defect within a reasonable time period determined by the customer which allows for at least three attempts to remedy the defect, the customer shall be entitled to extraordinarily terminate the agreement.

 

10.6             If upon a notice of defects by the customer, there appears to be no defects of the software the customer shall compensate the costs accrued in connection with the examination provided that the unjustified notice of defects is the fault of the customer.

 

10.7             In case that a third-party asserts property rights regarding the contractual services against the customer Jedox will at its discretion and expenses either change or replace the contractual services so that the property rights claim is no longer against the customer.

 

10.8             The customer shall immediately notify Jedox if third parties assert property rights (e.g. copyrights or patent rights) to the contractual services against him. The customer authorizes Jedox to solely take legal action against the third party. As long as Jedox makes use of the authorization the customer may not acknowledge the claims of the third party without Jedox's consent; Jedox will then fend off the claims of the third party at its own expense and indemnify the customer of all costs associated with the defense against such claims unless these are based on faults attributable to the customer (e.g. use in violation of agreement).

 

10.9             Jedox shall only be liable for damages due to defects within the scope defined in subsections 11 and 12. This limitation does not apply if Jedox has fraudulently concealed a defect.

 

10.10         The support agreed in accordance with the support terms and conditions pursuant to subsection 2.1 of these SaaS terms does not restrict the warranty rights of the customer according to this subsection 10.

 

11.          Liability, disclaimer of liability

 

11.1            Jedox is liable according to the regulations of the German Product Liability Act as well as in cases of culpable incapacity and culpable impossibility. Jedox shall in addition be liable for damages according to the legal provisions in cases of malicious intent, gross negligence, acceptance of a warranty, as well as injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible. If Jedox otherwise  violates an obligation due to simple negligence whose fulfillment is a prerequisite for the proper execution of the agreement and the compliance to which the customer regularly trusts and can trust, or an obligation whose violation puts the achievement of the contractual purpose at risk (in total "cardinal contractual obligations“), the obligation to pay compensation of Jedox shall be limited to the foreseeable damage which is typical for the agreement; subsection 4.2 - liability limitation in the event of delay in delivery - shall remain unaffected. In all other cases of liability claims for damages due to the violation of contractual obligations and through impermissible acts are excluded, as a result of which Jedox shall not be liable for loss of profit or other financial losses of the customer.

 

11.2                  In the event of a data loss Jedox's liability in cases of simple negligence shall be limited to the expense for a restoration using existing data backups.

 

11.3                  Insofar as the liability of Jedox is excluded or limited due to the aforementioned provisions this also applies to the personal liability of office employees, factory workforce, staff members, legal representatives and agents.

 

12.          Limitation period

 

Subject to sentence 3 all liability claims against Jedox expire by limitation after one year. The time limit for the liability limitation commences on the date specified in section 199 subsection 1 of the German Civil Code (BGB). The regulations specified in sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply to Jedox's liability on account of malicious intent and gross negligence, injury to life, body and health for which Jedox is responsible, as well as on account of simple, negligent violation of cardinal obligations, a liability pursuant to the German Product Liability Act and as a result of a warranty.

13.          Data protection

 

13.1            Jedox's data protection practice shall be in accordance with the German Federal Data Security Act (Bundesdatenschutzgesetz, BDSG) as well as the German Telemedia Act (Telemediengesetz, TMG). From the 25.05.2018 onwards Jedox’s data protection practice shall also be in accordance with the European General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

 

13.2            The customer's data including personal data provided by the customer shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner and only be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes. Jedox adheres to the principles of data minimization, data accuracy, storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality, as regulated in the GDPR. The customer shall keep the data up to date and communicate all relevant changes to Jedox.

 

13.3            Jedox does not pass any personal data on to third parties with the exception of service provision partners, to the extent required to calculate the remuneration and for the settlement of accounts with the customer.

13.4            Jedox undertakes to ensure that access to customer data is restricted to technical support, cloud operations and consulting teams, and only if they directly require access to the data in order to fulfill Jedox’s obligations in accordance with this Agreement and the relevant data protection laws. Jedox shall ensure that the confidentiality obligations stipulated in this Agreement are enforced. 

 

 

13.5            The customer is entitled to obtain information about personal data, the rectification of inaccurate personal data, the erasure of personal data concerning him or her, restriction of processing as well as any other right regulated in the GDPR.

 

13.6            Under this agreement the customer is not entitled to store and process any personal data. An additional arrangement on data-protection compliant commissioning is therefore not necessary. In case however that the customer does store and process personal data in connection with this agreement the customer shall notify Jedox without delay and conclude a commissioned data processing contract prior to the actual processing or storage of such personal data.

 

14.          Content published, use of the software

 

14.1            The customer undertakes to designate content put on the internet as his own or third-party content, as well as to state his full name and address. Further obligations, in particular information obligations, may arise from the German Distance Selling Act (Fernabsatzrecht), the provisions of the German Telecommunications Act, as well as the German Telemedia Act. The customer is obligated to investigate on, and comply with, such obligations.

 

14.2             The customer undertakes not to publish content which violates third-party rights or statutory regulations. The customer is in particular not permitted to spread and/or put images, texts, graphics and links or other data or content online which violate legal regulations or third-party copyrights, intellectual property rights or any other third-party rights. Storage and/or disclosure to third parties of extremist content, or content which is against public policy or of texts or data depicting violence or contain pornographic, discriminatory, racist, defamatory or other illegal content or illustrations are not permitted. Jedox is entitled to block the customer account in case of violation of the above. The same shall apply if the customer discloses content to third parties which offends their honor, or insults or disparages persons or certain groups of people. The same applies even if an actual legal claim is not given. The customer bears the sole responsibility for data and content provided by him. Jedox does not examine the content for its correctness, or lack of viruses or to determine whether it is technically possible to examine it for viruses.

 

14.3            The customer is prohibited (a) under these SaaS terms to store or forward infringing, defamatory or other illegal and/or illicit content, (b) to use services and systems provided under this agreement to store or forward malicious codes or other sabotage programs,

(e)  to impair or disturb the integrity or performance capacity of the services and system provided under this agreement,

(f)    to use the services provided under this agreement to gain illicit access to systems or networks which are interconnected with these services, as well as

(e)   to send spam, mass e-mails or other unwanted messages in violation of applicable laws and regulations.

 

14.4            Jedox is entitled to block the customer's account in case of non-compliance. With a provision of these SaaS Terms.

 

15.           Remuneration, due date, default in payment

 

15.1            Unless otherwise agreed the remuneration for the use of the standard software in connection with the "Jedox Cloud“ during the minimum term is calculated in accordance with the list of prices and conditions of Jedox plus turnover tax. After expiry of the minimum term, provided that a new agreement is concluded and unless otherwise agreed, the remuneration shown in the relevant list of prices and conditions for the minimum term plus turnover tax shall apply unless a new minimum term is agreed upon.

 

15.2            Unless otherwise agreed the remuneration for the agreed minimum term is due in advance on the third working day of the agreed minimum term. After expiry of the agreed minimum term, and unless the agreement is terminated, the remuneration for the following term shall always be due in advance on the third working day of the respective term.

 

15.3             For the interest on arrears payable by the customer in case of default in payment subsection 6.4 above shall apply accordingly.

 

16.           Term and notice of termination

 

16.1             The term of the agreement is subject to the time period stated in the offer (hereinafter "minimum term“). After expiry of the minimum term the agreement is extended automatically for the period of the minimum term, however for no more than 24 months (hereinafter "extension period“), unless it is terminated in writing by one of the parties with a notice period of ninety days at the end of the minimum term or extension period. In the event that no minimum term is stated in the offer it is agreed that the minimum term is 12 months.

 

16.2             The contractual relationship commences with the transmission of the access data to the customer.

 

16.3             A right of termination of the customer on account of denial of use pursuant to section 543 subsection 2 sentence 1 no.1 of the German Civil Code (BGB) is excluded, unless the effort to bring the contractual services into conformity with the agreement must be deemed to have failed.

 

16.4             Section 545 of the German Civil Code (BGB) is excluded.

 

16.5             In addition the agreement can be terminated in writing by any of the parties without observance of a notice period for material breach. For the purposes of the agreement a material breach entitling Jedox to terminate the agreement exists in particular if the customer violates rights of Jedox by using the software beyond the scope agreed upon in the agreement and does not stop the violation within a reasonable period after a warning notice by Jedox, or if the customer does not pay an invoice despite reminder with appropriate deadline. For the customer a material breach can be a substantial undercutting of the agreed software availability which must be regularly be an undercutting of more than 10%.

 

16.6             Terminations must be made in writing.

 

16.7             With the termination of the agreement no matter for what legal reasons all rights granted under the agreement are void.

 

III.      Final provisions

 

17.           Subcontractors

 

Jedox shall be entitled to provide the contractual services by third parties acting as subcontractors provided that the subcontractors have the necessary skills to provide the contractual services.

 

18.           Confidentiality

 

18.1             The customer undertakes to maintain secrecy as to all confidential information made known to him during this contractual relationship and to refrain from using that knowledge in particular for his own business purposes. Confidential information under this agreement includes all information that is known only to a small group of persons, that is not obvious, that must be kept secret according to the (explicit or implied) will of Jedox, and in the secrecy of which Jedox has a legitimate or economic interest.

 

18.2             Secrecy does not extend to publicly available knowledge, or knowledge that has been or can be disclosed without violation of any secrecy obligation, that the customer may or must disclose due to a law or by order of governmental or judicial authorities, or that can be passed on without obvious disadvantages for the company.

 

18.3             The obligation to maintain secrecy shall remain in force for another five years after termination of the agreement.

 

 

19.           Reference customers

 

Jedox is entitled to cite the name of the customer along with the full company name and his logo on its marketing materials (including Websites) as a reference customer.

 

20.           Place of fulfillment, applicable law, place of jurisdiction, supremacy clause, escape clause

 

20.1             Unless otherwise agreed the place of fulfillment shall be  the company domicile of Jedox in Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany.

 

20.2             The law of the Federal Republic of Germany shall apply for these SaaS terms and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer. Any collision rules as well as the UN Convention on the Sale of Goods (CISG) are excluded.

 

20.3             Insofar as the customer is a businessperson in the meaning of the German Commercial Code, a legal person subject to public law or special public law fund, the exclusive place of jurisdiction for all rights and obligations of the contractual parties from any kind of business - including disputes over bills of exchange and checks - shall be the company domicile of Jedox. The same applies if the customer does not have a general place of jurisdiction domestically (Federal Republic of Germany), relocates his domicile or usual place of residence (outside  the Federal Republic of Germany) after conclusion of the agreement, or if his residence or usual place of residence is not known at the time proceedings are instituted.

 

20.4             In the event of inconsistencies between SaaS terms and support conditions the provisions of the SaaS terms shall have priority.

 

20.5             These SaaS terms can be changed between the customer and Jedox by way of a corresponding arrangement as follows: Jedox sends the customer the changed terms before they shall take effect in writing (e.g. via e-mail) and separately informs the customer about the new regulations as well as the date when they are to take effect. Jedox will at the same time grant the customer a reasonable, at least four-week deadline to declare whether he accepts the changed conditions for a further use of the contractual services. In the event that no declaration is made within this time period, which commences with the receipt of the written notification, the changed conditions are deemed to have been accepted. At the beginning of the time period Jedox will separately inform the customer about the legal consequences of his actions or inactions, i.e. the right to object, the time limit for filing an objection, and the legal effect of his silence.

 

 

 

G

General Terms and Conditions for the Sale of Standard Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content of Jedox France SAS

(as of December 2017)

 

I.              Introductory Provisions

 

1.             General, Definitions, Scope of Contract

 

1.1           Offers and deliveries of Jedox France SAS (“Jedox”) relating to the sale of perpetual licenses of Standard Software and/ or Jedox Software Content (in the following “Software”), present or future, made in relation to the persons or entities listed in clause 1.3 herein take place solely on the basis of the present General Terms and Conditions for the Sale of License of Software ("License Terms "). Jedox does not recognize any of General Terms and Conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than the License Terms of Standard Software of Jedox.

 

1.2           “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

 

1.3           These License Terms shall only apply to persons who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity ("Professionals") at the conclusion of the contract, as well as to legal entities under public law or a fund under public law. They do not apply to natural persons who conclude the contract for a purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity (“Consumers”).

 

2.             Purpose of Contract, Conclusion of Contract

 

2.1           The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly, the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2           The details and information given on Jedox’ homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

2.3           The content of any contractual relationship and the scope of delivery are governed solely by written confirmation of order of Jedox; however, in the event of a binding offer on part of Jedox and its acceptance within the specified period, the contractual relationship is governed by the written offer of Jedox. Collateral agreements, verbal statements given by any employees or agents as well as changes or amendments to confirmed contracts (including changes to the products) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing to be effective; such written confirmation provided via fax or email shall be sufficient.

 

3.             Product Descriptions, Offer and Quotation Documents, Reservation of Right to Make Modifications

 

3.1           Product descriptions on Jedox’ homepage, with test programs, in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not create any warranty as to quality, nature or description of any Jedox product.

 

3.2           Jedox reserves the right to ownership of and title over, copyrights and intellectual or industrial property rights (including the right to register any such rights) in all Jedox’ offer and quotation documents, in particular in test programs, illustrations and cost estimates. The documents listed above must be immediately returned to Jedox at Jedox’ request if an offer by Jedox is not accepted.

 

3.3           Test programs provided by Jedox on a temporary basis and free of charge are considered to be on loan, and in particular liability and liability for faulty product are governed by the legal provisions related to lend goods.

 

3.4           Jedox reserves the right to make technical changes and modifications, provided that the usual use of the products or such use provided under the contract is not significantly or detrimentally impaired and the customer may reasonably be expected to accept such changes.

 

II. Conditions for the sale of Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content

 

4.             Delivery Period

 

4.1           Delivery periods are only binding if Jedox expressly confirmed them in writing.

 

4.2           Delivery of Jedox software is handled through electronic transmission of the license key to the email address provided by customer on the order document (i.e. quotation). Alternatively, customer may request to receive license key by fax or letter. The respective, current version of Jedox standard software can be downloaded from Jedox’ website; the respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

4.3           In case of delay in delivery, the delivery period shall be duly extended in the event of force majeure and any and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after the conclusion of the contract and for which Jedox is not responsible, provided that such impediments have an effect on the provision of the service owed. This shall apply even if these delaying circumstances occur at upstream suppliers of Jedox. Jedox will inform the customer as soon as possible of any such impediments. If the impediment persists for longer than three months, or if it is established that it shall persist for longer than three months, Jedox, as well as the customer, may rescind the contract.

 

4.4           If Jedox is in default of delivery due to simple negligence, Jedox’ liability for damages due to the delay in delivery, which may be claimed in addition to the delivery, shall be limited to 0.75% of the value of the delivery for every full week of default, up to a maximum of 5% of the total value of the delivery. If the customer claims damages instead of the delivery in the said cases, the damages payable shall be limited to 15% of the total value of the delivery. The limitation of liability according to the above sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply in the event of default due to intent or gross negligence or in the event of injury to life, body or health or in the case of a transaction that depends on the compliance with a fixed date.

 

5.             Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise, the prices shown in Jedox’ current list of prices and conditions plus statutory value added / sales tax and shipping costs apply.

 

6.             Terms of Payment, Customer's Ability to Pay, Value Added Tax for deliveries abroad

 

6.1               Unless agreed otherwise, Jedox’ invoices shall be due for payment in full without deductions or set-offs within 30 days of the date of invoice. Payment is deemed to have been made from the point  at  which  Jedox  obtained  unrestricted  access  to the amount ("Receipt of Payment").

 

6.2           Checks shall be accepted if agreed between the parties and shall be considered to be payment only once they have been unconditionally credited to Jedox. Any costs and expenses incurred thereby, in particular, bank, discount and other expenses, inclusive of any value added tax thereon, shall be paid by the customer and shall be immediately due for payment.

 

6.3           Set-offs or reductions of the amount payable for counter claims or retention of payment with the effect of a set-off by the customer is only permitted if the legal claims are recognized by Jedox, uncontested and due for decision by a court or recognized by force of law. This is not applicable if claims of customer are grounded on rectification of a defect or costs for completion of delivery.

 

6.4           Failure to pay by the due date results in the automatic and immediate payment of default interest to Jedox, calculated from the due date and until full payment, based on an interest rate equal to the rate applied by the European Central Bank at its most recent refinancing operation + ten (10) points, in addition to the payment of a flat-rate delay compensation of forty (40) EUR and without prejudice to reimbursement by customer to Jedox of all the recovery costs and all damages that Jedox could claim.

 

6.5           If after the conclusion of the specific contract, it becomes apparent that the payment claim of Jedox will be endangered by the inability of customer to perform, Jedox shall be entitled to refuse its performance under the contract, including performance of any preparatory acts. The right to refuse performance shall cease to exist once payment has been made or customer provides security for payment. Jedox can set a reasonable time limit for provision of such security. After expiration of such reasonable time limit, Jedox may rescind the contract.

 

6.6           For international deliveries within the European Union, customer shall furnish its VAT identification number which is used for income tax purposes in the importing country prior to the contractual delivery date. In the event that such VAT information is not provided or is provided incompletely, Jedox reserves the right to charge the applicable value-added tax to customer.

 

 

7.              Customer's Rights related to the Software

 

7.1.1       If Jedox delivers standard software to the customer against payment of a one-off charge for any length of time, the customer shall receive the non-exclusive worldwide right, granted for the legal duration of protection of intellectual property rights, to duplicate the software to the extent such duplication is necessary for loading, viewing, running, transferring or saving the software contemporaneously on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum number of users as agreed in the contract ("Agreed Use"). The customer agrees to abide by the provisions relating to Agreed Use and agrees not to make the software available to additional users. Special, separate licenses can be purchased for test, backup or development systems.

 

7.1.2       To the extent that the standard software transferred free of charge has been licensed as Open Source software, the rights and obligations of the customer shall be those provided in the Open Source license which the software is licensed under. The relevant Open Source license agreement is included in the software.

 

7.1.3       To the extent that the software transferred free of charge is not Open Source software ("Freeware"), the customer can use the software pursuant to the Agreed Use and as a non-transferrable right. The Customer shall only use the software according to this Agreed Use. The Customer is not permitted under any circumstances, without Jedox’ written consent, to sell the software or to transfer the software to third parties free of charge.

 

If customer deems that it is allowed, under article L.122-6-1 of the French Intellectual Property Code, to carry out reverse engineering activity, then customer shall provide Jedox with written notice prior to such reverse engineering activity, information sufficient regarding customer's intended method of reverse engineering, its purpose and the legal authority for such activity and shall afford Jedox a reasonable period of time before initiating such activity in order to evaluate the activity and/or challenge the reverse engineering activity with the appropriate legal authorities. Customer shall refrain from such reverse engineering activity until such time as any legal challenge is resolved in Customer's favor.  Reverse engineering includes, without limitation, sniffing, decompiling, disassembly, peeling semiconductor components, or otherwise deriving source code.

 

7.2         The operation of the software by third party businesses due to outsourcing requires Jedox’ prior consent.

 

7.3         The customer is not entitled to generate copies or partial copies of the software on other media. This does not apply to the generation of a backup copy to preserve the use of the software, as stated under article L.122-6-1 of the French Intellectual Property Code. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the words "Backup Copy".

 

7.4         The customer is entitled to sell software purchased from Jedox to third parties only if:

 

a)             it fully gives up the use of the software and destroys any existing copies of the software;

 

b)            it notifies Jedox of the name and address of such third party; and

 

c)             such third party gives to Jedox its consent to be bound by these License Terms of Standard Software in writing.

 

If the customer violates this clause, customer shall owe Jedox a contractual penalty of half the amount that the third party would have had to pay under Jedox’ current list of prices and conditions to obtain the software from Jedox, or half the purchase price agreed with the customer, whichever is greater.

 

7.5         The customer is not under any circumstances whatsoever entitled to permanently or temporarily rent, lease or otherwise make the software available to third parties. The customer's employees are not third parties for the purposes of these License Terms of Standard Software, as long as they use the software within their employment mission and according to the contract.

 

7.6         The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

 

7.7         In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

 

7.8         Upon request, and if there is a justified reason to inquire, the customer will allow Jedox or a third party acting on behalf of Jedox to investigate if the use of the software is within the restrictions and granted rights as set by Jedox. The customer will support Jedox in this investigation to its best efforts.

 

7.9         Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

7.10       The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

 

8.             Lack of Conformity of the Goods or Documentation with Contract, Notice of Defects, Limitation Period

 

8.1.    To the extent that Jedox transfers standard software, granted for the legal duration of protection of intellectual property rights, against payment of a one-time fee, the following applies:

 

8.            1.1        If the purchase is a commercial transaction for both parties, the customer shall, if this is usual according to the ordinary business operations, inspect the product without delay and report any and all defects in writing, indicating the type and scope of the defect. The report must be received by Jedox within eight working days from the delivery in the case of obvious defects or within eight working days from the discovery in the case of concealed defects. If the report does not fulfill the said requirements, the product will be deemed accepted by the customer. If the customer does not indicate the defects without delay, the termination or withdrawal rights of the customer are excluded. The same applies for hidden defects if it is not indicated within eight (8) business days after delivery.

 

If, after the customer has given notice of lack of conformity, no actual lack of conformity of the product is found, the customer shall reimburse Jedox for the costs and expenses Jedox incurred in connection with the examination and inspection of the goods, provided that the unjustified report of defects is attributable to the fault of the customer.

 

8.3.2       Rights due to defects in quality can only arise if the product has a defect in quality at the time of transfer of risk. No rights due to defects in quality shall arise in the case of improper use or treatment of the product, unsuitable environment or operating conditions, defects caused by changes performed by the customer, insufficient maintenance, etc. . If questions regarding the use of the delivered licenses occur, customer shall in particular consult the respective documentation or the information in the Jedox Knowledge Base (https://knowledgebase.jedox.com).

8.1.2        

 

8.1.3       Subject to the provisions of clause 8.1.3, the customer may, at Jedox’s discretion, demand supplementary performance in the form of elimination of the defect (rectification) or delivery of a product without any defects (replacement). The expenses required for the supplementary performance shall be borne by the customer if they are higher due to the fact that the product has been transported to a location other than the delivery address of the customer, unless the transport corresponds to its intended use. If Jedox is unwilling or unable to provide rectification/replacement, especially if such is unduly delayed for reasons for which Jedox is responsible, the customer shall, at its own discretion, be entitled to rescind the contract or reduce the purchase price if it cannot be expected to accept further supplementary performance attempts. In the case of a minor defect, the rescission of the contract by the customer is subject to Jedox’ approval.

 

8.1.4       Once the customer exercises its right to rescind the contract, its right to use the licensed software shall end. In such case, the customer shall remove the software from all storage media and destroy all copies of the software and notify Jedox of this in writing.

 

8.1.5       Subject to sentence 2 of this paragraph, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is one year. In the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible and in cases of intent and gross negligence, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is the applicable legal period.

 

8.1.6       Jedox’ liability for defects of the goods shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 10.

 

8.2         In case of the granting of the use of software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.1.2 and 7.1.3, the rights of the customer with regards to legal defects are determined in accordance with the legal provisions regulating gifts.

 

9.            Legal defects

 

9.1           In as far as Jedox transfers Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

9.1.1       If the product is encumbered by a legal defect, the customer may demand a method of using the product that is not subject to any legal objection or provision of an equivalent product free of such defects. Jedox retains the right to determine which alternative product this may be.

 

9.1.2       The customer agrees to notify Jedox without delay and in writing if any third parties assert industrial or intellectual property rights (e.g. copyright or patent rights) in the product against customer. The customer authorises Jedox to pursue the dispute with the third party on behalf of customer. For as long as Jedox makes use of such authorisation, the customer shall not be permitted to acknowledge any such third party claims without the consent of Jedox; Jedox shall defend against such third party claims at its own expense and indemnify the customer in relation to all costs arising from such defense to the extent that such cost do not arise from of the customer’s breach of obligations (e.g. use of the product in violation of the contract).

 

9.1.3       For damages resulting from legal defects of the products, the liability of Jedox shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 10.

 

9.2           In case of the granting of the software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.1.2 and 7.1.3, the rights of the customer with regards to legal defects are determined in accordance with the legal provisions regulating gifts.

 

10.         Limitation of Liability

 

10.1        In as far as Jedox transfers Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

10.1.1     Jedox shall be liable in accordance with the civil contractual liability rules only for direct, certain and foreseeable damage. The aggregate liability of Jedox is capped for all damages and all other losses for any cause arising under this contract to the contract value. Jedox excludes all liability as regards indirect damages notably loss of profit or other financial losses of the customer.

  However, Jedox remains liable for damages in cases of intent, gross negligence, if Jedox provided a guarantee and in the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox cannot limit its liability.

 

10.2        Subject to sentence 3, all liability claims against Jedox expire by limitation after one year. The time limit for the liability limitation commences on the date specified in article 2224 of the French Civil Code. The regulations specified in sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply to Jedox' liability on account of malicious intent and gross negligence, injury to life, body and health for which Jedox is responsible, as well as on account of simple, negligent violation of cardinal obligations, bodily injury and as a result of a warranty.

 

10.2.1     If the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’ liability shall be limited to the recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

10.2.2     If Jedox’ liability is excluded or limited due to the aforesaid provision, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’ employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

10.3        In case of a transfer of software free of charge in accordance with clause 7.1.2 and 7.1.3, Jedox is only liable for intent or gross negligence.

 

11.         Reservation of Ownership Rights

 

The ownership of the products and the rights as set under clause 7 shall pass to the customer only after payment in full of the purchase price as specified in clause 6.1.

 

III.   Concluding Provisions

 

12.         Compliance Audit of Contract Terms

 

12.1        Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox shall in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license agreements and terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) business days before such an inspection unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

12.2        If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually

 

 

13.       Confidentiality

 

13.1     The parties hereto each undertake to treat in strict confidence all items (e.g. software, documentation, information) received from or that become known via the other party before the conclusion of or in the performance of the contract and that are protected by law, that include business or operational secrets or that are described as being confidential - during and beyond the term of the contract for five (5) more years - unless they become known to the public without infringement of the duty to maintain confidentiality. The parties shall keep and safeguard all such items so that third parties are completely denied access to them.

 

13.2     The customer agrees that it shall make the contractual products available only to those of its employees and other third parties that require such access to perform their respective tasks. The customer agrees to instruct such persons on the need to maintain secrecy and confidentiality with respect to such items.

 

13.3     Jedox shall process customer's data required for the transaction in accordance with any pertinent data protection laws and regulations. Following successful provision of the services, Jedox shall be entitled to cite the customer as a reference customer.

 

 

14.       Term and notice of termination

 

14.1      To the extent permitted by applicable law, the contract can in addition be terminated in writing by any of the parties without observance of a notice period for material breach. For the purposes of the contract, a material breach entitling Jedox to immediately terminate the contract without judicial formality and without prejudice to any damages, exists in particular if the customer violates rights of Jedox by using the software beyond the scope agreed upon in the contract and does not stop the violation within a reasonable period after a warning notice by Jedox.

 

14.2     Notice of termination must be made in writing.

 

14.3      The right of the customer to use the software expires upon termination of the contract. In this case the customer is obliged to remove the software from all storage devices, to delete all copies of the software, as well as to send us a signed deletion notice.

 

 

15.       Place of Performance, Jurisdiction, Governing Law

 

15.1      Unless specifically agreed otherwise, the place of performance is the company domicile of Jedox France SAS.

 

15.2      These License Terms of Standard Software and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer shall be governed by the law of France, under exclusion of the UN Convention on the International Sale of Goods (CISG).

 

15.3      If the English legal meaning differs from the French legal meaning of the contract and its terms, the French meaning shall prevail.

 

15.4     In case of dispute, the customer and Jedox shall discuss to find an amicable settlement. ANY DISPUTE CONCERNING THE EXISTENCE, PERFORMANCE, APPLICATION, INTERPRETATION OF THE CONTRACT AND THE LICENSE TERMS OF STANDARD SOFTWARE WHICH COULD NOT BE SETTLED OUT OF COURTS WILL BE SUBJECT TO THE EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION OF THE COMMERCIAL COURTS OF PARIS, NOTWITHSTANDING ANY WARRANTIES CALLS AND/OR EMERGENCY OR CONSERVATORY PROCEDURES IN INTERIM (REFERE) OR ON REQUEST.

 

 

 

H

 

General terms and conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of Software of Jedox France SAS ("Jedox“ or "we“)

(As of: December 2017)

 

 

I.    Introductory provisions

 

1.   General, Definitions, scope of application

 

1.1 Our offers and deliveries to, and other services concerning the provision of subscription licenses of the Standard Software and/ or Jedox Software Content (hereinafter “Software”) - including future ones - for persons specified in subsection 1.2 are exclusively performed on the basis of the following general terms and conditions ("Subscription General Terms and Conditions“). Conflicting terms and conditions, or alternative terms and conditions of the customer not included in our license agreement will not be accepted.

 

1.2 Our Subscription General Terms and Conditions apply only to persons who, upon conclusion of the agreement act in the course of their trade, business or profession ("Professionals“) and, in the event of a domestic business transaction, to domestic legal entities under public law or a domestic separate fund under public law. They shall not apply to natural persons concluding the agreement for purposes that cannot be attributed to their trade, business or profession ("Consumers “).

 

1.3   “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

1.4 Our Subscription General Terms and Conditions apply to the use (see subsection 2 below) of Jedox standard software. The provision of services provided to Professionals (cf. subsection 1.2) shall be governed by an additional agreement and shall be based on the applicable General Terms and Conditions for Services.

 

2.   Purpose of agreement, conclusion of agreement

 

2.1 The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2 We make the software specified in the order confirmation or offer available to the customer for the use on his own hardware or for the use on his external platform for the duration of the agreement against payment. We perform support services as contractually agreed and defined in the "Terms and conditions governing the maintenance agreements of software packages for JEDOX FRANCE SAS“ ("Support Terms“); warranty rights of the customer according to subsection 8 shall remain unaffected; the installation, operation and maintenance of the software however remain under the sole responsibility of the customer.

 

2.3 The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

 

2.4 The specifications and information given in the product catalogues and on our homepage shall only be legally binding if the agreement expressly refers to them.

 

2.5 Solely relevant for the content of the contractual relationship as well as the scope of both delivery and performance shall be our binding offer after its timely acceptance. Collateral agreements, verbal statements by employees or representatives as well as changes of confirmed orders (including changes to delivery items) require our written confirmation to be effective; it may be communicated by fax or electronic media.

 

3.   Product descriptions, offer documents, reservation of right of modification

 

3.1 Product descriptions on our homepage based on test programs, in catalogues, brochures etc. are no quality guarantees.

 

3.2 As far as its offer documents, in particular test programs, illustrations and quotes are concerned, Jedox reserves all proprietary rights, copyrights and industrial property rights (including the right to register these rights). The aforementioned documents shall upon request be immediately returned to Jedox if our offer is not accepted.

 

3.3 Jedox reserves the right to technical changes provided that the customary use of the contractual object or its use as agreed is not materially and adversely affected and the changes are not unreasonable for the customer.

 

4.   Delivery, delivery period, delay in acceptance

 

4.1 After conclusion of the agreement we will make the software available to the customer via download (On- Premises Subscription) or integrated in an external Cloud (Subscription as a Service). The respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

4.2 The delivery period is reasonably extended - even within a delay - in the event of force majeure and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after conclusion of the agreement for which Jedox is not responsible insofar as these impediments have a demonstrable effect on the fulfillment of the contractually agreed performance. This also applies if said circumstances occur at preliminary suppliers. Jedox will inform the customer about the beginning and end of such impediments as soon as possible. In case that the impediment lasts for more than three months or if it is certain that it will last for more than three months both the customer and Jedox may withdraw from the agreement.

 

II. Provisions for the on-premises subscription use

 

5.     Rights and duties of customer

5.1   The customer receives the non-exclusive, non-transferrable, non-sub licensable temporary right limited to the duration of the agreement to use the Jedox software, as well as the right to duplicate it to the extent required for the installation, loading, display, and operation or storage of the software on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum contractually agreed number of users (intended use). The customer shall use the software only as intended and will not make the software available to additional users. Special, separate licenses can be agreed upon or purchased for test, backup or development systems. The customer is not entitled to be provided with, or use, the source code of the software.

 

5.2   If customer deems that it is allowed, under article L.122-6-1 of the French Intellectual Property Code, to carry out reverse engineering activity, then customer shall provide Jedox with written notice prior to such reverse engineering activity, information sufficient regarding customer's intended method of reverse engineering, its purpose and the legal authority for such activity and shall afford Jedox a reasonable period of time before initiating such activity in order to evaluate the activity and/or challenge the reverse engineering activity with the appropriate legal authorities.  Customer shall refrain from such reverse engineering activity until such time as any legal challenge is resolved in Customer's favor.  Reverse engineering includes, without limitation, sniffing, decompiling, disassembly, peeling semiconductor components, or otherwise deriving source code. The customer is in addition not entitled to edit, translate, rework or duplicate the software unless this is required for the intended use, in particular to remedy a defect of the software. This shall however only apply on condition that we have not made the information required for this available to the customer upon request within a reasonable period of time, or if we are in arrears in remedying the defect, reject the rectification unjustifiably or are incapable to remedy the defect for reasons outside our responsibility. The customer may not commission third parties with the aforesaid measures who are competitors of Jedox unless he proves that the danger of disclosure of operation and trade secrets is excluded.

 

5.5   The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

 

5.6   In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software, Software Content or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

 

5.4   Third-party operation of the software by way of outsourcing requires our permission.

 

5.5   The customer is not entitled to make copies or partial copies of the software on another data storage device. This does not apply to the making of a backup copy to preserve the use of the software, as stated under article L.122-6-1 of the French Intellectual Property Code. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the note "backup copy".

 

5.6   The customer is not entitled to transfer the software provided to him to third parties, or to transfer copies of the software to third parties. The customer is in particular not permitted to sell, rent or otherwise sublicense the software, or to display or disclose it to the public unless it is absolutely necessary for the intended use, operation and maintenance of the software.

 

5.7   In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions all rights of use granted in connection with the subscription agreement shall immediately become ineffective and automatically revert to us. In this case the customer is obliged to immediately and completely terminate the use of the software, to delete all copies installed on his systems as well as to delete or return all backup copies to us which he may have made.

 

5.8   The customer has to ensure that the system requirements are met.

 

5.9   The customer is obliged to inform us upon request about the number, data storage device and the repository of all copies (e.g. backup copies) the customer has received.

 

5.10 The customer shall also be obliged to save all data including the external data files (e.g. data bases and configuration data) appropriately to the level of risk, at least once a day and to store them in a place that corresponds to security standards customary in the trade to which neither the software transferred by us nor other components of the server systems used by the customer have written access.

 

5.11 Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

5.13     The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

6.     Remuneration, due date, default in payment, turnover tax for foreign deliveries

6.1   Unless otherwise agreed, the remuneration for the granted use during the minimum term is computed on the basis of the current version of our list of prices and conditions plus turnover tax. After expiry of the minimum term and provided that a new agreement is concluded, the remuneration listed in the current version of our list of prices and conditions shall apply for a one-year term plus turnover tax unless a new minimum term is agreed upon.

 

6.2   Unless otherwise agreed, the remuneration for the agreed minimum term is due in advance as well as payable immediately and within 30 days from the date of the invoice without deductions. Payments will be considered as made when Jedox disposes of the entire amount without recourse (receipt of payment). After expiry of the agreed minimum term, and unless the agreement is terminated, the remuneration for each subsequent 12-months period shall always be due for immediate payment within 30 days from the date of the invoice without deductions.

 

6.3   Failure to pay by the due date results in the automatic and immediate payment of default interest to Jedox, calculated from the due date and until full payment, based on an interest rate equal to the rate applied by the European Central Bank at its most recent refinancing operation + ten (10) points, in addition to the payment of a flat-rate delay compensation of forty (40) EUR and without prejudice to reimbursement by customer to Jedox of all the recovery costs and all damages that Jedox could claim.

 

6.4.   Checks will only be accepted after a corresponding arrangement between the parties and are considered a valid payment only after the amount has been credited without reservation. All costs arising thereof, in particular bank, discount and other charges plus V.A.T. must be borne by the customer and are due without delay.

 

6.9   Any offsetting or retention of payment with the effect of an offsetting is only permitted when counterclaims by the customer have been acknowledged by Jedox, are undisputed, ready for a decision or have become res judicata.

 

6.10         In case of foreign deliveries to countries within the European Union, the customer is obliged to communicate his V.A.T identification number in good time prior to the delivery date agreed under contract as evidence of their obligation to purchase taxation in the importing country. In the event that this information is not furnished in time and in full Jedox reserves the right to charge the applicable V.A.T.

 

7.     Term and notice of termination

7.1   The term of the agreement is subject to the period stipulated in the offer (hereinafter "minimum term"). In the event that no minimum term has been agreed upon a minimum term of twelve (12) months shall apply. Afterwards, the On-premises Subscription General Terms and Conditions is automatically extended by the minimum term period, however by no more than 24 months ("extension period"), unless it is terminated by one of the parties to the agreement within a period of ninety (90) days at the end of a minimum term or extension period.

 

7.2   To the extent permitted by applicable law, the On-premises subscription agreement can in addition be terminated in writing by any of the parties without observance of a notice period for material breach. For the purposes of the agreement, a material breach entitling Jedox to immediately terminate the agreement without judicial formality and without prejudice to any damages, exists in particular if the customer violates rights of Jedox by using the software beyond the scope agreed upon in the agreement and does not stop the violation within a reasonable period after a warning notice by Jedox.

 

7.3   Notice of termination must be made in writing.

 

7.4   The right of the customer to use the software expires upon termination of the agreement. In this case the customer is obliged to remove the software from all storage devices, to delete all copies of the software, as well as to send us a signed deletion notice.

 

8.     Maintenance, warranty

8.1   We warrant that the contractually agreed quality of the software is maintained over the duration of the on-premises subscription agreement and that no third-party rights conflict with the contractual use of the software. We shall remedy defects in quality and defects in title that may arise within a reasonable time period after receipt of the customer's notice of defects.

 

8.2   The customer must immediately notify us in writing in the event that software defects have been discovered. In the case of quality defects, time and circumstances of the occurrence of the defects must be indicated.

 

8.3   If, within eight working days, the customer does not notify us of defects that are known to him or obvious, the customer's rights to a reduction of the remuneration or to terminate the agreement on the basis of the defects are excluded.

 

8.4   Warranty rights of the customer are excluded if the customer makes changes to, or commissions any third party to make a change in the software without our consent, unless the customer provides evidence that the changes have consequences for the analysis and removal of the defect which are acceptable for us and did not cause the defect. Customer rights due to defects shall remain unaffected provided that the customer is entitled to make changes, in particular in exercising the right to correct defects on his own consent, that the changes are adequate and appropriate, and that they are traceably documented.

 

8.5   We are entitled but not obliged to continuously develop the software and to make additional features or extensions of the software available to the customer by way of updates. We are entitled to adjust the technical requirements correspondingly. Prior to the installation of updates the customer has to make sure that his systems meet the updated system requirements.

 

8.6   We will make our best effort to inform the customer prior to the provision of updates, whose installation is required for a smooth operation of the software, about the update, system requirements and the date of the provision. The customer is obliged to install updates himself within a period of four weeks from the provision of the update. This may also require an update of the required third-party software including the operating system. Jedox undertakes to inform the customer accordingly.

 

8.7   The support agreed in accordance with the Support Terms pursuant to subsection 2.2 of these on-premises subscription General Terms and Conditions does not restrict the warranty rights of customer according to this subsection 8.

 

9.     Limitation of liability

 

9.1   We are liable in accordance with the civil contractual liability rules only for direct, certain and foreseeable damage. The aggregate liability of Jedox is capped for all damages and all other losses for any cause arising under this agreement to the contract value. Jedox excludes all liability as regards indirect damages notably loss of profit or other financial losses of the customer. However, Jedox remain liable for damages in cases of fraud, gross negligence or willful misconduct as well as injury to life, body or health for which Jedox cannot limit its liability.

 

9.2   In the event of a data loss relating to an on premises subscription agreement, Jedox' liability is limited to the expense for a recovery using existing data backups. If the customer uses an external Cloud provider, Jedox shall in no event be liable for a data loss caused by the provider.

 

9.3   Insofar as the liability of Jedox is excluded or limited due to the aforementioned provisions this also applies to the personal liability of office employees, factory workforce, staff members, legal representatives and agents.

 

10.   Limitation period

 

        Subject to sentence 3 of the On-Premises Subscription General Terms and Conditions, all liability claims against Jedox expire by limitation after one year. The time limit for the liability limitation commences on the date specified in article 2224 of the French Civil Code. The regulations specified in sentences 1 and 2 shall not apply to Jedox' liability on account of malicious intent and gross negligence, injury to life, body and health for which Jedox is responsible, as well as on account of simple, negligent violation of cardinal obligations, bodily injury and as a result of a warranty.

 

11.  Advice and support for the installation or implementation of the Software

 

11.1 In connection with the on-premise subscription use of the Software, we provide consulting and support services during the installation or implementation process as required by the customer. The customer commissions Jedox for these services in the form of performance days, see clause 1.3.

 

11.2 The customer undertakes to support us in providing our consulting and support services by adequate cooperation. The customer shall in particular inform us in writing or by sending us a corresponding text on his own accord on the features of his IT systems which must be observed in the performance of support services and to take organizational security measures to prevent loss of data, system failures and other impediments of his systems due to our support services.

 

 

III.    Final provisions

 

12.   Right to audit regarding observance of contractual conditions

 

12.1 Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox may notably in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) working days before such an inspection, unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

12.2 If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found, the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted, unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually.

 

13.   Confidentiality

 

13.1 The contractual parties undertake to treat all items received or disclosed by the other contractual partner (e.g. software, documents and information) that are legally protected or contain business or trade secrets as confidential even after the termination of the agreement, unless they become public knowledge without violation of the secrecy obligation. The contractual parties will store and secure these items in such a way that third parties access is excluded.

 

13.2 The customer will give only those employees and other third parties access to the delivered items who require such access in the performance of their service obligations. The customer shall instruct these persons on the necessity to treat the delivered items as confidential. The customer shall inform us without delay about any requests of disclosure by third-parties, judicial or administrative authorities in written or electronic form and support us in the effort to prevent that confidential information is disclosed.

 

13.3 We shall process the data of the customer required in the business transaction in compliance with the relevant data protection regulations. We may cite the name of the customer along with the full company name and his logo on our marketing materials (including websites) as a reference customer.

 

 

13.4 The obligation to maintain secrecy shall remain in force for another five (5) years after termination of the agreement.

 

14.   Place of fulfillment, applicable law, place of jurisdiction, supremacy clause

 

14.1 Unless otherwise agreed, the place of fulfillment shall be the company domicile of Jedox France SAS.

 

14.2 The law of France shall apply for these on-premises subscription General Terms and Conditions and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer. Any collision rules as well as the UN Convention on the Sale of Goods (CISG) are excluded.

 

14.3 In case of dispute, the customer and Jedox shall discuss to find an amicable settlement.
