5.1       Subscription Fees and Other Fees.  Customer shall timely pay Jedox the Subscription Fees and any other fees specified in the Order Form on or before the due dates specified on such Order Form.  Except as otherwise set forth in the applicable Order Form, all fees and charges shall be paid in U. S. Dollars.  The Subscription Fees for the initial 12-month Term will be paid at the commencement of the Initial Term.   All Subscription Fees are due on the payment date(s) specified in the Order Form.  If, and to the extent the Order Form does not specify the due date for particular fees or charges hereunder, all such amounts shall be due within thirty (30) days after the date of Jedox’s invoice to Customer.  All amounts remaining unpaid after the applicable due date will accrue interest from the applicable due date until paid in full at a rate equal to the lesser of 1.5% per month or the highest contract interest rate allowed by law, from the date due until paid.  All fees set forth in this Agreement may be raised by Jedox not more than once per year.

 

5.2       The Subscription Fee for additional users will be billed at the then current rate, unless a different rate is contained in this Agreement.  The fee for users added will be due and payable within 30 days after the number of users exceeds the contracted number.

 

5.3       All invoices are due and payable upon receipt in US dollars.  Late payment charges will be imposed at the rate of 1.5% per month, including any fees overdue for an increase in the number of users.

 

5.4       Taxes.  Subscription Fees and any other amounts payable pursuant to the Agreement exclude any applicable sales and use taxes, transaction privilege tax, excise tax, tangible or intangible personal property taxes, or value added taxes on the sale or measured by the sales price (collectively “Tax” or “Taxes”).  Customer is solely responsible for the payment of all Taxes and will pay to Jedox or the applicable taxing authorities the amount of any Taxes, including without limitation any applicable interest or penalties in connection therewith, that Jedox or Customer is or becomes obligated to pay based on the license or delivery of the Software or delivery of Customer Support or other Professional Services.

 

6.0       LIMITED WARRANTIES

 

6.1       Jedox warrants that the Software will operate in substantial conformity with the Documentation.  Any description of the Software contained on Jedox’s website or promotional materials is for the sole purpose of identifying the Software, and any such description is not a part of the basis of the bargain and does not constitute a warranty that the Software shall conform to that description.  No affirmation of fact or promise made by Jedox, on its website or otherwise, shall constitute a warranty that the Software will conform to the affirmation or promise. If the Software does not perform as warranted in this Section 6.1 and Jedox is able to reproduce the error, Customer’s sole and exclusive remedy shall be as follows: Jedox shall undertake reasonable efforts to correct the Software, and if after undertaking such reasonable efforts, Jedox determines that it is unable to correct the Software, Customer will have the right, in accordance with the terms hereof, to terminate the Agreement.  This warranty does not apply to the Software or any Third Party Software that has been altered or modified in any way by Customer or someone other than Jedox or its authorized agents.

 

6.2  Warranty Conditions and Limitations.  The limited warranties in Section 6 are made to and for the benefit of Customer only and are conditioned upon Customer’s compliance with the terms of the Agreement, the Documentation and other reasonable instructions provided by Jedox.  These limited warranties shall not apply to the extent that Software fails to perform as warranted under Section 6.1 because of and would not have so failed but for: (a) use of the Software in connection or in combination with any computer hardware or software not expressly approved or recommended by Jedox in writing; or (b) use of the Software contrary to the specifications and directions contained in the Documentation or other reasonable instructions of Jedox.

 

6.3       Customer Representations and Warranties.  Customer represents, warrants and covenants that (a) it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of its state of organization, and has all power and authority to operate its business and conduct its business as presently conducted, and to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under the Agreement; (b) the Agreement, upon execution by the signatory, will have been duly and validly executed and delivered by it, has been duly and validly authorized by all company action, and constitutes the legal, valid, and binding obligation of Customer; (c) the execution, delivery, and performance of the Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby will not conflict with or any judgment or decree or any agreement or other instrument to which Customer is a party; and (d) it is not a government agency and it is not acquiring the license granted by the Agreement pursuant to any government contract or with government funds.

7.0       LIMITATIONS

7.1  OTHER THAN THE WARRANTIES EXPRESSLY STATED IN THIS AGREEMENT, JEDOX NEITHER MAKES NOR GRANTS ANY WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OR CONDITIONS, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED.  JEDOX EXPRESSLY EXCLUDES ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS AND CONDITIONS, INCLUDING SPECIFICALLY ANY AND ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS OF MERCHANTABILITY, MERCHANTABLE QUALITY, OR FITNESS FOR ANY PURPOSE, PARTICULAR, SPECIFIC OR OTHERWISE. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN SECTION 6, THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED STRICTLY “AS IS,” AND Jedox MAKES NO ADDITIONAL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED, ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE, OR STATUTORY, AS TO THE SOFTWARE OR ANY MATTER WHATSOEVER.  IN PARTICULAR, EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN SECTION 6, ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING IN LAW OR FROM COURSE OF DEALING, COURSE OF PERFORMANCE, OR USE OF TRADE ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED.  THIS IS A LIMITED WARRANTY AND IS THE ONLY WARRANTY MADE BY Jedox. CUSTOMER HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY RELIANCE ON ANY WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION NOT EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT. 

 

7.2       Jedox SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO CUSTOMER OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY LOSS OF PROFITS, LOSS OF USE, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, LOSS OF DATA, COST OF RECREATING LOST DATA, COST OF COVER OR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY KIND IN CONNECTION WITH OR ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FURNISHING, PERFORMANCE OR USE OF THE SOFTWARE, MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT, OR OTHER ITEMS OR SERVICES PROVIDED HEREUNDER OR ANY DELAY IN DELIVERY OR FURNISHING THE SOFTWARE, MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT, OR SAID ITEMS OR SERVICES EVEN IF Jedox HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. 

 

7.3       NOTWITHSTANDING ANY TERM OF THIS AGREEMENT, Jedox’s MAXIMUM AGGREGATE LIABILITY (WHETHER IN CONTRACT OR IN TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER FORM OF LIABILITY, INCLUDING INDEMNIFICATION) FOR DAMAGES OR LOSS, HOWSOEVER ARISING OR CAUSED, WHETHER OR NOT ARISING FROM Jedox’s ACTIONS, SHALL IN NO EVENT BE GREATER THAN THE FEES PAID TO Jedox BY CUSTOMER DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRIOR TO THE DATE OF THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO SUCH LIABILITY. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.

 

7.4       No employee, agent, representative or affiliate of Jedox has authority to bind Jedox to any oral representations or warranty concerning the Software or Customer Support.  Any written representation or warranty not expressly contained in the Agreement is not authorized and is unenforceable.  Any description of the Software contained on Jedox’s website or promotional materials is for the sole purpose of identifying the Software, and any such description is not a part of the basis of the bargain and does not constitute a warranty that the Software shall conform to that description.  No affirmation of fact or promise made by Jedox, on its website or otherwise, shall constitute a warranty that the Software will conform to the affirmation or promise.

8.0       INDEMNIFICATION

8.1  Indemnification by Jedox.  Jedox will defend at its expense any action brought against Customer to the extent based on a claim that the Software, when used within the scope of this Agreement, infringes a U.S. or European patent, copyright or trade secret.  Subject to the limitation set forth in Section 7.3, Jedox will pay any costs and damages finally awarded against Customer in such action that are attributable to such claim, provided that Customer promptly notify Jedox in writing of the claim, allow Jedox to control the defense, provide Jedox with the information and assistance necessary for the defense and/or settlement of the claim, and do not agree to any settlement without Jedox’s prior written consent.  Should the Software become, or in Jedox’s opinion be likely to become, the subject of any claim of infringement, Jedox may at its option (i) procure for Customer the right to continue using the Software, (ii) replace or modify the Software so as to make it non-infringing, or, if (i) and (ii) are not commercially reasonable, (iii) terminate the license granted hereunder and refund the amounts paid for such license.  Jedox will have no liability for any claim of infringement based upon (i) use of other than the latest unmodified release of the Software available to Customer if such infringement would have been avoided by the use of such release, (ii) use or combination of the Software with other programs or data if such infringement would not have occurred without such use or combination, or (iii) use of the Software after receiving notice from a third party, or having reason to believe, that the Software infringes a patent, copyright or trade secret right of a third party unless prompt written notice thereof is given to Jedox. The forgoing states the exclusive remedy of Customer and Jedox’s entire liability with respect to infringement of patents, copyrights, trade secrets or other proprietary rights. THE FOREGOING SETS FORTH JEDOX’S EXCLUSIVE OBLIGATION AND LIABILITY FOR INFRINGEMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.

 

8.2 Indemnification by Customer; Responsibility for Parties.  Customer shall indemnify and defend Jedox and its officers, directors, employees and representatives against, and hold them harmless from: (a) any claims or allegations against Jedox that arise from Customer’s failure to comply with governmental regulations, Customer’s interaction with its customers, in each case when Jedox reasonably alleges that Customer is at fault or in breach of its duties in respect of such matter (including any misuse or unauthorized access by (or permitted by) Customer or an employee of Customer, and (b) any litigation, arbitration, judgments, awards, settlements, damages, expenses, losses, attorneys’ fees, and costs arising from or relating to any such claims or allegations. Customer is responsible for its employees, agents, and affiliates who use the Software and Customer shall defend and indemnify Jedox for any liability caused by the improper, negligent, reckless or fraudulent use of the Software by any employee, agent or affiliate of Customer.

 

9.0  CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION AND OWNERSHIP

 

9.1  Mutual Covenants. Each party acknowledges that the other party’s Confidential Information constitutes valuable trade secrets and agrees that it shall use the other party’s Confidential Information solely in accordance with the provisions of the Agreement and shall not disclose, or permit to be disclosed, the same, directly or indirectly, except as required by law, to any third party without the disclosing party’s prior written consent, and shall safeguard the disclosing party’s Confidential Information from unauthorized use and disclosure using measures that are equal to the standard of performance used by the recipient party to safeguard its own Confidential Information of comparable value, but in no event less than reasonable care.  However, Confidential Information of a party does not include information that (a) is rightfully publicly available, (b) has been rightfully obtained by the recipient party from third parties without restrictions on disclosure, or (c) was independently developed by the recipient party without reference to the disclosing party’s Confidential Information.  Both parties agree that neither party shall disclose the terms of the Agreement, except as required by law.

 

9.2  Injunctive Relief.  In the event of actual or threatened breach of the provisions of Section 9.1, which the parties hereby agree would cause irreparable harm, the non-breaching party shall be entitled to immediate injunctive and other equitable relief, without bond and without the necessity of showing actual damage.

 

9.3  Ownership.  Jedox’s business methods, know-how, the Software, the Documentation, Confidential Information, trademarks, tradenames and any other proprietary information, and any and all derivative works thereof, plans, prices, configurations, specifications, techniques, algorithms, schemas, screen prints and processes contained herein, or any modification, extraction, or extrapolations thereof (including improvements and revisions made during the Term hereof regardless of the source of such idea for the improvement or revision), are the property and trade secrets of Jedox and are subject to copyright protection and other proprietary rights.  Any lack of a copyright notice does not imply unrestricted or public access. No duplication, usage, disclosure, or publication thereof, in whole or in part, for any purpose is permitted, except that which is expressly permitted by the Agreement.  Customer shall include in all copies made by it notices of copyright and other proprietary rights included by Jedox in the Documentation, or any and all derivative works thereof.  Customer specifically agrees that any and all derivative works of the Software and the Documentation shall be the property of Jedox and Customer hereby assigns all title and ownership interest therein, if any, to Jedox.

 

10.0  TERM.  The initial Subscription Term (“Initial Subscription Term”) is set forth Order Form. If not specified in the Order Form, the Initial Subscription Term is for twelve (12) months.  The initial Subscription Term will automatically extend for additional 12-month periods unless either party notifies the other in writing of its intention not to extend, no less than ninety (90) days before the end of the Initial Subscription Term.  The Subscription Term will expire, and this Agreement will terminate, at the end of any Subscription Term in which a timely notice of non-extension is delivered and received.

 

11  TERMINATION

 

11.1  Termination for Cause.  If a party defaults in performing any material obligations required under the Agreement, the other “non-defaulting” party may give written notice of its intention to terminate the Agreement, describing in reasonable detail the default.  If the party in default fails to remedy such material default within thirty (30) days (ten (10) days for a payment default) following such written notice, or if such default is not capable of cure within such thirty (30) day period, or if the party in default fails to commence cure procedures within such thirty (30) day period, then the non-defaulting party may, in addition to all other remedies available at law or in equity, terminate the Agreement. 

 

11.2  Termination Due to Insolvency.  Either party will have the right to terminate the Agreement by providing prior notice to other party (the “Insolvent Party”) upon occurrence of any of the following circumstances with respect to the Insolvent Party: (a) the filing by or against the Insolvent Party of a petition for reorganization or liquidation under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or corresponding laws or procedures of any applicable jurisdiction; (b) the filing by or against the Insolvent Party of any other proceeding concerning bankruptcy, insolvency, dissolution, cessation of operations, reorganization of indebtedness, or the like by the Insolvent Party (if such proceeding is involuntary and is contested in good faith, the Agreement will terminate only after the passage of one hundred twenty (120) days without the dismissal of such proceedings); (c) the voluntary or involuntary execution upon the assignment or conveyance to a liquidating agent, trustee, mortgages or assignee of whatever description; or the making of any judicial levy against a substantial percentage of the Insolvent Party’s assets, for the benefit of its creditors; (d) the appointment of a receiver, keeper, liquidator or custodian of whatever sort or description, for all or a substantial portion of the Insolvent Party’s assets; or (e) the termination, dissolution, insolvency, or its cessation to continue all or substantially all of the Insolvent Party’s business affairs.

 

11.3   Effect of Termination.

 

(a) In the event the Agreement is terminated due to Customer’s default, Customer shall immediately pay all Subscription Fees and other amounts due to Jedox through the then current Term of the Agreement, and shall immediately discontinue use of and shall return to Jedox all Software, Documentation and any Confidential Information of Jedox.

 

(b) In the event the Agreement is terminated due to any reason other than Customer’s default, (i) Customer shall pay all Subscription Fees and other fees accrued through the date of such termination, and (ii) Jedox shall refund any unused portion of any pre-paid Subscription Fees and Professional Services Fees.

 

(c)       Section 1 (“Definitions”), Section 5 (“Payments”), Section 6 (“Limited Warranties), Section 7 (Limitations”), Section 8 (Indemnification), Section 9 (“Confidential Information and ownership”), Section 11 (“Termination”) and Section 12 (“General”) shall survive any termination or expiration of the Agreement.  Termination is not an exclusive remedy and all other remedies will be available whether or not termination occurs.

12   GENERAL

 

12.1   Assignment/Binding Nature.  Neither the Agreement nor any rights or obligations under the Agreement may be assigned or otherwise transferred by Customer, in whole or in part, whether voluntary or by operation of law or in connection with a merger or sale of stock or assets that results in a change of control.  This Agreement and the rights and obligations of Jedox under the Agreement may be assigned, without the consent of Customer, by Jedox to any entity which is a wholly owned subsidiary or parent of Jedox, which survives a merger in which Jedox participates or to any entity which acquires all or substantially all of the assets of Jedox or substantially all of Jedox’s interests in the product suite which contains the Software.  Subject to the foregoing, the Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective permitted successors and assigns.

 

12.2   Notices.  Any notice required or permitted under the terms of the Agreement or required by law must be in writing and must be (a) delivered in person, (b) sent by registered mail return receipt requested, (c) sent by overnight air courier, (d) by facsimile, or (e) sent via electronic mail to the recipient(s) named herein at the email addresses set forth herein.  If to Jedox, a notice shall be forwarded to Jedox at: Jedox Inc. 50 Milk Street, 14th Floor, Boston, MA 02109.  If to Customer, a notice shall be forwarded to Customer at the address set forth in the Order Form.  Notices shall be considered to have been given at the time of actual receipt, five business days after posting if sent by registered mail, one business day after delivery to an overnight air courier service, or upon receipt of machine confirmation of successful transmission by facsimile.

 

12.3   Force Majeure.  Except obligations to pay fees, neither party shall incur any liability to the other party on account of any loss or damage resulting from any delay or failure to perform all or any part of the Agreement if such delay or failure is caused, in whole or in part, by events, occurrences, or causes beyond the control and without negligence of the parties.  Such events, occurrences or causes shall include, without limitation, acts of God, strikes, lockouts, riots, acts of war, earthquakes, fire and explosions, but the delay or failure to meet financial obligations under this Agreement is expressly excluded.

 

12.4  Waiver.  The failure of either party to enforce at any time any of the provisions hereof or exercise any right or option hereunder shall not be construed to be a waiver of the right of such party thereafter to enforce any such provisions or exercise such right or option.  Any consent by any party to, or waiver of, a breach by the other, shall not constitute consent to, waiver of, or excuse of any other, different or subsequent breach.

 

12.5   Severability.  If any term, condition, or provision in this Agreement is found to be invalid, unlawful or unenforceable to any extent, then the meaning of said provision shall be construed, to the extent feasible, so as to render the provision enforceable, such term, condition or provision shall be severed from the remaining terms, conditions and provisions, which remaining terms shall continue to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law.

 

12.6   Entire Agreement; Modification and Amendment; Headings.  These Terms and Conditions together with the Order Form and any exhibits, schedules or addenda attached hereto or to the Order Form contains the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter of the Agreement and supersede all previous or contemporaneous communications, representations, understandings and agreements, either oral or written, between the parties.  This Agreement may not be altered, modified, amended, changed, rescinded or discharged in whole or in part, except by written agreement executed by authorized officers of both Customer and Jedox.

 

12.7   No Third-Party Beneficiaries.  The parties agree and acknowledge that the Agreement is not made for the benefit of any third-party.  Nothing in the Agreement, whether expressed or implied, is intended to confer upon any person other than the parties hereto and their respective heirs, representatives, successors and permitted assigns, any rights or remedies under or by reason of the Agreement, nor is anything in the Agreement intended to relieve or discharge the liability of either party hereto, nor shall any provision hereof give any entity any right of subrogation against or action over or against either Party.

 

12.8   Relationship of Parties.  The parties are independent contractors and not the franchisee, partner, or agent of each other. Neither party shall have the right to make any representations on behalf of the other.

 

12.9   Standard Terms of Customer.  No terms, provisions or conditions of any purchase order, acknowledgement or other business form that Customer may use in connection with the acquisition or licensing of the Software shall have any effect on the rights, duties or obligations of the parties hereunder, or otherwise modify, the Agreement, regardless of any failure of Jedox to object to such terms, provisions or conditions.  Customer shall, and hereby does, waive, and agree to indemnify Jedox from and against, any claim, demand or cause of action that is inconsistent with the foregoing.

 

12.10 Publicity.  Neither party shall use the name of the other in publicity releases or advertising, including customer lists, or for other promotional purposes, without securing the prior written approval of the other party hereto.

 

12.11 Counterparts.  The Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which so executed shall be deemed to be an original and such counterparts together shall constitute one and the same agreement.  Facsimile signatures on counterparts of the Agreement will be deemed original signatures.

 

12.12 Applicable Law.  This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, without regard to the application of conflicts of law principles.  Except for actions initiated by either party to this Agreement for injunctive relief to enforce its rights pursuant to Section 8.2 above, any dispute or claim arising in connection with this Agreement will be adjudicated in the appropriate courts located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

 

12.13 Recruitment of Personnel.  During the Term of the Agreement and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, neither Jedox nor Customer will solicit, hire, employ or contract with directly or indirectly any employee(s) of the other party, and will not hire, employ or contract with directly or indirectly any former employee(s) of the other party for a period of one hundred twenty (120) days following termination of such employee’s employment. 

 

12.14 Electronic Software Delivery.  With respect to all the Software licensed by Customer hereunder, all Software updates delivered under Jedox’s Support obligations under this Agreement or any programs or modules licensed by Customer in the future, Customer request that Jedox deliver such updates, programs or modules via Electronic Software Delivery (“ESD”).  Jedox shall use commercially reasonable efforts to secure all file transfers via ESD.  Customer acknowledges that, despite such efforts by Jedox to effect a secure file transfer, including using a non-public server and transferring by appointment only, there remains some level of risk of invasive activity by unknown third parties.

 

 

 

L

 

General terms and conditions for the use of software over the internet (“Software as a Service,” abbreviated “SaaS”) These General Terms and Conditions for the Use of Software over the Internet (these “Terms and Conditions”), together with the Order Form executed and attached hereto (the “Order Form”), and any additional Statements of Work and  any other exhibits, schedules and addenda attached hereto or to the Order Form constitute the software subscription and services agreement (the “Agreement”) made and executed by and between Jedox Inc., a Delaware  corporation (“Jedox”), and the Customer identified on the Order Form (“Customer”).  By executing the signature page to the Order Form, and in consideration of the mutual promises, and upon the terms and conditions set forth below and in the Order Form and intending to be legally bound, Jedox and Customer hereby agree as follows:

 

1.      Definitions

 

“Approved Users” means individuals who are authorized by Customer to access and use the Software, including by remote mobile devices, and who have been supplied user identifications and passwords by Customer (or by Jedox at Customer’s request). Approved Users may include but are not limited to Customer’s employees, consultants, contractors and agents; Customer’s clients/customers and prospective clients/customers; and other third parties with which Customer transacts business.

 

“Confidential Information” means all knowledge or data of an intellectual, technical, scientific, commercial, or industrial nature relating to technology, inventions, concepts, processes, designs, improvements, trademarks, copyrighted materials, trade secrets, and other information of a similar nature in which the disclosing party has a confidential interest or has a legal duty to protect, including without limitation the Software, Documentation, Trade Secrets, object code and machine-readable copies of the Software, source code of or relating to the Software (if applicable), and any other proprietary information (including proprietary information of third parties) supplied to Customer by Jedox, or by Customer to Jedox, or, in the case of the Software, the Documentation and any information relating to Jedox’s pricing and costs, regardless of whether so marked.

 

“Customer” means the party or parties identified on the Order Form.

 

“Customer Data” means all electronic data or information submitted by Customer and Approved Users through the Software and stored or processed on the Jedox Server.

 

“Customer Support” means services such as Software maintenance and support provided by Jedox for the Software, as more fully described herein and in the Order Form.

 

“Documentation” means written materials relating to the Software including but not limited to online help and user instruction files regarding use of the Software, as generally provided by Jedox to licensees of the Software, and shall include any updated versions of Documentation as may be generally provided by Jedox to other licensees of the Software during the Term of the Agreement.

 

“Interface” means any software, firmware or hardware that does not modify the Software, and which is not part of, based upon, or a derivative work of the Software, but which provides an interface for the exchange of data to, from and between the Software and one or more other computer applications programs.

 

“Jedox Server” means the server computer owned, leased or controlled by Jedox (or its data center vendor) that runs or executes the Software and that is made available by Jedox to Customer for remote access via the Internet to allow use of the Software.  The Jedox Server may be changed by Jedox.  There may be more than one Jedox Server.

 

 “Maintenance Release” means any update or modification of the Software, including any correction, bug-fix, patch or other work-around for the Software, created or developed by Jedox during the Term of the Agreement and generally released by Jedox to other licensees of the Software, but excluding a New Version.

 

“New Version” means any new release of the Software which includes material, substantive increases in functional performance, but only if (a) marketed and promoted by Jedox as a new product release and (b) not generally released to existing customers who have a license to use the Software without payment of additional license fees or other consideration.

 

“Order Form” means the document(s) attached hereto and the Schedules thereto, which are incorporated herein by references.  If there is any conflict between the terms of the Order Form and the Agreement, the Order Form shall control.

 

“Professional Services” means those training, implementation and consulting services, as applicable, provided by Jedox, as more fully described below and in the Order Form, and may include basic training services, quick-start services, accelerator services and other consulting services.

 

“Professional Services Fees” has the meaning set forth in Order Form and the Schedules thereto.

 

“Service” means access to the Software, as more fully described in the Order Form, that Customer licenses or otherwise receives from Jedox pursuant to the terms set forth herein and in the Agreement, on a “software-as-a-service” basis.

 

“Software” means the Jedox computer software program, including (i) any modules set forth in an Order Form; (ii) Documentation for the Software and Service specified in an Order Form; (iii) any Interfaces provided by Jedox to Customer; (iii) associated mobile applications; and (iv) any Maintenance Release, New Version, or other modifications, corrections, improvements, enhancements or releases provided by Jedox to Customer as part of Customer Support.  Software shall not include any other products or services currently marketed by Jedox but not included in the Order Form, or any “beta” versions of the Software.

 

“Software Content” which means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

“Subscription Fees” has the meaning set forth in Section 5.1.

 

“Third-Party Software” means software of companies other than Jedox.

 

“Trade Secrets” means all concepts, ideas, formulae, patterns, devices or compilations of information used in a company’s business which may relate to the development, production, licensing, or sale of such company’s goods, products or services, to the management or administration of such company, or which otherwise give it a competitive advantage, which are not publicly known without restriction and without breach of the Agreement.  Trade Secrets include manuals, on-line documentation, business activities and plans, financial results and projections, costs and prices, customers, customer lists, suppliers, software developers, employees, software products and related documentation, any and all techniques, algorithms, data models, stored procedures, schemas, processes (and any modification, revision, extraction or extrapolation thereof), technologies, technical and business strategies, and draft contracts and exhibits exchanged by the parties.

 

2.      License to Use the Service

 

2.1  Grant of License.  Subject to Customer’s performance of its obligations under the Agreement, including without limitation timely payment of all amounts due hereunder, Jedox grants to Customer a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, non-assignable (except as otherwise provided in Section 10.1 below), right and license (without the right to grant sublicenses) to use the Service and the Software through an Interface during the Term of the Agreement for the number of Approved Users specified in the Order Form and the Schedules thereto (the “License”).

 

2.2  Limitation of License.  Except as explicitly set forth in Section 2.1, nothing contained in the Agreement transfers to Customer any license or rights in the Software.  All rights of Jedox not expressly granted to Customer in the Agreement shall be, and hereby are, reserved to Jedox.  The License shall expire at the expiration or termination of the Term of the Agreement.

 

2.3  Delivery; Copying of Documentation.  Promptly following the Effective Date set forth in the Order Form or any later date specified therein, Jedox will deliver to Customer (a) access to the Software via the Internet and (b) access to an electronic copy of the Documentation.  Subject to the requirements of Section 8 of this Agreement, Customer may reproduce the Documentation for its own internal use in connection with the use of the Software by printing the electronic files and the online help files.  Customer is responsible, at its expense, for obtaining and using all Internet access, equipment, software (e.g., compatible web browser), and third-party services needed by Customer for access to and use of the Software.  Jedox may provide specifications or requirements for such Internet access, equipment, software, and third-party services in writing and may update or revise such specifications and requirements from time to time in writing.  It is the responsibility of Customer to meet the then-current specifications and requirements in order to use the Service and exercise the License.

 

2.4  Updates and Enhancements.  The Software and its features as well as Software Content and functionality are subject to change by Jedox from time to time as implemented in updated or enhanced versions of the Software.  Such updates and enhancements may affect the Software’s features, functionality, and components.  Software features, functionality, and components may be added, deactivated temporarily, altered, or permanently removed by Jedox without notice to Customer; provided that core features and functionality will not be removed without an equivalent alternative being provided at no additional charge.  As updated or enhanced versions of the Software are installed by Jedox on the Jedox Server for access and use by Customer under the License, and to the extent that such updates do not constitute a new and unique product of Jedox, such versions, updates and enhancements will become part of the Software governed by the Agreement and subject to the License.

 

2.5    Maintenance of Software.  Jedox is responsible for maintenance of the Software and for testing and installing maintenance fixes, patches and New Versions of the Software on the Jedox Server, and, where applicable, providing updates for any Software installed locally on Customer’s computers and Approved Users’ mobile devices.  All decisions concerning the correction of errors and the implementation of corrections, fixes, patches, new versions, and/or work-around solutions, including, without limitation, the timing thereof, shall be made by Jedox in its judgment and discretion.

 

2.6    Approved User Permissions and Administrative Settings.  Customer is responsible for setting up and customizing all user permissions and features of the Software for its individual Approved Users.  Such user permissions allow an employee of Customer to access a wider or narrower set of Software features and to access administrative functions.  Customer is solely responsible for terminating or editing its employees’ user permissions when an employee is terminated or such employee’s responsibilities no longer require access to specific administrative features.  Jedox is not responsible for any losses associated with Customer’s failure to effectively maintain user permissions and administrative settings.

 

3.      License Restrictions

 

Customer agrees that it shall not itself, or through any parent, subsidiary, affiliate, agent or any other third party:

 

A.     Make the Software available to anyone other than Approved Users.

B.     License, sell or lease the Software or Documentation to, or permit the use of the Software by or for the primary benefit of, any third party.

C.     Attempt, or knowingly permit or encourage others to attempt to modify, decompile, decipher, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise decrypt or discover the source code of all or any portion of the Software.

D.     Use the Software or the Service to store or transmit material in violation of third-party privacy rights.

E.     Use the Software or the Service to store or transmit viruses and other malicious code.

F.     Interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of the Software or the Service or third-party data contained therein.

G.    Attempt to gain unauthorized access to the Software, the Service or the related systems or networks.

H.     Write or develop any derivative works based on the Software.

I.       Except for use as contemplated in Section 2 herein, use the Software or the Service to provide processing services to third parties, to provide commercial timesharing, rental or sharing arrangements to any third parties, on a “service bureau” basis or otherwise, or to otherwise allow any third party to directly or indirectly use the Software for itself or for the benefit of any other party.

J.      Violate any additional license restrictions set forth in the Order Form; or

K.     Use any portion of the Software or the Service in any manner except as expressly provided in this Agreement.

 

4.   Customer Support

 

Jedox will provide support and maintenance services pursuant to the General Terms and Conditions for Software Support Contracts, attached to the Order Form and incorporated herein by reference.  To the extent that any of the terms set forth in the General Terms and Conditions for Software Support Contracts are inconsistent with Sections 2.4 or 2.5 hereof or inapplicable for software operated remotely by Jedox as a service, those terms shall not apply to this Agreement.

 

5.   Software Content

 

Jedox will provide Software Content pursuant to the General Terms and Conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of standard software of Jedox Inc.

 

6.      Payments

 

6.1  Subscription Fees and Other Fees.  Customer shall timely pay Jedox the Subscription Fees and any other fees specified in the Order Form on or before the due dates specified on such Order Form.  Except as otherwise set forth in the applicable Order Form, all fees and charges shall be paid in U. S. Dollars.  The Subscription Fees for the initial 12-month Term will be paid at the commencement of the Initial Term.   All Subscription Fees are due on the payment date(s) specified in the Order Form.  If, and to the extent the Order Form does not specify the due date for particular fees or charges hereunder, all such amounts shall be due within thirty (30) days after the date of Jedox’s invoice to Customer.  All amounts remaining unpaid after the applicable due date will accrue interest from the applicable due date until paid in full at a rate equal to the lesser of 1.5% per month or the highest contract interest rate allowed by law, from the date due until paid.  All fees set forth in this Agreement may be raised by Jedox not more than once per year.

 

6.2  The Subscription Fee for additional users will be billed at the then current rate, unless a different rate is contained in this Agreement.  The fee for users added will be due and payable within 30 days after the number of users exceeds the contracted number.

 

6.3  All invoices are due and payable upon receipt in US dollars.  Late payment charges will be imposed at the rate of 1.5% per month, including any fees overdue for an increase in the number of users.

 

6.4  Taxes.  Subscription Fees and any other amounts payable pursuant to the Agreement exclude any applicable sales and use taxes, transaction privilege tax, excise tax, tangible or intangible personal property taxes, or value added taxes on the sale or measured by the sales price (collectively “Tax” or “Taxes”).  Customer is solely responsible for the payment of all Taxes and will pay to Jedox or the applicable taxing authorities the amount of any Taxes, including without limitation any applicable interest or penalties in connection therewith, that Jedox or Customer is or becomes obligated to pay based on the license or delivery of the Software or delivery of Customer Support or other Professional Services.

 

7.      Limited Warranties and Limitation of Liability; Responsibility for Third Parties

 

7.1  Jedox Limited Warranties.

 

(a)   Jedox warrants to Customer for the Term of the Agreement that the Software shall perform substantially in accordance with the Documentation provided to Customer by Jedox from time to time and in accordance with the terms of the Uptime Commitment attached hereto as Exhibit A. Jedox does not warrant that the Software shall operate in combination with other software selected by Customer other than any Third-Party Software or other software noted in the Order Form or the Documentation, or that the Software shall operate uninterrupted or free of errors.  If the Software does not perform as warranted in this Section 6.1(a), and Jedox is able to reproduce the error, Customer’s sole and exclusive remedy shall be as follows: Jedox shall undertake reasonable efforts to correct the Software, and if after undertaking such reasonable efforts, Jedox determines that it is unable to correct the Software, Customer will have the right, in accordance with the terms hereof, to terminate the Agreement.

 

(b)   Jedox warrants to Customer that it shall use commercially reasonable efforts to perform Customer Support in a professional and workmanlike manner.  Customer agrees that the sole and exclusive remedy for a breach of this warranty is for Jedox to undertake reasonable efforts to re-perform the specific Customer Support services that fail to comply with the foregoing warranty as specified in Section 6.1(a). 

 

7.2  Warranty Conditions and Limitations.  The limited warranties in Section 6.1 are made to and for the benefit of Customer only and are conditioned upon Customer’s compliance with the terms of the Agreement, the Documentation and other reasonable instructions provided by Jedox.  These limited warranties shall not apply to the extent that Software fails to perform as warranted under Section 6.1(a) because of and would not have so failed but for: (a) use of the Software in connection or in combination with any computer hardware or software not expressly approved or recommended by Jedox in writing; or (b) use of the Software contrary to the specifications and directions contained in the Documentation or other reasonable instructions of Jedox.

 

7.3  Disclaimers.  EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN SECTION 6.1(a), THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED STRICTLY “AS IS,” AND Jedox MAKES NO ADDITIONAL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED, ARISING FROM COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE, OR STATUTORY, AS TO THE SOFTWARE OR ANY MATTER WHATSOEVER.  IN PARTICULAR, EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN SECTION 6.1, ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING IN LAW OR FROM COURSE OF DEALING, COURSE OF PERFORMANCE, OR USE OF TRADE ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED.  THIS IS A LIMITED WARRANTY AND IS THE ONLY WARRANTY MADE BY Jedox. CUSTOMER HEREBY DISCLAIMS ANY RELIANCE ON ANY WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION NOT EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT. 

 

7.4  Liability Limitations.  Jedox SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO CUSTOMER OR ANY THIRD PARTY FOR ANY LOSS OF PROFITS, LOSS OF USE, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, LOSS OF DATA, COST OF RECREATING LOST DATA, COST OF COVER OR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY KIND IN CONNECTION WITH OR ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FURNISHING, PERFORMANCE OR USE OF THE SOFTWARE, MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT, OR OTHER ITEMS OR SERVICES PROVIDED HEREUNDER OR ANY DELAY IN DELIVERY OR FURNISHING THE SOFTWARE, MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT, OR SAID ITEMS OR SERVICES EVEN IF Jedox HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY TERM OF THIS AGREEMENT, Jedox’s MAXIMUM AGGREGATE LIABILITY (WHETHER IN CONTRACT OR IN TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER FORM OF LIABILITY, INCLUDING INDEMNIFICATION) FOR DAMAGES OR LOSS, HOWSOEVER ARISING OR CAUSED, WHETHER OR NOT ARISING FROM Jedox’s ACTIONS, SHALL IN NO EVENT BE GREATER THAN THE FEES PAID TO Jedox BY CUSTOMER DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS PRIOR TO THE DATE OF THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO SUCH LIABILITY. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.

 

7.5  Accessibility and Downtime.  Access to and use of Software may be temporarily down, inaccessible, or deactivated due to maintenance, upgrades, equipment failure, power failure, and/or other scheduled or unscheduled downtimes or interruptions, and Jedox shall not be liable to Customer or any third party for any such circumstances except in excess of those provided in the Uptime Commitment attached hereto as Exhibit A.  Jedox will use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that maintenance and downtime occur during non-peak hours and that the Software performs in accordance with industry standards.

 

7.6    Responsibility for Approved Users.  Customer is solely responsible for third parties who use or access the Service.  Customer is solely responsible for any contract entered into with such third parties and for any obligations, warranties or representations made to such third parties.  Jedox has no obligation to provide any telephone, email or other type of support to any third parties.  Any contacts, inquiries or questions from third parties to Jedox will be referred to Customer.  All disputes between Customer and third parties, whether or not relating to any information, data or forms available on or through the Software, will be settled by and between Customer and such third party.  Jedox bears no responsibility for resolving such disputes and has no obligation to be involved in any way in any such dispute.  Customer shall also indemnify and hold Jedox harmless from any claims made by third parties that relate to the subject matter of the Agreement in accordance with the indemnification provisions set forth in Section 7 below.

 

7.7  Customer’s Responsibilities. Customer shall (i) be responsible for Approved Users’ compliance with this Agreement, (ii) be responsible for the accuracy, quality and legality of Customer Data and of the means by which Customer acquired Customer Data, (iii) use commercially reasonable efforts to implement and follow data protection practices that prevent unauthorized access to or use of the Service, and notify Jedox promptly of any such unauthorized access or use, (iv) use the Software only in accordance with the Documentation and applicable laws and government regulations, and (v) back up its data regularly and before Jedox performs previously- announced maintenance on the Service.

 

7.8  Exclusion of Unauthorized Warranties.  No employee, agent, representative or affiliate of Jedox has authority to bind Jedox to any oral representations or warranty concerning the Software or Customer Support.  Any written representation or warranty not expressly contained in the Agreement is not authorized and is unenforceable.  Any description of the Software contained on Jedox’s website or promotional materials is for the sole purpose of identifying the Software, and any such description is not a part of the basis of the bargain and does not constitute a warranty that the Software shall conform to that description.  No affirmation of fact or promise made by Jedox, on its website or otherwise, shall constitute a warranty that the Software will conform to the affirmation or promise.

 

7.9  Customer Representations and Warranties.  Customer represents, warrants and covenants that (a) it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of its state of organization, and has all power and authority to operate its business and conduct its business as presently conducted, and to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under the Agreement; (b) the Agreement, upon execution by the signatory, will have been duly and validly executed and delivered by it, has been duly and validly authorized by all company action, and constitutes the legal, valid, and binding obligation of Customer; (c) the execution, delivery, and performance of the Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby will not conflict with or any judgment or decree or any agreement or other instrument to which Customer is a party; and (d) it is not a government agency and it is not acquiring the license granted by the Agreement pursuant to any government contract or with government funds.

 

8.      Indemnification

 

8.1  Indemnification by Jedox.  Jedox will defend at its expense any action brought against Customer to the extent based on a claim that the Software, when used within the scope of this Agreement, infringes a U.S. or European patent, copyright or trade secret.  Subject to the limitation set forth in Section 6.4, Jedox will pay any costs and damages finally awarded against Customer in such action that are attributable to such claim, provided that Customer promptly notify Jedox in writing of the claim, allow Jedox to control the defense, provide Jedox with the information and assistance necessary for the defense and/or settlement of the claim, and do not agree to any settlement without Jedox’s prior written consent.  Should the Software become, or in Jedox’s opinion be likely to become, the subject of any claim of infringement, Jedox may at its option (i) procure for Customer the right to continue using the Software, (ii) replace or modify the Software so as to make it non-infringing, or, if (i) and (ii) are not commercially reasonable, (iii) terminate the license granted hereunder and refund the amounts paid for such license.  Jedox will have no liability for any claim of infringement based upon (i) use of other than the latest unmodified release of the Software available to Customer if such infringement would have been avoided by the use of such release, (ii) use or combination of the Software with other programs or data if such infringement would not have occurred without such use or combination, or (iii) use of the Software after receiving notice from a third party, or having reason to believe, that the Software infringes a patent, copyright or trade secret right of a third party unless prompt written notice thereof is given to Jedox. The forgoing states the exclusive remedy of Customer and Jedox’s entire liability with respect to infringement of patents, copyrights, trade secrets or other proprietary rights. THE FOREGOING SETS FORTH JEDOX’S EXCLUSIVE OBLIGATION AND LIABILITY FOR INFRINGEMENT OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.

 

8.2  Indemnification by Customer; Responsibility for Parties.  Customer shall indemnify and defend Jedox and its officers, directors, employees and representatives against, and hold them harmless from: (a) any claims or allegations against Jedox that arise from Customer’s failure to comply with governmental regulations, Customer’s interaction with its customers, in each case when Jedox reasonably alleges that Customer is at fault or in breach of its duties in respect of such matter (including any misuse or unauthorized access by (or permitted by) Customer or an employee of Customer), and (b) any litigation, arbitration, judgments, awards, settlements, damages, expenses, losses, attorneys’ fees, and costs arising from or relating to any such claims or allegations. Customer is responsible for its employees, agents, and affiliates who use the Software and Customer shall defend and indemnify Jedox for any liability caused by the improper, negligent, reckless or fraudulent use of the Software by any employee, agent or affiliate of Customer.

 

9.      Confidential Information and Ownership

 

9.1  Mutual Covenants.  Each party acknowledges that the other party’s Confidential Information constitutes valuable trade secrets and agrees that it shall use the other party’s Confidential Information solely in accordance with the provisions of the Agreement and shall not disclose, or permit to be disclosed, the same, directly or indirectly, except as required by law, to any third party without the disclosing party’s prior written consent, and shall safeguard the disclosing party’s Confidential Information from unauthorized use and disclosure using measures that are equal to the standard of performance used by the recipient party to safeguard its own Confidential Information of comparable value, but in no event less than reasonable care.  However, Confidential Information of a party does not include information that (a) is rightfully publicly available, (b) has been rightfully obtained by the recipient party from third parties without restrictions on disclosure, or (c) was independently developed by the recipient party without reference to the disclosing party’s Confidential Information.  Both parties agree that neither party shall disclose the terms of the Agreement, except as required by law.

 

9.2  Injunctive Relief.  In the event of actual or threatened breach of the provisions of Section 8.1, which the parties hereby agree would cause irreparable harm, the non-breaching party shall be entitled to immediate injunctive and other equitable relief, without bond and without the necessity of showing actual damage.

 

9.3  Ownership.  Jedox’s business methods, know-how, the Software, the Documentation, Confidential Information, trademarks, tradenames and any other proprietary information, and any and all derivative works thereof, plans, prices, configurations, specifications, techniques, algorithms, schemas, screen prints and processes contained herein, or any modification, extraction, or extrapolations thereof (including improvements and revisions made during the Term hereof regardless of the source of such idea for the improvement or revision), are the property and trade secrets of Jedox and are subject to copyright protection and other proprietary rights.  Any lack of a copyright notice does not imply unrestricted or public access. No duplication, usage, disclosure, or publication thereof, in whole or in part, for any purpose is permitted, except that which is expressly permitted by the Agreement.  Customer shall include in all copies made by it notices of copyright and other proprietary rights included by Jedox in the Documentation, or any and all derivative works thereof.  Customer specifically agrees that any and all derivative works of the Software and the Documentation shall be the property of Jedox and Customer hereby assigns all title and ownership interest therein, if any, to Jedox.

 

9.4  Jedox’s Protection of Customer Data. Jedox shall maintain appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data.  Jedox shall not (a) modify Customer Data, (b) disclose Customer Data except as compelled by law in accordance with Section 8.1 or as expressly permitted in writing by Customer, or (c) access Customer Data except to provide access to the Software and prevent or address service or technical problems, or at Customer’s request in connection with customer support matters. Jedox undertakes to ensure that access to customer data is restricted to technical support, cloud operations and consulting teams, and only if they directly require access to the data in order to fulfill Jedox’s obligations in accordance with this Agreement and the relevant data protection laws. Jedox shall ensure that the confidentiality obligations stipulated in this Agreement are enforced.

 

 

10.   Term and Termination

 

10.1           Term.  The initial Term (“Initial Term”) is set forth Order Form. If not specified in the Order Form, the Initial Subscription Term is for twelve (12) months.  The initial Term will automatically extend for additional 12-month periods unless either party notifies the other in writing of its intention not to extend, no less than ninety (90) days before the end of the Initial Term.  The Subscription Term will expire, and this Agreement will terminate, at the end of any Term in which a timely notice of non-extension is delivered and received.

 

10.2           Termination for Cause.  If a party defaults in performing any material obligations required under the Agreement, the other “non-defaulting” party may give written notice of its intention to terminate the Agreement, describing in reasonable detail the default.  If the party in default fails to remedy such material default within thirty (30) days (ten (10) days for a payment default) following such written notice, or if such default is not capable of cure within such thirty (30) day period, or if the party in default fails to commence cure procedures within such thirty (30) day period, then the non-defaulting party may, in addition to all other remedies available at law or in equity, terminate the Agreement. 

 

10.3           Termination Due to Insolvency.  Either party will have the right to terminate the Agreement by providing prior notice to other party (the “Insolvent Party”) upon occurrence of any of the following circumstances with respect to the Insolvent Party: (a) the filing by or against the Insolvent Party of a petition for reorganization or liquidation under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or corresponding laws or procedures of any applicable jurisdiction; (b) the filing by or against the Insolvent Party of any other proceeding concerning bankruptcy, insolvency, dissolution, cessation of operations, reorganization of indebtedness, or the like by the Insolvent Party (if such proceeding is involuntary and is contested in good faith, the Agreement will terminate only after the passage of one hundred twenty (120) days without the dismissal of such proceedings); (c) the voluntary or involuntary execution upon the assignment or conveyance to a liquidating agent, trustee, mortgages or assignee of whatever description; or the making of any judicial levy against a substantial percentage of the Insolvent Party’s assets, for the benefit of its creditors; (d) the appointment of a receiver, keeper, liquidator or custodian of whatever sort or description, for all or a substantial portion of the Insolvent Party’s assets; or (e) the termination, dissolution, insolvency, or its cessation to continue all or substantially all of the Insolvent Party’s business affairs.

 

10.4           Effect of Termination.

 

(a)   In the event the Agreement is terminated due to Customer’s default, Customer shall immediately pay all Subscription Fees and other amounts due to Jedox through the then current Term of the Agreement, and shall immediately discontinue use of and shall return to Jedox all Software, Documentation and any Confidential Information of Jedox.

 

(b)    In the event the Agreement is terminated due to any reason other than Customer’s default, (i) Customer shall pay all Subscription Fees and other fees accrued through the date of such termination, and (ii) Jedox shall refund any unused portion of any pre-paid Subscription Fees and Professional Services Fees.

 

(c)   Section 1 (“Definitions”), Section 5 (“Payments”), Section 6 (“Warranties and Limitation of Liability”), Section 8 (“Confidential Information and ownership”), Section 9 (“Term and Termination”) and Section 10 (“General”) shall survive any termination or expiration of the Agreement.  Termination is not an exclusive remedy and all other remedies will be available whether or not termination occurs.

 

11.   General

 

11.1 Assignment/Binding Nature.  Neither the Agreement nor any rights or obligations under the Agreement may be assigned or otherwise transferred by Customer, in whole or in part, whether voluntary or by operation of law or in connection with a merger or sale of stock or assets that results in a change of control.  This Agreement and the rights and obligations of Jedox under the Agreement may be assigned, without the consent of Customer, by Jedox to any entity which is a wholly owned subsidiary or parent of Jedox, which survives a merger in which Jedox participates or to any entity which acquires all or substantially all of the assets of Jedox or substantially all of Jedox’s interests in the product suite which contains the Software.  Subject to the foregoing, the Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the parties and their respective permitted successors and assigns.

 

11.2 Notices.  Any notice required or permitted under the terms of the Agreement or required by law must be in writing and must be (a) delivered in person, (b) sent by registered mail return receipt requested, (c) sent by overnight air courier, (d) by facsimile, or (e) sent via electronic mail to the recipient(s) named herein at the email addresses set forth herein.  If to Jedox, a notice shall be forwarded to Jedox at: Jedox Inc. 50 Milk Street, 14th Floor, Boston, MA 02109.  If to Customer, a notice shall be forwarded to Customer at the address set forth in the Order Form.  Notices shall be considered to have been given at the time of actual receipt, five business days after posting if sent by registered mail, one business day after delivery to an overnight air courier service, or upon receipt of machine confirmation of successful transmission by facsimile.

 

11.3 Force Majeure.  Except obligations to pay fees, neither party shall incur any liability to the other party on account of any loss or damage resulting from any delay or failure to perform all or any part of the Agreement if such delay or failure is caused, in whole or in part, by events, occurrences, or causes beyond the control and without negligence of the parties.  Such events, occurrences or causes shall include, without limitation, acts of God, strikes, lockouts, riots, acts of war, earthquakes, fire and explosions, but the delay or failure to meet financial obligations under this Agreement is expressly excluded.

 

11.4 Waiver.  The failure of either party to enforce at any time any of the provisions hereof or exercise any right or option hereunder shall not be construed to be a waiver of the right of such party thereafter to enforce any such provisions or exercise such right or option.  Any consent by any party to, or waiver of, a breach by the other, shall not constitute consent to, waiver of, or excuse of any other, different or subsequent breach.

 

11.5 Severability.  If any term, condition, or provision in this Agreement is found to be invalid, unlawful or unenforceable to any extent, then the meaning of said provision shall be construed, to the extent feasible, so as to render the provision enforceable, such term, condition or provision shall be severed from the remaining terms, conditions and provisions, which remaining terms shall continue to be valid and enforceable to the fullest extent permitted by law.

 

11.6 Entire Agreement; Modification and Amendment; Headings.  These Terms and Conditions together with the Order Form and any exhibits, schedules or addenda attached hereto or to the Order Form contains the entire agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter of the Agreement and supersede all previous or contemporaneous communications, representations, understandings and agreements, either oral or written, between the parties.  This Agreement may not be altered, modified, amended, changed, rescinded or discharged in whole or in part, except by written agreement executed by authorized officers of both Customer and Jedox.

 

11.7 No Third-Party Beneficiaries.  The parties agree and acknowledge that the Agreement is not made for the benefit of any third-party.  Nothing in the Agreement, whether expressed or implied, is intended to confer upon any person other than the parties hereto and their respective heirs, representatives, successors and permitted assigns, any rights or remedies under or by reason of the Agreement, nor is anything in the Agreement intended to relieve or discharge the liability of either party hereto, nor shall any provision hereof give any entity any right of subrogation against or action over or against either Party.

 

11.8 Relationship of Parties.  The parties are independent contractors and not the franchisee, partner, or agent of each other. Neither party shall have the right to make any representations on behalf of the other.

 

11.9      Standard Terms of Customer.  No terms, provisions or conditions of any purchase order, acknowledgement or other business form that Customer may use in connection with the acquisition or licensing of the Software shall have any effect on the rights, duties or obligations of the parties hereunder, or otherwise modify, the Agreement, regardless of any failure of Jedox to object to such terms, provisions or conditions.  Customer shall, and hereby does, waive, and agree to indemnify Jedox from and against, any claim, demand or cause of action that is inconsistent with the foregoing.

 

11.10    Publicity.  Neither party shall use the name of the other in publicity releases or advertising, including customer lists, or for other promotional purposes, without securing the prior written approval of the other party hereto.

 

11.11    Counterparts.  The Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which so executed shall be deemed to be an original and such counterparts together shall constitute one and the same agreement.  Facsimile signatures on counterparts of the Agreement will be deemed original signatures.

 

11.12    Applicable Law.  This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, without regard to the application of conflicts of law principles.  Except for actions initiated by either party to this Agreement for injunctive relief to enforce its rights pursuant to Section 8.2 above, any dispute or claim arising in connection with this Agreement will be adjudicated in the appropriate courts located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

 

11.13    Recruitment of Personnel.  During the Term of the Agreement and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, neither Jedox nor Customer will solicit, hire, employ or contract with directly or indirectly any employee(s) of the other party, and will not hire, employ or contract with directly or indirectly any former employee(s) of the other party for a period of one hundred twenty (120) days following termination of such employee’s employment.

 

 

 

 

EXHIBIT A

UPTIME COMMITMENT

 

 

Commitment

 

Jedox commits to provide 99.0% uptime with respect to the Customer’s Service during each calendar year of the Term, excluding regularly scheduled maintenance times and Force Majeure events (as defined in Section 10.3).

 

If in any calendar year  this uptime commitment is not met by Jedox and Customer was negatively impacted (i.e., attempted to log into or access the Service and failed due to the unscheduled downtime), Jedox and Customer shall review the annual average availability after every contractual year. If the annual average availability falls below 98 percent, Jedox compensates Customer proportionately relating to unavailability and yearly payments made.

 

Scheduled and Unscheduled Maintenance

 

Regularly scheduled support and maintenance time as well as scheduled disconnections or shutdowns (“Maintenance Time”) do not count as downtime. The Maintenance time is regularly scheduled if it is communicated in accordance with the notice section set forth below. Regularly scheduled maintenance time typically is communicated over the Jedox Cloud Console (http://knowledgebase.jedox.com/knowledgebase/jedox-production-cloud/) or is directly agreed upon between Jedox and customer. The duration of regularly scheduled maintenance time is depending on the customer’s data size, but shall take less than 60 hours each quarter if no other time is agreed upon.

 

Likewise, periods during which Jedox temporarily limits the availability of contractual services due to (i) an urgent threat of the data, the hard and/or software infrastructure or the data, the hard and/or software infrastructure of the customer because of external hazards (e.g. viruses, port-hacking, attacks by Trojans), or (ii) a substantial threat to the security of network operation or the maintenance of network integrity, are not to be deemed as unavailability.

 

Jedox in its sole discretion may take the Service down for unscheduled maintenance and in that event will attempt to notify customer in advance in accordance with the Notice section set forth below. Such unscheduled maintenance will be counted against the uptime guarantee.

 

Credit Request

 

In order to receive a credit under this uptime commitment, Customer must request it simply by emailing Jedox, within ten days of the end of the applicable year. If Customer submits a credit request and does not receive a prompt automated response indicating that the request was received, Customer must resubmit the request because the submission was not properly received and will not result in a credit. Customers who are past due or in default with respect to any payment or any material contractual obligations to Jedox are not eligible for any credit under this Service Level Commitment. Jedox shall calculate any service level downtime using Jedox’s system logs and other records.

 

 

 

M

 

General Terms and Conditions of Business for the Sale of Standard Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content  of Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068 (Jedox)

(as of December 2017)

 

I.             Introductory Provisions

 

1.            General, Definitions, Scope of Contract

 

1.1          Offers and deliveries of Jedox, present or future, relating to the sale of perpetual licenses of standard software  and/ or Jedox Software Content (in the following “Software”) made in relation to the persons or entities listed in clause I.1.3 herein take place solely on the basis of the present General Terms and Conditions of Business for the Sale of Software ("License Terms "). Jedox does not recognize any general terms and conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than the License Terms in Business Transactions of Jedox.

 

1.2          “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

 

1.3          These License Terms shall only apply to persons or organisations who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity at the commencement of the agreement (”entrepreneurs”). They do not apply to natural persons who enter into the agreement or acquire software or services from Jedox for personal, domestic or household purposes or another purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity (“consumers”).

 

1.4          Where other products or services are acquired from Jedox, such as Jedox support services, Jedox training services, Jedox cloud services or Jedox business transaction services, other Jedox terms and conditions may apply to the provision of those services. 

 

2.            Subject of Contract, Conclusion of Contract

 

2.1          The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly, the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2          The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

2.3          By accepting an offer from Jedox or placing an order with Jedox in respect of Jedox software, the customer agrees that it has read, understood and will be bound by these License Terms in Business Transactions, together with the written order confirmation of Jedox and any notices posted by Jedox on its website from time to time pursuant to these License Terms in Business Transactions. If you are entering into these License Terms in Business Transactions as an agent, officer, employee or other representative of the customer, you warrant to Jedox that you have full legal authority to bind the customer to these License Terms in Business Transactions.

 

 

2.4          The content of any contractual relationship and the scope of delivery are governed solely by these License Terms and the written confirmation of order of Jedox; however, in the event of a binding offer on part of Jedox and its acceptance within the specified period, the contractual relationship is governed by these License Terms in Business Transactions and the written offer of Jedox. Collateral agreements, verbal statements given by any employees or agents of Jedox or any related entity of Jedox as well as changes or amendments to confirmed contracts (including changes to the products) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing to be effective; such written confirmation provided via fax or email shall be sufficient.

 

2.5          The details of the Jedox software to be licensed to the customer will be as set out or referred to in the written confirmation of order or as otherwise agreed by the parties in writing.

 

 

3.            Product Descriptions, Offer and Quotation Documents, Reservation of Right to Make Modifications

 

3.1          Product descriptions on Jedox’s homepage, with test programs, in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not create any warranty as to quality, nature or description of any Jedox product.

 

3.2          The customer acknowledges that nothing in these License Terms grants the customer any ownership of or rights in respect of the intellectual property in the Jedox software, the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox or any improvements to the aforementioned created under or in connection with these License Terms.  Any intellectual property in respect of the Jedox software or the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox which is created by or vests in the customer is assigned to Jedox immediately upon the intellectual property being created or vesting in the customer and the customer agrees to do all things and execute all documents as is reasonably necessary to effect such assignment.

 

3.3          Jedox reserves the right to ownership of and title over, copyrights and intellectual or industrial property rights (including the right to register any such rights) in all Jedox’s offer and quotation documents, in particular in test programs, illustrations and cost estimates. The documents listed above must be immediately returned to Jedox at Jedox’s request if an offer by Jedox is not accepted or otherwise on written demand by Jedox.

 

3.4          If test programs are provided or made available by Jedox, these programs are provided by Jedox on a temporary basis and free of charge and, to the extent permitted by law, Jedox does not accept any liability in relation to the provision of test programs, the use of test programs or the provision of services in relation to test programs.

3.5          Jedox reserves the right to make technical changes and modifications in respect of the applicable Jedox software, product or service, provided that the usual use of the Jedox software, product or service or such use provided for under the contract, is not significantly or detrimentally impaired.

 

 

II. Conditions for the sale of Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content

 

4.            Customer responsibilities and obligations

 

4.1          The customer will be responsible for:

(a)    the day to day use of the Jedox software;
