(b)    obtaining all consents, permits or approvals necessary to use the Jedox software;

(c)    ensuring that the use of the Jedox software by the customer complies with all applicable laws, regulations or codes of conduct;

(d)    satisfying itself that the Jedox software is compatible with its own hardware, software and internet and network capabilities and maintaining all hardware, software, third party applications and other technology necessary to be able to access and use the Jedox software;

(e)    any acts or omissions committed by the employees, officers, contractors or representatives of the customer or any of its related parties in relation to the Jedox software.

 

4.2          The customer must:

(a)    use the Jedox software only for its internal business purposes;

(b)    only use and copy the documentation and other materials provided by Jedox in connection with the Jedox software to the extent necessary to use the Jedox software;

(c)    comply with all policies regarding the Jedox software which Jedox notifies the customer of from time to time (which notification may be provided by Jedox making the relevant policies accessible via its website);

(d)    not use the Jedox software in any way or for any purpose other than as contemplated by these License Terms in Business Transactions;

(e)    not modify, adapt, reverse engineer, translate, de-compile, disassemble or copy all or any part of the Jedox software;

(f)     not attempt to circumvent or break any encryption, decryption or other security device or technological protection measure contained in the Jedox software;

(g)   not undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

(h)    in case he purchases a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, license the third-party Software accordingly.

(i)     not distribute any part of the Jedox software for commercial purposes or otherwise sub-licence or resell the Jedox software;

(j)     not create derivative works from all or any part of the Jedox software;

(k)    not transfer, assign, rent, lease, lend, sell or otherwise dispose of all or any part of the Jedox software; and

(l)     not make any part of the Jedox software publicly available.

 

 

5.            Delivery Period

 

5.1          Delivery periods (including any timeframes, milestones or delivery dates in relation to the provision of Jedox software or services) are only binding if Jedox expressly confirmed them in writing. Any service periods expressed by Jedox as being a target or estimate will not be binding on Jedox.

 

4.1          Delivery of Jedox standard software being service provision by Jedox) is handled through electronic transmission of the license key to the email address provided by customer on the order document (quotation). Alternatively, customer may request to receive license key by fax or letter. The respective, current version of Jedox standard software can be downloaded from Jedox’s website using the provided license key; the respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

5.2           

 

5.3          In case of delay in delivery of Jedox software or the provision of a service by Jedox, including a delay caused by an event of force majeure or any and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after the commencement of the contract and for which Jedox is not responsible, which have an effect on the provision of the service owed, the service period shall be duly extended by such period as Jedox reasonably determines. This shall apply even if these delaying circumstances occur at upstream suppliers of Jedox. Jedox will inform the customer as soon as possible of any such delays or impediments. If the delay or impediment persists for longer than three months, or if it is established that it shall persist for longer than three months, Jedox as well as the customer may terminate the contract effective immediately on providing written notice of termination to the other party.

 

5.4          Any liability of Jedox for any loss, however caused (including by the negligence of Jedox), suffered by the customer in connection with a delay by Jedox in delivering the Jedox software or providing any service is limited to an amount equivalent to 15% of the total value of the delivery (with the total value of delivery being the total amounts paid to Jedox by the Customer for the licence of the Jedox software or the provision of the relevant service). The limitation of liability in this clause 5.3 shall not apply in the event of default due to willful misconduct by Jedox or gross negligence by Jedox or in the event of injury to life, body or health caused by negligence or breach of these License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox.

 

6.            Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, the prices shown in Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions do not include Indirect Taxes or other statutory taxes or any shipping costs, which amounts will be payable by the customer in addition to the prices .

 

7.            Terms of Payment, Customer's Ability to Pay, Value Added Tax

 

7.1          Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, Jedox’s invoices shall be due for payment in full without deductions or set-offs within 30 days of the date of invoice. Payment is deemed to have been made from the point at which Jedox obtained unrestricted access to the amount ("Receipt of Payment").

7.2          Checks shall be accepted if agreed between the parties and shall be considered to be payment only once they have been unconditionally credited to Jedox. Any costs and expenses incurred thereby, in particular, bank, discount and other expenses, inclusive of any Indirect Taxes or other taxes thereon, shall be paid by the customer and shall be immediately due for payment.

 

7.3          Set-offs or reductions of the amount payable for counter claims or retention of payment with the effect of a set-off by the customer is only permitted if Jedox provides prior written consent to the set off or reduction (which consent may be given or withheld in the sole discretion of Jedox). This is not applicable if claims of customer are grounded on rectification of a defect or costs for completion of delivery.

 

7.4          If the customer fails to pay any amounts payable to Jedox in respect of the licence of the Jedox software or the provision of the services then (without limiting the other rights of Jedox in respect of the non-payment), from the commencement of the default until the outstanding amount (together with any interest) is paid in full, Jedox may require payment of interest on all unpaid amounts at the rate fixed from time to time by the Attorney General under the Penalty Interest Rates Act 1983 (Vic)..

 

7.5          If after the commencement of the specific contract, it becomes apparent that the payment claim of Jedox or the ability of Jedox to recover payment (including a future payment) from the customer will be endangered by the inability of customer to perform, Jedox shall be entitled to refuse its performance under the contract, including performance any preparatory acts. The right to refuse performance shall cease to exist once payment has been made (including, in the case of a future payment, by the customer making that payment in advance) or customer provides security for payment (which security is acceptable to Jedox in its sole discretion). Jedox can set a time limit for payment or provision of such security. After expiration of such time limit if the relevant payment has not been made or security acceptable to Jedox provided, Jedox may terminate the contract effective immediately upon Jedox providing written notice of termination to customer.

 

7.6          Unless expressly stated otherwise, all fees and other amounts payable by the customer under or in connection with these License Terms in Business Transactions have been calculated without regard to any goods or services tax, value added tax, consumption tax or tax of a similar kind (“Indirect Tax”).  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in these License Terms in Business Transactions, if Indirect Tax is imposed upon or is payable by Jedox under or in connection with these License Terms in Business Transactions, the customer must pay to Jedox an amount equal to the Indirect Tax upon demand by Jedox.

 

7.7          If the customer is required by law to make any deduction or withholding for any taxes from any payments to Jedox under these License Terms in Business Transactions such that Jedox would not receive the full amount of the fees or other amounts payable, the customer agrees to:

(a)    deduct or withhold the amount for taxes from the payment;

(b)   promptly pay the amount deducted to the relevant government authority on time and otherwise in accordance with the relevant law;

(c)    provide to Jedox an original receipt, certificate or other evidence of payment of the deducted or withheld amount; and

(d)    pay an additional amount to Jedox at the same time as the affected payment is due so that, after making the deduction or withholding and any further deductions or withholdings on the additional amount payable under this clause 8.7 (d), Jedox receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received if no deductions or withholdings had been made

 

8.             Customer's Rights related to the Software

 

8.1          If Jedox delivers standard software to the customer against payment of a one-off charge for a licence of any length of time, the customer shall receive the non-exclusive right, for the relevant license duration (subject to termination of the licence pursuant to these License Terms in Business Transactions), to duplicate the software to the extent such duplication is necessary for loading, viewing, running, transferring or saving the software contemporaneously on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum number of users as agreed in the contract ("Agreed Users"). The customer agrees to abide by the provisions relating to Agreed Use and agrees not to make the software available to additional users. Special, separate licenses can be purchased for test, backup or development systems.

 

8.2          To the extent that the standard software transferred free of charge has been licensed as Open Source software, the rights and obligations of the customer shall be those provided in the Open Source license which the software is licensed under. The relevant Open Source license agreement is included in the software.

 

8.3          To the extent that the software transferred free of charge is not Open Source software ("Freeware"), the customer shall have the non-exclusive, non-transferable right, not limited in time, to duplicate the software to the extent necessary to load, demonstrate, run, transfer or save the software ("Agreed Use for Freeware"). The Customer shall only use the software according to this Agreed Use. The Customer is not permitted under any circumstances, without Jedox’s written consent, to sell the software or to transfer the software to third parties free of charge.

 

8.4          The customer has the right to decompile, edit or duplicate the software to the extent that this is necessary to establish the interoperability of the software with other programs or to eliminate errors or bugs in the software. This applies, however, only where Jedox failed upon request to make the relevant, necessary information accessible to the customer within an appropriate time period. The customer is not entitled to decompile, translate, edit, arrange or rework the software in any other manner beyond the above authorization.

 

8.5          The operation of Jedox software for the customer by third party businesses due to outsourcing must only be undertaken with the prior written consent of Jedox.

 

8.6          The customer is not entitled to generate copies or partial copies of the software on other media. This does not apply to the generation of a backup copy. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the words "Backup Copy".

 

8.7          The customer is entitled to sell copies of software purchased from Jedox to third parties only if:

 

8.8          it fully gives up the use of the software and destroys any existing copies of the software;

 

8.9          it notifies Jedox of the name and address of such third party; and

 

8.10       such third party gives to Jedox its consent to be bound by these License Terms in Business Transactions in writing.

 

If the customer violates this clause, the customer shall owe Jedox a contractual penalty of half the amount that the third party would have had to pay under Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions to obtain the software from Jedox, or half the purchase price agreed with the customer, whichever is greater. The customer and Jedox agree that the above amounts represent a genuine and reasonable pre-estimate of some of the loss Jedox will suffer if the customer breaches this clause 8.7.

 

8.11       The customer is not under any circumstances whatsoever entitled to permanently or temporarily rent, lease or otherwise make the software available to third parties. The customer's employees are not third parties for the purposes of these License Terms in Business Transactions, as long as they use the software within their relationship of employment existing and according to the contract.

 

8.12       Upon request, the customer will allow Jedox or a third party acting on behalf of Jedox to investigate if the use of the software is within the restrictions and granted rights by Jedox. The customer will support Jedox in this investigation to its best abilities.

 

8.13       If questions regarding the use of the delivered licenses occur, customer shall in particular consult the respective documentation or the information in the Jedox Knowledge Base (https://knowledgebase.jedox.com).

 

 

9.            Lack of Conformity of the Goods or Documentation with Contract, Notice of Defects, Limitation Period

 

9.1.    To the extent that Jedox transfers standard software, unlimited in time, against payment of a one-time fee, the following  applies:

 

9.1.1  If the purchase is a commercial transaction for both parties, the customer shall inspect the product without delay and report any and all defects in writing, indicating the type and scope of the defect. The report must be received by Jedox within eight working days of the delivery in the case of obvious defects or within eight working days of the discovery in the case of concealed defects. If the report does not fulfil said requirements, the product will be deemed approved.

 

9.1.2 If, after the customer has given notice of lack of conformity, no actual lack of conformity of the product is found, the customer shall reimburse Jedox for the costs and expenses Jedox incurred in connection with the examination and inspection of the goods, provided that the unjustified report of defects is attributable to the fault of the customer.

 

9.1.3     Rights due to defects in quality can only arise if the product has a defect in quality at the time of transfer of risk. No rights due to defects in quality shall arise in the case of improper use or treatment of the product, unsuitable environment or operating conditions, defects caused by changes performed by the customer, insufficient maintenance, etc.

 

9.1.4     Subject to the provisions of clause 9.1.3, the customer may, at Jedox’s discretion, demand supplementary performance in the form of elimination of the defect (rectification) or delivery of a product without any defects (replacement). The expenses required for the supplementary performance shall be borne by the customer if they are higher due to the fact that the product has been transported to a location other than the delivery address of the customer, unless the transport corresponds to its intended use. If Jedox is unwilling or unable to provide rectification/replacement, especially if such is unduly delayed for reasons for which Jedox is responsible, the customer shall, at its own discretion, be entitled to terminate the contract or reduce the purchase price if it cannot be expected to accept further supplementary performance attempts. In the case of a minor defect, the termination of the contract by the customer is subject to Jedox’s approval.

 

9.1.5     Once the customer exercises its right to terminate the contract, its right to use the licensed software shall end. In such case, the customer shall remove the software from all storage media and destroy all copies of the software and notify Jedox of this in writing.

 

9.1.6     Subject to sentence 2 of this paragraph, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is one year. In the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible and in cases of intent and gross negligence, the statute of limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is two years. Each limitation period above shall begin on the date the customer is aware (or ought reasonably to be aware) of the circumstances giving rise to the claim.

 

9.1.7     Jedox’s liability for defects of the goods shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 11.

 

9.2           In case of the granting of the use of software free of charge in accordance with clause 8.2 and 8.3, to the extent permitted by law, Jedox does not accept any liability in relation to the software provided free of charge, the use of software provided free of charge or the provision of services in relation to software provided free of charge.

 

9.3           The customer is solely responsible for ensuring that its access to and use of the software and services of Jedox complies with all applicable laws.

 

10.           Legal defects

 

10.1         In as far as Jedox licences Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

10.1.1      If the product is encumbered by a legal defect, the customer may demand a method of using the product that is not subject to any legal objection or provision of an equivalent product free of such defects. Jedox retains the right to determine which alternative product this may be.

 

10.1.2      The customer agrees to notify Jedox without delay and in writing if any third parties assert industrial or intellectual property rights (e.g. copyright or patent rights) in the product against customer. The customer authorises Jedox to pursue the dispute with the third party on behalf of customer. For as long as Jedox makes use of such authorisation, the customer shall not be permitted to acknowledge any such third party claims without the consent of Jedox; Jedox shall defend against such third party claims at its own expense and indemnify the customer in relation to all costs arising from such defense to the extent that such cost do not arise from of the customer’s breach of obligations (e.g. use of the product in violation of the contract).

 

 

10.1.3      For damages resulting from legal defects of the products, the liability of Jedox shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 11.

 

10.2         In case of software provided free of charge in accordance with clause 8.2 and 8.3, to the extent permitted by law  Jedox does not accept any liability with regards to legal defects in respect of the software provided free of charge.

 

11.           Limitation of Liability

 

11.1         In as far as Jedox licences Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

11.2         The Standard Software, other Jedox software licensed or provided to the customer or the other products or services provided by Jedox to the customer may be subject to consumer guarantees that cannot be excluded under the Australian Consumer Law or other applicable Australian State or Territory consumer protection legislation.  If customer is entitled to any remedy for breach of the consumer guarantees contained in the Australian Consumer Law or any other relevant legislation then nothing in these License Terms in Business Transactions will operate so as to exclude, restrict or modify the application of any of the provisions of the Australian Consumer Law  or any State or Territory consumer protection legislation, the exercise of a right conferred by such a provision, or any liability of Jedox for a breach of a condition, warranty or guarantee implied by such a provision, where the Australian Consumer Law or other relevant legislation would render it void to do so.  To the extent permitted by law, Jedox and its related entities expressly limit their liability for a breach of any condition, warranty or guarantee implied by virtue of any of the Australian Consumer Law or any other relevant legislation to, at the election of Jedox:

(a)    in the case of goods, any one or more of the following:

                                      i.          the replacement of the goods or the supply of equivalent goods;

                                    ii.           the repair of the goods;

                                   iii.          the payment of the cost of replacing the goods or of acquiring equivalent goods; or

                                   iv.          the payment of the cost of having the goods repaired; or

(b)    in the case of services:

                                    v.          the supplying of the services again; or

                                   vi.          the payment of the cost of having the services supplied again.

 

11.2.1       In all other cases of liability of Jedox to the customer, all compensation claims including due to the breach of a duty by Jedox, breach of these License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox and due to tort by Jedox are excluded, so that, to the maximum extent permitted by law, Jedox is not liable for lost profit or other monetary damage incurred by the customer. If Jedox is found to be liable to pay any damages, compensation or other amounts to the customer under or in connection with these License Terms in Business Transactions, such liability will be limited to the amount set out in clause 4.4 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

 

11.2.2      Without limiting any other provisions of these License Terms in Business Transactions, if the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’s liability in cases of negligence which results in data loss shall be limited to the recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

 

11.3         In case of a transfer of software free of charge in accordance with clause 8.1.2 and 8.1.3, Jedox is only liable to the customer for claims for willful misconduct or gross negligence of Jedox, with any liability of Jedox in respect of such claims limited to the amount set out in clause 4.4 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

11.4         Without limiting any other provisions of these License Terms in Business Transactions, Jedox is not liable for any Consequential Loss (however caused) suffered or incurred by the Customer in connection with this agreement or the provision of the services. This clause applies even if Jedox knew or ought to have known that the relevant Consequential Loss would be suffered.  Consequential Loss means loss beyond the normal measure of damages and further includes, without limitation, all indirect loss, all loss of revenue, all loss of reputation, all loss of profits, all loss of data, all loss of actual or anticipated savings, all loss of bargain, all lost opportunities, including opportunities to enter into arrangements with third parties, all loss of use, all cost of capital and all costs of substitute goods, facilities or services.

 

11.5         If Jedox’s liability is excluded or limited due to any of the aforesaid provisions, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

12.           Indemnity

The customer must indemnify and keep Jedox indemnified against any loss which arises directly or indirectly out of:

(a)    any breach of these License Terms in Business Transactions by the customer including any breach in respect of which Jedox exercises a right to terminate;

(b)    the customer or any other person in any way accessing or using the Jedox software;

(c)    any use of the Jedox software by the customer not complying with privacy or other laws of any applicable jurisdiction;

(d)    any negligent or unlawful acts of the customer or any of its related parties or their respective employees, officers, contractors or representatives,

except to the extent the relevant loss arises as a direct result of any breach of these License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox or any grossly negligent or unlawful act of Jedox or any of its personnel.

 

 

13.           Termination

 

13.1         Jedox may terminate these Licence Terms in Business Transactions at any time and without cause by providing the customer with no less than 30 days’ written notice of termination.

 

13.2         Without limiting the above, Jedox may, by written notice to the customer, terminate the agreement with immediate effect if:

(a)    the customer fails to comply with any written notice issued by Jedox requiring the customer to remedy a breach, non-observance or non-performance of the customer’s obligations under these Licence Terms in Business Transactions within seven business days of receiving that notice from Jedox;

(b)    the customer commits a breach of these Licence Terms in Business Transactions which is incapable of remedy;

(c)    the customer goes into liquidation, is wound up, becomes insolvent or has a receiver appointed over all or any substantial part of its assets; or

(d)    the customer proposes or enters into any schemes of arrangements with its creditors.

 

13.3         Notice of termination must be given in writing.

 

13.4         Upon termination of the agreement taking effect:

(a)    the customer must immediately:

                                     i.          pay to Jedox all fees, expenses or other sums payable to Jedox under these Licence Terms in Business Transactions which have accrued or are payable as at the date of termination;

                                   ii.          cease all use of the Jedox software and delete any copies of the Jedox software;

                                  iii.          provide Jedox with written confirmation that it has completed its obligations under this clause 13; and

(b)    Jedox ceases to have any obligations under these License Terms in Business Transactions.

For the avoidance of doubt, following termination of the agreement taking effect, Jedox will be entitled to retain any fees paid by the customer, even if such amounts were paid in advance.

 

14.           Reservation of Ownership Rights

 

The ownership of the products and the rights under clause 8 shall pass to the customer only after payment in full of the purchase price as specified in clause 6. For the avoidance of doubt, Jedox retains ownership of all intellectual property rights in respect of the Standard Software, other Jedox software licensed or provided to the customer and all intellectual property generated by Jedox as a result of its provision of the services and nothing in these License Terms in Business Transactions grants the customer any ownership of or other rights in respect of such intellectual property (other than the licenses granted to the customer under these License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

 

III. Concluding Provisions

 

15.           Compliance Audit of Contract Terms

 

15.1         Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox shall in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license agreements and terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) business days before such an inspection unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

15.2         If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually.

.

 

16.           Confidentiality

 

16.1         The parties hereto each undertake to treat in strict confidence all items (e.g. software, documentation, information) received from or that become known via the other party before the conclusion of or in the performance of the contract and that are protected by law, that include business or operational secrets or that are described as being confidential - during and beyond the term of the contract - unless they become known to the public without infringement of the duty to maintain confidentiality. The parties shall keep and safeguard all such items such that third parties are completely denied access to them.

 

16.2         The customer agrees that it shall make the contractual products available only to those of its employees and other third parties that require such access to perform their respective tasks. The customer agrees to instruct such persons on the need to maintain secrecy and confidentiality with respect to such items.

 

16.3         Jedox shall process customer's data required for the transaction in accordance with any relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations that apply to Jedox as a provider of information technology services (including any applicable provisions of the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth). However customer is solely responsible for ensuring that the use of Jedox software or the services by the customer and the processing of customer’s data by Jedox as required for the transaction will comply with all applicable privacy or data protection laws.

 

16.4         Following successful provision of the services, Jedox shall be entitled to cite the customer as a reference customer, including in Jedox promotional and marketing materials.

 

17.           Place of Performance, Jurisdiction, Governing Law

 

17.1         If any provision of these Terms and Conditions is held by a Court or other competent authority to be unlawful, invalid, and unenforceable or in conflict with any rule or law, statute, ordinance or regulation then the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not thereby affected.

 

17.2         These License Terms in Business Transactions and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer shall be governed by the laws of the State of Victoria, and each party submits to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of courts exercising jurisdiction in the State of Victoria including the Federal Court of Australia.

 

 

 

N

 

General Terms and conditions for the subscription of Software licences in business transactions by Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068

(Dated December 2017)

 

I.     Introductory Provisions

Application

1.1.    These Terms apply to all Software licensed and all Services provided by the Company.

1.2.    In these Terms:

1.2.1.     “Acceptance of Order” means the Company’s written acknowledgment that the Customer has applied to licence the Software and that the grant of the Licence is subject to the Contract.

1.2.2.     “Company” means Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068 and its successors and assigns.

1.2.3.     “Confidential Information” means all the information provided by the Company to the Customer in connection with this Contract where such information is identified as confidential at the time of its disclosure or ought reasonably to be considered confidential based on its content, nature or the manner of its disclosure and includes but is not limited to the Company’s trade secrets, confidential business and technical information, know-how, customer and supplier lists (whether in electronic or hard copy form),  and other information not generally known to the public but for a breach of these Terms.

1.2.4.     “Consequential Loss or Damage” means loss of profits, revenue, use or opportunity, loss of reputation, loss of access to markets, loss of goodwill, re-installation costs, removal costs and any remote, indirect, abnormal or unforeseeable form of loss or damage whether arising from a breach of Contract or tort (including negligence) or under statute or any other basis in law or equity.

1.2.5.     “Contract” means the agreement between the Company and the Customer constituted by these Terms and, if issued, will also comprise and include the Acceptance of Order, the Licence Proposal, the Terms and the Order and if there is any inconsistency between them then the Acceptance of Order will prevail over the Licence Proposal, the Terms and the Order, the Licence Proposal will prevail over the Terms and the Order and the Terms will prevail over the Order.

1.2.6.     “Customer” means the person or entity with whom the Company has contracted under the Contract and his, her or its successors and assigns.

1.2.7.      “GST” means the Goods and Services Tax imposed by A New Tax System (Goods & Services Tax) Act 1999 (Cth) and any related act and/or regulations.

1.2.8.      “Intellectual Property Rights” means all intellectual property rights including but not limited to all copyright, patents, trademarks, design rights, trade secrets, domain names, know-how and other rights of a similar nature throughout the world, whether or not now existing and whether or not registered or registrable, and any applications for registration or rights to make any such application as well as all renewals and extensions of such rights. 

1.2.9.      “Licence” means the non-exclusive, non transferable right to use the Software.

1.2.10.  “Licence Proposal” means the Company’s written offer to licence the Software to the Customer and includes any written amendments issued by the Company prior to or simultaneous with issue of the Order.

1.2.11.   “Moral Rights” has the meaning given under the Copyright Act 1968 (Cth) and includes any similar rights existing in other countries. 

1.2.12.   “Order” means the Customer’s written response to the Licence Proposal.

1.2.13.   “Support & Maintenance” means the performance of support and maintenance services as contractually agreed and defined in the "General terms and conditions for software support contracts in business transactions of Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068“ ("support terms“); warranty rights of the customer according to subsection 8 shall remain unaffected; the installation, operation and maintenance of the software however lies within the sole responsibility of the customer.

1.2.14.   “Software” means all Standard Software programmes, Software Content and other products supplied by the Company from time to time.

1.2.15.  “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

1.2.16.  “Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

1.2.17.   

1.2.18.   “Subscription Fee” means the fee payable for the temporary use of the licensed Software.

1.2.19.   “Subscription Period” means subject to the payment of the Subscription Fee, the period for which the Customer has been granted a licence to use the Software.

1.2.20.   “Terms” means these Terms and Conditions, as amended from time to time.

1.3.    All provisions of the Contract are set out in these Terms, the Licence Proposal, the Order and the Acceptance of Order and the Contract contains no other express or implied terms.

1.4.    No amendment, alteration, waiver or cancellation of any of these Terms is binding on the Company unless confirmed by the Company in writing.

1.5.    Particulars on the Jedox website, in leaflets, catalogues, drawings, brochures and other printed material are illustrations only and form no part of the Contract and are not binding on the Company unless specifically referred to in the Contract. 

1.6.    The Customer acknowledges that no employee or agent of the Company has any right to make any representation, warranty or promise, whether express or implied, in relation to the Software or the Services other than as contained in these Terms.

Technical Documents

1.7.    All technical documents such as drawings, illustrations, descriptions as well as test programmes and quotation documents are the exclusive property of the Company.  They must not be made available to third parties or copied, duplicated or used for reproducing any part of the Software.  If a quotation is not accepted then all documents must be either returned to the Company or destroyed. 

1.8.    The Company reserves the right to make technical changes and updates to the Software provided that the changes do not affect the ordinary use of the Software by the Customer.  

1.9.    The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

Time for Delivery and Performance

1.10. After conclusion of the agreement we will make the software available to the customer via download (On- Premises Subscription) or integrated in an external Cloud (Subscription as a Service). The respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

1.11. Delivery times are estimates only unless the Company has agreed in writing to be bound by the delivery date.

1.12. The Company will not be liable to the Customer for any breach of contract due to any matter or thing beyond the Company’s control (including but not limited to transport stoppages, fire, flood, earthquake, acts of God, strikes, lock-outs, work stoppages, wars, riots or civil commotion, intervention of public authority, explosion, accident or power outages).

1.13. The Company will notify the Customer of any delay as soon as practicable.

1.14. If the delay is likely to be longer than three months then the Customer can terminate the Contract.  

 

II. Terms of Licence Provision

Customer’s Rights During the Subscription Period

1.15. In consideration of payment of the Subscription Fee by the Customer to the Company, the Company grants the Customer a Licence during the Subscription Period subject to these Terms.  The Customer acknowledges that the Company retains the ownership in the Software whether in its original form or as modified during the term of the Contract. 

1.16. The Customer is granted the right during the Subscription Period to make copies of the Software to the extent necessary to run and operate the Software on one server respective hosted by one network of remote servers for use by the maximum number of agreed users.  The Customer is not permitted to have more than the agreed number of users.  Additional Licences can be acquired for testing, back-up and development.

1.17. The Customer may not reproduce, make error corrections, decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise modify or adapt the Software or create any derivative works based on the Software unless it is necessary for the Software to be compatible with the operation of other programmes used by the Customer or to rectify mistakes in the Software and the Company has failed to provide the Customer with the necessary information within a reasonable period after being requested to do so by the Customer. 

1.18. The Customer may not sell, rent out or otherwise grant sub-licences of the Software.

1.19. The Customer may not authorise the use or copying of the Software by a third party or subcontractor without the written consent of the Company. 

1.20. The Customer is not permitted to copy or partially copy the Software on to another disc or USB stick or other storage device apart from for the purpose of making a back-up copy. Any backup copies must be clearly marked “Back-Up Copy”.

1.21. The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

1.22. In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software, Software Content or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

1.23. Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

1.24. The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

1.25. If the Customer breaches any of the above sub-clauses then the Company is entitled to immediately terminate the Contract and cancel the Licence. Where the Contract is terminated by the Company, the Customer must immediately remove the Software from its computer system and destroy all copies of the Software from its systems as well as all back-up copies. 

Terms of Payment for Licence

1.26. Unless otherwise agreed in writing, payment for the Licence for the initial Subscription Period is to be made in accordance with the current price list and is calculated based on a minimum term of twelve months.  After the expiry of the initial Subscription Period, unless otherwise agreed in writing, and where a further Subscription Period has not been specifically agreed between the Parties, payment for any further Subscription Period will be calculated in accordance with the prices current at the time of renewal based on the Subscription Fee for a twelve month Licence.

1.27. Payment, unless otherwise agreed in writing, is due within three working days from the start date of the Subscription Period and is payable one year in advance.  After the initial Subscription Period has expired, if not otherwise agreed in writing, payment for the following Subscription Period falls due on the third working day after the commencement of the further Subscription Period.

1.28. Interest is payable on all overdue accounts calculated on a daily basis at the rate of interest equivalent to the Commonwealth Bank of Australia’s indicator lending rate for commercial loans plus 8% until full payment is received by the Company. 

1.29. Payment must be made in full, without any set-off, deduction or discount other than as agreed by the Company, as stated in these Terms, the relevant invoice or statement to the Customer, or where there is a binding judgement in favour of the Customer against the Company and all rights of appeal have been exhausted.

1.30. Payment by cheque will only be accepted by prior agreement and will only be applied against any outstanding invoices after it has been credited as cleared funds in the Company’s bank account. 

1.31. The Customer is liable for all charges associated with the payment of the invoice, including but not limited to bank charges, account charges and other expenses. 

Termination

1.32. Unless otherwise agreed in writing, the Contract is for the Subscription Period agreed between the Parties.  In the absence of any other written agreement, and if the Contract is not terminated in writing by either Party not less than three months prior to the end of the Subscription Period, on expiry of the Subscription Period, the Contract will automatically renew for a further twelve month period.

1.33. The Company has the right to terminate the Contract immediately at any time by giving written notice to the Customer in any of the following events:

1.33.1.  if the Customer fails to make payment when due and payable and the Customer fails to rectify such failure within fourteen business days of written notice to do so;

1.33.2.  if the Customer commits a breach or non-observance of any non-essential term of the Contract and the Customer fails to rectify such breach or non-observance within twenty-one days of written notice to do so;

1.33.3.  if the Customer enters into liquidation or compounds with its creditors or has a receiver or manager appointed to all or any part of its assets or takes any similar action in consequence of debt or any similar event in respect of the Customer under the law of the jurisdiction;

1.33.4.  if the Customer or, if the Customer is a company, any principal officer of the Customer becomes bankrupt or insolvent or enters into any arrangement with its creditors or takes any similar action in consequence of debt or any similar event in respect of the Customer under the law of the jurisdiction;

1.33.5.  if there is a change in the shareholding of the Customer, its parent company or its ultimate holding company or in the composition of the board of directors of the Customer, its parent company or its ultimate holding company which, in the opinion of the Customer, adversely affects the interests of or is otherwise unacceptable to the Company.

1.34. If the Contract is terminated or expires for any reason then, in addition and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available:

1.34.1.      the Customer’s right to use the Software immediately ceases;

1.34.2.      the Customer must immediately remove the Software from the Customer’s server and/or cloud platforms, destroy all copies of the Software, including all back-up copies and notify the Company in writing that this has been done; and

1.34.3.      the Customer must immediately pay all outstanding fees, if any.

 

 

 

Intellectual Property and Other Warranties

1.35. Nothing in this Agreement constitutes a transfer or assignment of any of the Intellectual Property Rights in the Software owned by the Company to the Customer. 

1.36. The Customer:

1.36.1.  acknowledges and agrees that the Company owns all the Intellectual Property Rights in and to the Licensed Software; and

1.36.2.  will not directly or indirectly do anything that would or might invalidate or put the Company’s Intellectual Property Rights in or to the Software and Services in dispute. 

1.37. If any person makes any claim alleging that any of the Software and Services (or any use of the Software and Services) infringes any Intellectual Property Rights or Moral Rights of any person, the Customer must:

1.37.1.  promptly notify the Company in writing;

1.37.2.  not make any admissions or take any actions in relation to the claim without the Company’s prior written consent;

1.37.3.  permit the Company to have complete control over any and all investigations, negotiations, settlement and dispute resolution proceedings relating to the claim; and

1.37.4.  cooperate with, assist and act at all times in accordance with the reasonable instructions of the Company in relation to the claim and any consequent investigations, negotiations, settlement and dispute resolution proceedings. 

1.38. The Customer acknowledges that the Intellectual Property Rights in and to any content created by the Customer while using the Software and Services in accordance with the terms of the Contract remain the property of the Company.

1.39. The Company warrants that it holds the Intellectual Property Rights to the Software during the Subscription Period and that no third party holds any Intellectual Property Rights in the Software which prevent the Customer from using the Software in accordance with the Contract.  

1.40. Unless the Customer has inspected the Software or Services and given written notice to the Company within eight business days after receipt of the Software or provision of the Services that the Software or Services are defective, did not comply with the relevant specifications or descriptions, or that the Software or Services are faulty or damaged, the Software and Services are deemed to have been accepted in good order and condition and compliant with those specifications and descriptions. 

Support & Maintenance

1.41. The Company warrant that the contractually agreed quality of the software is maintained over the duration of the subscription use agreement and that no third-party rights conflict with the contractual use of the software. The Company shall remedy defects in quality and defects in title that may arise within a reasonable time period after receipt of the Customer's notice of defects.

1.42. The Customer must immediately notify us in writing in the event that software defects have been discovered. In the case of quality defects time and circumstances of the occurrence of the defects must be indicated.

1.43. If, within eight working days, the Customer does not notify us of defects that are known to him or obvious, the Customer's rights to a reduction of the remuneration or to terminate the agreement on account of the defects are excluded.

1.44. Warranty rights of the Customer are excluded if the customer makes changes to, or commissions, changes of the software without our consent unless the customer provides evidence that the changes have consequences for the analysis and removal of the defect which are acceptable for us and did not cause the defect. The Customer rights due to defects shall remain unaffected on condition that the customer is entitled to make changes, in particular in exercising the right to correct defects on his own accord, that the changes are made adequately and appropriately, and that they are traceably documented.

1.45. The Company is entitled but not obliged to continuously develop the software and to make additional features or extensions of the software available to the customer by way of updates. The Company is entitled to adjust the technical requirements correspondingly. Prior to the installation of updates the Customer has to make sure that his systems meet the updated system requirements.

1.46. The Company will make its best effort to inform the customer prior to the provision of updates, whose installation is required for a smooth operation of the software, about the update, system requirements and the date of the provision. The Customer is obliged to install updates himself within a period of four weeks from the provision of the update. This may also require an update of the required third-party software including the operating system. The Company undertakes to inform the Customer accordingly.

1.47. The support agreed in accordance with the support terms and conditions pursuant to subsection 1.2.13 of these subscription terms does not restrict the warranty rights of the Customer according to this subsection 8.

Limitation of Liability

1.48. The Customer acknowledges and agrees that:

1.48.1.  the Customer has determined that the Software is fit for the purpose for which the Customer requires it; and

1.48.2.  the Customer has not relied on the Company’s skill and judgement in selecting the Software.

1.49. Except as provided in clause 9.3., the Company is not subject to, and the Customer releases the Company from any liability (including but not limited to Consequential Loss and Damage) arising from any delay in delivery of or any defect or fault in the Software to the full extent permitted by Law.

1.50. Where there is a delay in delivery of the Software, the Company agrees to, at the Customer’s election either:

1.50.1.  pay liquidated damages calculated at 0.75% of the invoice value per full week of delay up to a maximum of 5% of the invoice value where the Customer elects to continue with the Contract; or

1.50.2.  where the Customer elects to terminate the Contract, pay liquidated damages calculated at 15% of the invoice value.

1.51.  If the Terms or, despite clause 9.2, the provisions of the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 (Cth), the Sale of Goods Act (Vic) 1958 or any other act or the general law impose on the Company a liability for a defect or fault in the Software then, to the extent to which the Company is entitled to do so, the Company’s liability is limited, at the Company’s option to:

1.51.1.  replacement or repair of the Software;

1.51.2.  providing the Services again;

1.51.3.  supply of equivalent Software; or

1.51.4.  payment of the cost of replacing or repairing the Software or of acquiring equivalent products or having the Services provided by a third party,

and in any case:

1.51.5.  the Company will not be liable for any Consequential Loss or Damage or any other loss or damage; and

1.51.6.  unless specified otherwise in these Terms, the Company’s total liability to the Customer is limited to the invoice value of the Software or Services, as the case may be.

1.52. The Company is not liable under any circumstances for the loss of the Customer’s data.  If the Customer has failed to carry out regular back ups of its data, the Company’s liability is limited to the reinstallation of the Software only. 

Company’s right to sub-contract

The Company may subcontract any of the Services provided under this Contract, provided that the subcontractor carrying out the work has the required skills and experience in the relevant Jedox products.

 

III.        Miscellaneous Terms

Audit

The Customer must permit the Company (or its nominated auditor) to audit the records and premises of the Customer at any time during the Term and for three years following the end of the Term, on at least ten days written notice for the purpose of confirming the Customer’s compliance with the Contract provided that such audit will not unduly interfere with the conduct of the Customer’s business.  If the audit reasonably establishes that the Customer has breached the Contract then the Customer must pay the reasonable cost of the audit. 

Confidentiality and Privacy

1.53. The Customer must not, without the prior written consent of the Company, use or disclose the Confidential Information unless expressly permitted to do so by these Terms or required to do so by law or any regulatory authority. 

1.54. The Customer may:

1.54.1.  use the Confidential Information solely for the purposes of complying with its obligations and exercising its rights under this Contract; and

1.54.2.  disclose the Confidential Information to its personnel or advisors to the extent necessary for them to know the information for purposes related to this Contract, but only if reasonable steps are taken to ensure that the confidentiality of the Confidential Information is retained. 

1.55. The Customer must implement and maintain effective security measures to prevent unauthorised use and disclosure of the Confidential Information, including by ensuring that all employees, subcontractors or other third parties who have access to the Confidential Information agree to be bound by this clause, whilst it is in the Customer’s possession or control.

1.56. The Customer must return or, at the Company’s option, destroy all Confidential Information of the Company in the Customer’s possession or control on the earlier of the Company’s request or on termination of the Contract for any reason. 

1.57. The Customer acknowledges and agrees that the Company may collect, store and use personal information in relation to the Customer or, if the Customer is a company, its directors and officers, for the purposes of considering any credit application from the Customer or any other purpose related and incidental to the business relationship between the Customer and the Company.

1.58. The Company agrees that it will not disclose any personal information of the Customer or its directors or officers to any third party except to obtain credit information concerning the Customer, make an entry of the Customer’s credit report, or to enforce these Terms. 

1.59. The Customer agrees that the Company may use the Customer as a trade reference.

Governing Law

This Contract for the supply of Software and the provision of Services is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws applicable in the state of Victoria, Australia and each Party submits to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts and tribunals of that jurisdiction and waives any right it might have to claim that those courts and tribunals are an inconvenient forum. 

Waiver of Breach

No failure by the Company to insist on strict performance of any of the terms in these Terms is a waiver of any right or remedy which the Company may have, and is not a waiver of any subsequent breach or default by the Customer.

No Assignment

Neither this Contract nor any rights arising under this Contract may be assigned by the Customer without the prior written consent of the Company which is at the Company’s absolute discretion.

Severability

If any provision contained in these Terms is held by a court to be unlawful, invalid or unenforceable, the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not affected.

GST Matters

1.60. For the purposes of this clause:

"GST" means the goods and services tax as imposed by the GST Law together with any related interest, penalties, fines or other charge;

"GST Amount" means any Payment (or the relevant part of that Payment) multiplied by the appropriate rate of GST (currently 10%);

"GST Law" has the meaning given to that term in A New Tax System (Goods and Services Tax) Act 1999, or, if that Act does not exist for any reason, means any Act imposing or relating to the imposition or administration of a goods and services tax in Australia and any regulation made under that Act;

"Input Tax Credit" has the meaning given to that term by the GST Law;

"Payment" means any amount payable under or in connection with this Agreement including any amount payable by way of indemnity, reimbursement or otherwise (other than a GST Amount) and includes the provision of any non-monetary consideration;

"Tax Invoice" has the meaning given to that term by the GST Law; and

"Taxable Supply" has the meaning given to that term by the GST Law.

1.61. The parties agree that:

1.61.1.  unless specifically stated otherwise, all Payments have been calculated without regard to GST;

1.61.2.  each Party will comply with its obligations under the GST Law when calculating the amount of any Payment and the amount of any relevant Payments will be adjusted accordingly;

1.61.3.  if the whole or any part of any Payment is the consideration for a Taxable Supply, the payer must pay to the payee an additional amount equal to the GST Amount, either concurrently with that Payment or as otherwise agreed in writing;

1.61.4.  any reference to a cost or expense in this Deed excludes any amount in respect of GST forming part of the relevant cost or expense when incurred by the relevant party for which that party can claim an Input Tax Credit; and

1.61.5.  the payee will provide to the payer a Tax Invoice.

 

 

 

O

 

General Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software via Internet (Software as a Service, abbreviated SaaS) in business transactions by Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068 (Jedox)

(as of December 2017)

 

 

I. Introductory Provisions

 

1.             General, Applicability

 

1.1                 Offers, deliveries, and other services relating to the payable use of software of Jedox within the scope of the Jedox SaaS Licence – including those that will be provided in the future – to the persons specified in section 1.2 are provided exclusively on the basis of these “General Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software via Internet (Software as a Service, abbreviated SaaS) in business transactions” (hereinafter referred to as "SaaS Terms"). Jedox does not recognize any of General Terms and Conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than these SaaS Terms.

 

1.2                 These SaaS Terms shall only apply to persons or organisations who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity at the commencement of the agreement (”entrepreneurs”). They do not apply to natural persons who enter into the agreement or acquire services from Jedox for personal, domestic or household purposes or another purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity (“consumers”).

 

1.3                 Within the contractually agreed term, the performance of support and maintenance services are included as defined in the “General terms and conditions for software support contracts in business transactions of Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068” (“support terms”). The provision of Software Content is regulated in the “General Terms and Conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of standard software of Jedox Pty Ltd ACN 137 055 068”, whereas Software Content means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

1.4                 Where other products or services are acquired from Jedox, such Jedox training services, Jedox software licensing or Jedox business transaction services, other Jedox terms and conditions may apply to the provision of those services. 

 

 

2.             Agreement Content, Agreement Conclusion

 

2.1                 The details and information contained on the Jedox website and in product catalogs shall only become legally binding components of the agreement if expressly referenced in it.

 

2.2                 By accepting an offer from Jedox or placing an order with Jedox in respect of SaaS services, the customer agrees that it has read, understood and will be bound by these SaaS Terms, together with the written order confirmation of Jedox and any notices posted by Jedox on its website from time to time pursuant to these SaaS Terms. If you are entering into these SaaS Terms as an agent, officer, employee or other representative of the customer, you warrant to Jedox that you have full legal authority to bind the customer to these SaaS Terms.

 

2.3                 The content of the agreement relationship and the scope of delivery and services shall be governed exclusively by these SaaS Terms and the written order confirmation of Jedox or, in the case of a binding offer of Jedox and its due acceptance, by these SaaS Terms and the offer. To be valid, any side agreements, verbal declarations by employees or representatives of Jedox or any related entity of Jedox and amendments to confirmed orders (including changes to items to be delivered) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing; transmission by telecommunications shall be sufficient. The SaaS services to be provided by Jedox to the customer are as set out or referred to in the written confirmation of order or as otherwise agreed by the parties in writing.

 

3.             Product descriptions

 

3.1                 Product descriptions on the Jedox website or in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not represent guaranteed features.

 

3.2                 The customer acknowledges that nothing in these SaaS Terms grants the customer any ownership of or rights in respect of the intellectual property in the SaaS services provided by Jedox, the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox to provide the SaaS services or any improvements to the SaaS services, software, technology or materials of Jedox created in connection with the provision of the SaaS services.  Any intellectual property in respect of the SaaS services provided by Jedox which is created by or vests in the customer is assigned to Jedox immediately upon the intellectual property being created or vesting in the customer and the customer agrees to do all things and execute all documents as is reasonably necessary to effect such assignment.

 

3.3                 Jedox reserves all ownership, copyrights, and commercial property rights (including the right to register these rights) to all offer documents of Jedox, including to test programs, illustrations, and cost estimates. If an offer is not accepted or otherwise on written demand by Jedox, the listed documents shall be returned to Jedox without delay.

 

3.4                 Jedox reserves the right to implement technical changes in respect of the Jedox SaaS services or any other aspect of the Jedox services or contractual item, provided that the usual or contractually intended use of the service or contractual item is not significantly impaired.

 

3.5                 Nothing in these SaaS Terms grants the customer any ownership of or rights to use the trade marks of Jedox.  The customer will not adopt, register or attempt to register or use any trade marks which are identical or deceptively similar to the trade marks owned by Jedox.

 

 

4.            Customer responsibilities and obligations

 

4.1                 The customer will be responsible for:

(f)     uploading all of its data to the SaaS infrastructure offered by Jedox;

(g)    the day to day use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(h)    obtaining all consents, permits or approvals necessary to upload its data to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, store its data on the Jedox SaaS infrastructure and otherwise use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(i)     ensuring that the use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure by the customer and the uploading and storage of its data complies with all applicable laws, regulations or codes of conduct;

(j)     satisfying itself that the Jedox SaaS infrastructure is compatible with its own hardware, software and internet and network capabilities and maintaining all hardware, software, third party applications and other technology necessary to be able to access and use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(k)    any acts or omissions committed by the employees, officers, contractors or representatives of the customer or any of its related parties in relation to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure.

 

4.2                 The customer must:

(m)  use the SaaS services only for its internal business purposes;

(n)    only use and copy the documentation and other materials provided by Jedox in connection with the SaaS services to the extent necessary to use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(o)    comply with all policies regarding the SaaS services offered by Jedox which Jedox notifies the customer of from time to time (which notification may be provided by Jedox making the relevant policies accessible via its website);

(p)    not use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure in any way or for any purpose other than as contemplated by these SaaS Terms;

(q)    not modify, adapt, reverse engineer, translate, de-compile, disassemble or copy all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox;

(r)     not attempt to circumvent or break any encryption, decryption or other security device or technological protection measure contained in the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(s)    not distribute any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services for commercial purposes or otherwise sub-licence or resell the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services;

(t)     not create derivative works from all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, SaaS materials or any other services offered by Jedox;

(u)    not transfer, assign, rent, lease, lend, sell or otherwise dispose of all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or the SaaS services; and

(v)    not make any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services or SaaS materials offered by Jedox publicly available.

 

4.3                 The customer undertakes not to publish content which violates third-party rights or statutory regulations. The customer is in particular not permitted to spread and/or put images, texts, graphics and links or other data or content online which violate legal regulations or third-party copyrights, intellectual property rights or any other third-party rights. Storage and/or disclosure to third parties of extremist content, or content which is against public policy or of texts or data depicting violence or contain pornographic, discriminatory, racist, defamatory or other illegal content or illustrations are not permitted. Jedox is entitled to block the customer account in case violation of the above. The same shall apply if the customer discloses content to third parties which offends their honor, or insults or disparages persons or certain groups of people. The same applies even if an actual legal claim is not given. The customer bears the sole responsibility for data and content provided by him. Jedox does not examine the content for its correctness, or lack of viruses or to determine whether it is technically possible to examine it for viruses.

 

4.4                 The customer is prohibited (a) under these SaaS terms to store or forward infringing, defamatory or other illegal and/or illicit content, (b) to use services and systems provided under this agreement to store or forward malicious codes or other sabotage programs, (c) to impair or disturb the integrity or performance capacity of the services and system provided under this agreement, (d) to use the services provided under this agreement to gain illicit access to systems or networks which are interconnected with these services, as well as (e) to send spam, mass e-mails or other unwanted messages in violation of applicable laws and regulations.

 

4.5                In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

4.6                Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

4.7                 The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

 

5.            Delivery Time, Default of Acceptance

 

5.1                 Delivery and performance periods (including any timeframes, milestones or delivery dates in relation to services) shall be binding only if expressly confirmed by Jedox. Any delivery or performance periods expressed by Jedox as being a target or estimate will not be binding on Jedox.

 

5.2                 Even if a state of default has already started, the delivery or performance period shall be duly extended in the event of force majeure and any unforeseeable hindrances that occur after the conclusion of the agreement and for which Jedox is not responsible, provided that such hindrances affect the performance of the services owed. This shall apply even if these circumstances occur at upstream suppliers. Jedox shall notify the customer as soon as possible of the beginning and end of such hindrances. If the hindrance lasts longer than three months or it is obvious that it will last longer than three months, either the customer or Jedox may terminate the agreement by providing written notice of termination to the other party.

 

5.3                 Any liability of Jedox for any loss, however caused (including by the negligence of Jedox), suffered by the customer in connection with any delay by Jedox in providing the Jedox SaaS services, other services of Jedox or any contractual item is limited to an amount equivalent to 15 percent of the delivery or performance value (with delivery or performance value being the total amounts paid to Jedox by the Customer for the relevant service). The limitation of liability in this clause 5.3 shall not apply in the event of delay due to gross negligence, or in the event of injury to life, body, or health.

 

6.             Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise, the prices quoted in the applicable list of prices and conditions of Jedox are subject to Indirect Taxes or any other relevant taxes and shipping costs which amounts will be payable by the customer in addition to the prices.

 

7.             Payment Terms, Doubts concerning the Creditworthiness

 

7.1                 Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, invoices shall be due for payment without any deductions within 30 days of the invoice date. The payment will be deemed made as soon as Jedox has the entire amount at its disposal without recourse (receipt of the payment).

 

7.2                 Checks will only be accepted by special agreement between the Parties and will only be deemed as payment after they have been unconditionally credited. All costs incurred in this connection, especially banking, discount, and other fees plus Indirect Taxes or other relevant taxes shall be borne by the customer and shall be due immediately.

 

7.3                 Offsetting, set offs or retention of payments that has the effect of offsetting is only permitted if Jedox provides prior written consent to the offsetting, set offs or retention (which consent may be given or withheld in the sole discretion of .Jedox).

 

7.4                 If the customer fails to pay any amounts payable to Jedox in respect of any services provided by Jedox then (without limiting the other rights of Jedox in respect of the non-payment), from the onset of the default until such time as the unpaid amount (together with all interest) is paid in full, Jedox may require payment of interest on all unpaid amounts at the rate fixed from time to time by the Attorney General under the Penalty Interest Rates Act 1983 (Vic).

 

7.5                 If it becomes evident after the commencement of the agreement that the entitlement of Jedox to payment or the ability of Jedox to recover payment (including a future payment) from the customer is endangered by the lack of ability to pay on the part of the customer, Jedox may refuse the performance and the actions in preparation of the performance. The right to refuse performance shall cease if the payment is made (including, in the case of a future payment, by the customer making that payment in advance) or collateral or other security is furnished by the customer (which security is acceptable to Jedox in its sole discretion). Jedox may set a period for the customer to pay/to furnish collateral or other security. If this period passes without payment or collateral being provided, Jedox may terminate the agreement by providing written notice of termination to customer.

 

7.6                All payments by the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms shall be made in full, without any deduction or withholding in respect of taxes unless the deduction or withholding is required by law. If the customer is required under any law to make a deduction or withholding in respect of taxes from a payment to Jedox under or in connection with these SaaS Terms, the customer must pay to Jedox an additional amount that ensures that, after the deduction or withholding is made, Jedox receives on the date of the payment an amount equal to the amount that Jedox would have received if the deduction or withholding had not been made.

 

7.7                Unless expressly stated otherwise, all fees and other amounts payable by the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms have been calculated without regard to any goods or services tax, value added tax, consumption tax or tax of a similar kind (“Indirect Tax”).  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in these SaaS Terms, if Indirect Tax is imposed upon or is payable by Jedox under or in connection with these SaaS Terms, the customer must pay to Jedox an amount equal to the Indirect Tax upon demand by Jedox.

 

7.8                If the customer is required by law to make any deduction or withholding for any taxes from any payments to Jedox under these SaaS Terms such that Jedox would not receive the full amount of the fees or other amounts payable, the customer agrees to:

(e)    deduct or withhold the amount for taxes from the payment;

(f)     promptly pay the amount deducted to the relevant government authority on time and otherwise in accordance with the relevant law;

(g)    provide to Jedox an original receipt, certificate or other evidence of payment of the deducted or withheld amount; and
