(h)    pay an additional amount to Jedox at the same time as the affected payment is due so that, after making the deduction or withholding and any further deductions or withholdings on the additional amount payable under this clause 7.8(d), Jedox receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received if no deductions or withholdings had been made.

 

 

II.    Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software within the Scope of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure

 

8.             Rights of the Customer, Use

 

8.1                 The customer is granted the non-exclusive right for the term of the agreement to use the Jedox software defined in the offer by way of remote access via the Internet. The customer may only use the software and process and store the data for its own internal business purposes.

 

8.2                 The customer is not granted any further rights, e.g. the right to modify the software, to reproduce it, and/or to use it for other purposes not specified herein. The customer is not permitted to reverse engineer, decompile, copy, disassemble, or reproduce the software or to use any part of the software for the purpose of creating a separate application. Moreover, the customer is prohibited from creating any other derived works on the basis of the software, especially from developing a competing product or service or from copying features, functions, or images.

 

8.3                 Furthermore, the customer is not permitted to market, sell, let, sublicense, license, or otherwise make available the rights granted herein to any third parties, unless the party is a designated user. Designated users are all persons that have been approved by Jedox as being users of the relevant service.

 

8.4                 The router port facing the Internet of the data center used by Jedox is the point of handover for the contractual services and Jedox ceases to be responsible for providing the contractual services once the contractual services are available from that router port.

 

8.5                 The software, the computing power required for the use, and the needed storage space for data (RAM and HD) shall be made available by Jedox or a sub-contractor engaged by it. The individual performance parameters shall be governed by the respective offer.

 

8.6                 Jedox will send the customer the login details required for the use of the software and authorization. The customer is not permitted to give the login details to third parties, unless the party is a user designated to Jedox who was taken into consideration in the calculation of the fee. The customer shall be responsible for all activities that take place due to unauthorized use of the login details. In the case of such unauthorized use by third parties, Jedox shall be notified without delay. The customer shall report new additional users to Jedox before the commencement of their work in order to enable an adjustment of the fee calculation.

 

8.7                 The connection of the customer to the Internet is not part of the subject matter of this agreement. The customer alone shall be responsible for the operability of his Internet connection, including the transmission routes and his own computer.

 

8.8                 The customer alone shall be responsible for the permissibility of the collection, processing, and use of the data entered by the customer within the scope of the use of the software.

 

8.9                 Operation of the software for the customer by third-party companies by way of outsourcing must only be undertaken with the prior written approval of Jedox.

 

8.10              All trademark rights, copyrights, rights to business secrets, and/or other intellectual property of Jedox shall belong exclusively to Jedox. The customer shall notify Jedox without delay in writing in case third parties assert property rights to the software against it.

 

9.             Obligations of the Customer

 

9.1                 The customer shall only use the software and the provided storage and computer space in accordance with these SaaS Terms. The installation of further software is not permitted. The same applies to the storage of data not directly associated with the use of the contractual software.

 

9.2                 The customer shall duly assist Jedox in the service performance.

 

9.3                 The customer shall observe the usual and accepted security standards. Among other things, this includes regular backups by the customer.

 

9.4                 The customer must protect all login details in order to prevent third-party access. Code words and passwords shall be changed prior to initial use and thereafter at regular intervals. Code words and passwords shall be changed without delay if it is suspected or there are indications that they have become known to third parties.

9.5                 The customer guarantees that the information it sends to Jedox is true and always up to date.

 

9.6                 The customer shall check in due time whether the contractual services performed meet the contractual requirements. If this is not the case, Jedox shall be notified without delay. In this case, the customer must give Jedox all relevant information. Moreover, the Customer shall ensure that the minimum requirements for the hardware and software as well as the Internet connection utilized by the customer, which are required for the contractual use of the services, are fulfilled. The customer shall observe all specifications of Jedox that concern the contractual services.

 

9.7                  The customer is solely responsible for ensuring that its access to and use of the software and services of Jedox complies with all applicable laws. The customer shall bear all costs, such as customs duties, taxes, other levies, or fees that may be incurred for the use of the software.

 

9.8                 In the event of a breach of the obligations under these SaaS Terms that the customer must comply with, Jedox may block the customer's access at its expense. This does not relieve the customer of its payment obligations toward Jedox.

 

9.9                 Any disadvantages and additional costs   resulting from    the obligations listed herein shall be borne exclusively by the customer.

 

10.           Availability

 

10.1              Unless expressly agreed otherwise between the parties, an availability of 99 percent in respect of the contractual service is ensured on annual average.

 

10.2              Failures and impairments in connection with the availability and/or provision during a normal maintenance window and/or during maintenance and support, installation, or implementation work coordinated with the customer as well as scheduled downtimes that have been coordinated with the customer or decommissioning during these times shall not be construed as non-availability times

 

10.3              Moreover, times during which the contractual service is not available or is only available to a limited extent due to technical or other circumstances outside the realm of influence of Jedox (e.g. force majeure, malfunction in telecommunication lines, third-party faults) shall not be construed as non-availability times.

 

10.4              Times of non-availability are also time periods during which Jedox temporarily restricts the access to  the contractual service due to

 

•                     an acute threat to the data, hardware, and/or software infrastructure or data, hardware, and/or software infrastructure of the customer due to external threats (e.g. viruses, port  hacking, attacks via Trojans) or due to

 

•                     a significant threat to the security of the network operation or the network integrity.

 

10.5              In the specified times of non-availability, Jedox shall take the legitimate interests of the customer into consideration as far as possible. Jedox shall without delay inform the customer of measures taken, as far as possible. Jedox shall take all steps that can reasonably be expected in order to restore the availability.

 

10.6              Unless the parties have expressly agreed otherwise, the responsibility of Jedox for the components used for the service performance (Jedox SaaS infrastructure) ends at the outbound router port of the data center used by Jedox.

 

10.7              The customer shall without delay report any availability malfunctions to Jedox. The availability will only be deemed impaired insofar as a malfunction is actually on hand. Impairment of the data transfer that originates from the customer's local IT system or malfunction of the customer's connection to the agreed point of handover (e.g. line failure or malfunction at other providers or telecommunication operators) does not represent a malfunction as defined above.

 

11.           Defects

 

11.1              Liability of Jedox for defects that already existed at the conclusion of the agreement is excluded.

 

11.2              The customer shall report any detected defects of the software to Jedox without delay in writing. In the event of defects in quality, the report shall contain a description of the time of occurrence of the defects and precise details.

 

11.3              If the customer fails to report defects that are known to it or obvious defects within eight workdays, the customer shall lose its rights to reduction or termination due to these defects. The same applies to concealed defects that are not reported within eight workdays of their discovery.

 

11.4              If no breach of the agreement can be found following a defect report of the customer, the customer shall refund the costs incurred in connection with the inspection if the unjustified defect report was caused by a fault of the customer.

 

11.5              Should a third party assert property rights concerning the contractual services against the customer, Jedox may, at its own discretion and at its own expense, either modify the contractual services or replace them so that the customer is no longer in breach of a property right.

 

11.6              The customer shall notify Jedox without delay in writing in case third parties assert property rights (e.g. copyrights or patent rights) to the contractual services against him. The customer authorizes Jedox to conduct the dispute with the third party by itself. As long as Jedox makes use of this authorization, the customer shall not take the initiative to acknowledge the claims of the third party without the approval of Jedox; in this case, Jedox will defend the third-party claims at its own expense and indemnifies the customer against all costs associated with the defense against these claims, unless they are based on conduct of the customer in breach of obligations (e.g. use in breach of the agreement) or any wrongful conduct, negligence or deliberate acts or omission by the customer.

 

11.7              For damage due to defects, Jedox shall only be liable up to the limits specified in sections 10 and 11.

 

12.           Liability, Exclusion of Liability

 

12.1              The products and services provided by Jedox may be subject to consumer guarantees that cannot be excluded under the Australian Consumer Law or other applicable Australian State or Territory consumer protection legislation.  If customer is entitled to any remedy for breach of the consumer guarantees contained in the Australian Consumer Law then nothing in these SaaS Terms will operate so as to exclude, restrict or modify the application of any of the provisions of the Australian Consumer Law  or any State or Territory consumer protection legislation, the exercise of a right conferred by such a provision, or any liability of Jedox for a breach of a condition, warranty or guarantee implied by such a provision, where the Australian Consumer Law or other relevant legislation would render it void to do so.  To the extent permitted by law, Jedox and its related entities expressly limit their liability for a breach of any condition, warranty or guarantee implied by virtue of any of the Australian Consumer Law or any other relevant legislation to, at the election of Jedox:

(c)    in the case of goods, any one or more of the following:

                                  vii.          the replacement of the goods or the supply of equivalent goods;

                                viii.           the repair of the goods;

                                   ix.          the payment of the cost of replacing the goods or of acquiring equivalent goods; or

                                    x.          the payment of the cost of having the goods repaired; or

(d)    in the case of services:

                                   xi.          the supplying of the services again; or

                                  xii.          the payment of the cost of having the services supplied again.

 

12.2              In all other cases of liability of Jedox to customer, all compensation claims including due to the breach of a duty by Jedox, breach of these SaaS Terms by Jedox and due to tort by Jedox are excluded, so that, to the maximum extent permitted by law, Jedox is not liable for lost profit or other monetary damage incurred by the customer. If Jedox is found to be liable to pay any damages, compensation or other amounts to the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms, such liability will be limited to the amount set out in clause 5.3 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms).

 

12.3              Without limiting any other provisions of these SaaS Terms, Jedox is not liable for any Consequential Loss (however caused) suffered or incurred by the Customer in connection with this agreement or the provision of the services. This clause applies even if Jedox knew or ought to have known that the relevant Consequential Loss would be suffered.  Consequential Loss means loss beyond the normal measure of damages and further includes, without limitation, all indirect loss, all loss of revenue, all loss of reputation, all loss of profits, all loss of data, all loss of actual or anticipated savings, all loss of bargain, all lost opportunities, including opportunities to enter into arrangements with third parties, all loss of use, all cost of capital and all costs of substitute goods, facilities or services.

 

12.4              Without limiting any other provision of these SaaS Terms, if the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’s liability in cases of negligence which results in loss of data shall be limited to the  recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

12.5              If Jedox’s liability is excluded or limited due to any of the aforesaid provisions, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

13.           Statute of Limitations

 

To the maximum extent permitted by law, all claims against Jedox by the customer under or in respect of these SaaS Terms shall expire after one year (“limitation period”). The limitation period shall begin on the date the customer is aware (or ought reasonably to be aware) of the circumstances giving rise to the claim. 

 

14.           Privacy and Data Protection

 

14.1              The Parties must comply with their respective obligations under the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth). 

 

14.2              Jedox shall process customer's personal information or data required to provide the services to the customer in accordance with any obligations imposed on Jedox under relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations (including the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth)) that apply to Jedox as a provider of information technology services.

 

14.3              The parties acknowledge that, with respect to all personal information or data that Jedox has access to in relation to the provision of the services by Jedox:

(a)    the customer will be responsible for determining and monitoring its compliance with the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations, including ensuring that the access to and use of the services by the customer complies with the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations;

(b)    Jedox will not have obligations to monitor compliance by the customer with the Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations; and

(c)    the customer will obtain all consents, permissions or authorisations required in order for Jedox to be able to access, use, store, process, disclose and otherwise manage personal information or data of the customer as contemplated by these SaaS Terms.

 

14.4              Jedox undertakes to ensure that access to customer data is restricted to technical support, cloud operations and consulting teams, and only if they directly require access to the data in order to fulfill Jedox’s obligations in accordance with this Agreement and the relevant data protection laws. Jedox shall ensure that the confidentiality obligations stipulated in this Agreement are enforced. 

 

15.           Published Contents

 

15.1              The Customer shall mark the contents it uploads to the Internet as their own or third-party contents and present his full name and address. .

 

15.2              The customer undertakes not to publish any contents that violate the rights of third parties or any applicable laws. Storage of extremist or immoral content or any other content that Jedox reasonably determines to be unacceptable is not permitted. Jedox may block the customer's access in case that this rule is breached. The same shall apply in case the customer publishes contents that could offend third parties or insult or denigrate persons or groups of people. This shall apply even if no actual legal claim is on hand. Jedox is under no obligation to review the contents of the customer.

 

15.3              The customer is prohibited (a) from storing or transmitting contents that breach rights, that constitute slander, or that are otherwise unlawful and/or prohibited within the scope of the rights granted under these SaaS Terms, (b) from using provided services or systems for storing or transmitting malicious code or other malware, (c) from impairing or disrupting the integrity or performance of the provided services, (d) from gaining unauthorized access to the systems or networks  associated with the provided services, and (e) from transmitting spam mail, mass mail, or other unsolicited mail in breach of applicable laws.

 

15.4              In the event of non-compliance, Jedox may block the access.

 

16.           Fee, Due Date, Late Payment

 

16.1              Unless agreed otherwise, the fee for the use of the standard software within the scope of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure during the minimum term shall be governed by the current list of prices and conditions of Jedox plus value-added tax. Unless agreed otherwise, after the end of the minimum term, the fee quoted in the current list of prices and conditions of Jedox for the minimum term shall apply plus any GST or other relevant taxes, unless a new minimum term is agreed.

16.2              Unless agreed otherwise, the fee for the agreed minimum term shall be due in advance on the third workday of the agreed minimum term. After the end of the minimum term and if the agreement is not terminated, the fee for the minimum term shall always be due in advance on the third workday of the respective minimum term.

16.3              With respect to the default interest to be paid by the customer in the case of late payment, section 6.4 shall apply analogously.

 

17.           Term and Termination

 

17.1              The term of the agreement depends on the period determined in the offer (hereinafter referred to as "minimum term"). Thereafter, it will automatically be extended by the period of the determined minimum term, unless it is terminated by either party with three months' written notice, effective at the end of the minimum term or of an extension term. If no minimum term is determined in the offer, a minimum term of 12 months will be deemed agreed.

 

17.2              The agreement shall commence upon transmission of the login details to the customer.

 

17.3         Moreover, the agreement may be terminated in writing by either party with immediate effect for good cause. Good cause that entitles Jedox to terminate the agreement includes if the customer breaches any provision of these SaaS Terms and fails to remedy the breach within 7 days of being provided with written notice by Jedox of the breach. For the customer, good cause will consist of a material shortfall of the agreed availability of the software; being a shortfall amounts to availability of more than 10 percent less than the agreed availability percentage.

 

17.4         Without limiting clause 17.3, Jedox may terminate the agreement at any time and without cause by providing the customer with no less than 30 days’ written notice of termination.

 

17.5         Without limiting clauses 17.3 and 17.4, Jedox may, by written notice to the customer, terminate the agreement with immediate effect if:

(e)    the customer fails to comply with any written notice issued by Jedox requiring the customer to remedy a breach, non-observance or non-performance of the customer’s obligations under these SaaS Terms within seven business days of receiving that notice from Jedox;

(f)     the customer commits a breach of these SaaS Terms which is incapable of remedy;

(g)    the customer goes into liquidation, is wound up, becomes insolvent or has a receiver appointed over all or any substantial part of its assets; or

(h)    the customer proposes or enters into any schemes of arrangements with its creditors.

 

17.6         Notice of termination must be given in writing.

 

17.7         Upon termination of the agreement taking effect:

(c)    the customer must immediately:

                                     i.          pay to Jedox all fees, expenses or other sums payable to Jedox under these SaaS Terms which have accrued or are payable as at the date of termination; and

                                   ii.          provide Jedox with written confirmation that it has completed its obligations under this clause 1617.7(a); and

(d)    Jedox ceases to have any obligations under these SaaS Terms with respect to the provision of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services or any additional services.

For the avoidance of doubt, following termination of the agreement taking effect, Jedox will be entitled to retain any fees paid by the customer, even if such amounts were paid in advance.

 

III.     Miscellaneous

 

18.           Indemnity

 

18.1              The customer must indemnify and keep Jedox indemnified against any loss which arises directly or indirectly out of:

(e)    any breach of these SaaS Terms by the customer including any breach in respect of which Jedox exercises a right to terminate;

(f)     the customer or any other person in any way accessing or using the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services;

(g)    any Unacceptable Content being uploaded to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(h)    the uploading of the customer’s data to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure by the customer which does not comply with privacy or other laws of any applicable jurisdiction;

(i)     the customer’s data being stored or displayed on the Jedox SaaS infrastructure; or

(j)     any negligent or unlawful acts of the customer or any of its related parties or their respective employees, officers, contractors or representatives,

except to the extent the relevant loss arises as a direct result of any breach of these SaaS Terms by Jedox or any grossly negligent or unlawful act of Jedox or any of its personnel.

 

19.           Sub-Contractors

 

Jedox may perform the contractual services (or any part thereof) through third parties as sub-contractors, provided that the respective sub-contractors are adequately qualified.

 

20.           Non-Disclosure

 

20.1              The customer undertakes not to disclose any confidential information that becomes known to him during this agreement relationship and not to use this knowledge, especially not for its own business purposes. Confidential information is all information that is only known to a small group of people and that is not publicly known, that is to be kept secret according to the (express or implied) will of Jedox, and in whose non- disclosure Jedox has a legitimate or economic interest.

 

20.2              The non-disclosure obligation does not apply to knowledge that is publicly accessible or whose forwarding would obviously not result in any disadvantage for Jedox.

 

20.3              The non-disclosure obligation shall continue to apply for 5 years after the end of the agreement.

 

21.           Right to Audit the Compliance with the Contractual Terms and Conditions

 

Jedox may inspect the records and IT systems of the customer in order to verify the compliance with these SaaS Terms. For this purpose, Jedox may also commission a third party. Jedox shall inform the customer of such an inspection in writing at least ten (10) workdays in advance.   As far as possible, the audit shall not impair the business operations of the customer more than necessary.

 

22.           Reference Customers

 

Jedox may refer to the customer as a reference customer including in Jedox promotional and marketing materials.

 

23.           Place of Fulfillment, Applicable Law, Jurisdiction

 

23.1              If any provision of these Terms and Conditions is held by a Court or other competent authority to be unlawful, invalid, and unenforceable or in conflict with any rule or law, statute, ordinance or regulation then the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not thereby affected.

 

23.2              These SaaS Terms and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer are governed by the laws of the State of Victoria, and each party submits to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of courts exercising jurisdiction in the State of Victoria including the Federal Court of Australia.

 

 

 

 

P

 

 Terms and Conditions of Business for Standard Software (Perpetual Licenses) and Software Content of Jedox Pte Ltd

(as of December 2017)

                                                                                                           

I.             Introductory Provisions

 

1.            General, Definitions, Scope of Contract

 

1.1          Offers and deliveries made by Jedox Pte Ltd (UEN 201626701M) ("Jedox") present or future, relating to the sale of perpetual licenses of Standard Software   and/ or Jedox Software Content (in the following “Software”) made in relation to the persons or entities listed in clause 3 herein take place solely on the basis of the present Terms and Conditions for Software ("Perpetual License Terms "). Jedox does not recognize any general terms and conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than the Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions.

 

1.2          “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.
“Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

 

 

1.3          These Perpetual License Terms shall only apply to persons or organizations who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity at the commencement of the agreement ("entrepreneurs"). They do not apply to natural persons who enter into the agreement or acquire software or services from Jedox for personal, domestic or household purposes or another purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity.

 

1.4          Where other products or services are acquired from Jedox, such as Jedox support services, Jedox training services, Jedox cloud services or Jedox business transaction services, other Jedox terms and conditions may apply to the provision of those services. 

 

 

2.            Subject of Contract, Conclusion of Contract

 

2.1          The purpose of the agreement is the provision of software specified in the offer or in the order confirmation which is developed and sold by us. The provision of the source code of the software is not a part of the agreement. Similarly, the provision of hardware as may be required for the operation, third-party software and other software components is also not a part of the agreement. It will be purchased or licensed by the customer under his own responsibility.

 

2.2          The details and information given on Jedox’s homepage, on Jedox Marketplace and in Jedox product catalogues become a legally effective part of any contract only if the contract makes express reference to such details and information.

 

2.3          By accepting an offer from Jedox or placing an order with Jedox in respect of Jedox software, the customer agrees that it has read, understood and will be bound by these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, together with the written order confirmation of Jedox and any notices posted by Jedox on its website from time to time pursuant to these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions. If you are entering into these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions as an agent, officer, employee or other representative of the customer, you warrant to Jedox that you have full legal authority to bind the customer to these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions.

 

2.4          The content of any contractual relationship and the scope of delivery are governed solely by these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions and the written confirmation of order of Jedox; however, in the event of a binding offer on part of Jedox and its acceptance within the specified period, the contractual relationship is governed by these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions and the written offer of Jedox. Collateral agreements, verbal statements given by any employees or agents of Jedox or any related entity of Jedox as well as changes or amendments to confirmed contracts (including changes to the products) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing to be effective; such written confirmation provided via fax or email shall be sufficient.

 

2.5          The details of the Jedox software to be licensed to the customer will be as set out or referred to in the written confirmation of order or as otherwise agreed by the parties in writing.

 

 

3.            Product Descriptions, Offer and Quotation Documents, Reservation of Right to Make Modifications

 

3.1          To the full extent permissible by applicable law, product descriptions on Jedox’s homepage, with test programs, in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not create any warranty as to quality, nature or description of any Jedox product.

 

3.2          The customer acknowledges that nothing in these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions grants the customer any ownership of or rights in respect of the intellectual property in the Jedox software, the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox or any improvements to the aforementioned created under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions.  Any intellectual property in respect of the Jedox software or the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox which is created by or vests in the customer is assigned to Jedox immediately upon the intellectual property being created or vesting in the customer and the customer agrees to do all things and execute all documents as is reasonably necessary to effect such assignment.

 

3.3          Jedox reserves the right to ownership of and title over, copyrights and intellectual or industrial property rights (including the right to register any such rights) in all Jedox’s offer and quotation documents, in particular test programs, illustrations and cost estimates. The documents listed above must be immediately returned to Jedox at Jedox’s request if an offer by Jedox is not accepted or otherwise on written demand by Jedox.

 

3.4          If test programs are provided or made available by Jedox, these programs are provided by Jedox on a temporary basis and free of charge and, to the extent permitted by law, Jedox does not accept any liability in relation to the provision of test programs, the use of test programs or the provision of services in relation to test programs.

 

3.5          Jedox reserves the right to make technical changes and modifications in respect of the applicable Jedox software, product or service, provided that the usual use of the Jedox software, product or service or such use provided for under the contract, is not significantly or detrimentally impaired.

 

 

II.           Conditions for the sale of Standard Software and free of charge use of Standard Software

 

5.            Customer responsibilities and obligations

 

5.1          The customer will be responsible for:

(l)           the day to day use of the Jedox software;

(m)        obtaining all consents, permits or approvals necessary to use the Jedox software;

(n)         ensuring that the use of the Jedox software by the customer complies with all applicable laws, regulations or codes of conduct;

(o)         satisfying itself that the Jedox software is compatible with its own hardware, software and internet and network capabilities and maintaining all hardware, software, third party applications and other technology necessary to be able to access and use the Jedox software;

(p)         any acts or omissions committed by the employees, officers, contractors or representatives of the customer or any of its related parties in relation to the Jedox software.

 

5.2          The customer must:

(w)        use the Jedox software only for its internal business purposes;

(x)         only use and copy the documentation and other materials provided by Jedox in connection with the Jedox software to the extent necessary to use the Jedox software;

(y)         comply with all policies regarding the Jedox software which Jedox notifies the customer of from time to time (which notification may be provided by Jedox making the relevant policies accessible via its website);

(z)         not use the Jedox software in any way or for any purpose other than as contemplated by these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions;

(aa)      not modify, adapt, reverse engineer, translate, de-compile, disassemble or copy all or any part of the Jedox software;

(bb)      not attempt to circumvent or break any encryption, decryption or other security device or technological protection measure contained in the Jedox software;

(cc)       not undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

(dd)      in case he purchases a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, license the third-party Software accordingly.

(ee)      not distribute any part of the Jedox software for commercial purposes or otherwise sub-licence or resell the Jedox software;

(ff)         not create derivative works from all or any part of the Jedox software;

(gg)      not transfer, assign, rent, lease, lend, sell or otherwise dispose of all or any part of the Jedox software; and

(hh)      not make any part of the Jedox software publicly available.

 

 

6.            Delivery Period

 

6.1          Delivery periods (including any timeframes, milestones or delivery dates in relation to the provision of Jedox software or services) are only binding if Jedox expressly confirmed them in writing. Any service periods expressed by Jedox as being a target or estimate will not be binding on Jedox.

 

6.2          Delivery of Jedox Software (being service provision by Jedox) is handled through electronic transmission of the license key to the email address provided by customer on the order document (quotation). Alternatively, customer may request to receive license key by fax or letter. The respective, current version of Jedox Standard Software can be downloaded from Jedox’s website using the provided license key; the respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

6.3          In case of delay in delivery of Jedox software or the provision of a service by Jedox, including a delay caused by an event of force majeure or any and all unforeseeable impediments that may occur after the commencement of the contract and for which Jedox is not responsible, which have an effect on the provision of the service owed, the service period shall be duly extended by such period as Jedox reasonably determines. This shall apply even if these delaying circumstances occur at upstream suppliers of Jedox. Jedox will inform the customer as soon as possible of any such delays or impediments. If the delay or impediment persists for longer than three months, or if it is established that it shall persist for longer than three months, Jedox as well as the customer may terminate the contract effective immediately on providing written notice of termination to the other party.

 

6.4          Any liability of Jedox for any loss, however caused (including by the negligence of Jedox), suffered by the customer in connection with a delay by Jedox in delivering the Jedox software or providing any service is limited to an amount equivalent to 3% per annum of the total value of the delivery (with the total value of delivery being the total amounts paid to Jedox by the customer for the licence of the Jedox software or the provision of the relevant service) prorated by the length of the delay. The limitation of liability in this clause 5.4 shall not apply in the event of default due to willful misconduct by Jedox or gross negligence by Jedox or in the event of death or injury to life, body or health caused by negligence or breach of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox.

 

7.            Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, the prices shown in Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions do not include Indirect Taxes or other relevant statutory taxes or any shipping costs, which amounts will be payable by the customer in addition to the prices.

 

 

8.            Terms of Payment, Customer's Ability to Pay, Value Added Tax

 

8.1          Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, Jedox’s invoices shall be due for payment in full without deductions or set-offs within 30 days of the date of invoice. Payment is deemed to have been made from the point at which Jedox obtained unrestricted access to the amount ("Receipt of Payment").

 

8.2          Checks shall be accepted if agreed between the parties and shall be considered to be payment only once they have been unconditionally credited to Jedox. Any costs and expenses incurred thereby, in particular, banking, discount and other expenses, inclusive of any Indirect Taxes or other relevant taxes thereon, shall be paid by the customer and shall be immediately due for payment.

 

8.3          Set-offs or reductions of the amount payable for counter claims or retention of payment with the effect of a set-off by the customer is only permitted if Jedox provides prior written consent to the set off, reduction or retention (which consent may be given or withheld in the sole discretion of Jedox). This is not applicable if claims of customer are grounded on rectification of a defect or costs for completion of delivery.

 

8.4          If the customer fails to pay any amounts payable to Jedox in respect of the licence of the Jedox software or the provision of the services then,without limiting the other rights of Jedox in respect of the non-payment, from the commencement of the default until such time as the outstanding amount (together with any interest) is paid in full, Jedox may require payment of interest on all unpaid amounts at the rate fixed from time to time under the Rules of Court promulgated by the Supreme Court of Judicature Act (Cap. 322).

 

8.5          If after the commencement of the specific contract, it becomes apparent that the payment claim of Jedox or the ability of Jedox to recover payment (including a future payment) from the customer is endangered by the inability of customer to perform, Jedox shall be entitled to refuse its performance under the contract, including performance of any preparatory acts. The right to refuse performance shall cease to exist once payment has been made (including, in the case of a future payment, by the customer making that payment in advance) or customer provides security for payment (which security is acceptable to Jedox in its sole discretion). Jedox can set a time limit for payment or provision of such security. After expiration of such time limit if the relevant payment has not been made or security acceptable to Jedox provided, Jedox may terminate the contract effective immediately upon Jedox providing written notice of termination to customer.

 

8.6          Unless expressly stated otherwise, all fees and other amounts payable by the customer under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions have been calculated without regard to any goods or services tax, value added tax, consumption tax or tax of a similar kind ("Indirect Tax").  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, if Indirect Tax is imposed upon or is payable by Jedox under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, the customer must pay to Jedox an amount equal to the Indirect Tax upon demand by Jedox.

 

8.7          If the customer is required by law to make any deduction or withholding for any taxes from any payments to Jedox under these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions such that Jedox would not receive the full amount of the fees or other amounts payable, the customer agrees to:

(i)           deduct or withhold the amount for taxes from the payment;

(j)           promptly pay the amount deducted to the relevant government authority on time and otherwise in accordance with the relevant law;

(k)         provide to Jedox an original receipt, certificate or other evidence of payment of the deducted or withheld amount; and

(l)           pay an additional amount to Jedox at the same time as the affected payment is due so that, after making the deduction or withholding and any further deductions or withholdings on the additional amount payable under this clause 7.7(d), Jedox receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received if no deductions or withholdings had been made

 

9.             Customer's Rights related to the Software

 

9.1          If Jedox delivers Standard Software to the customer against payment of a one-off charge for a licence of any length of time, the customer shall receive the non-exclusive right, for the relevant license duration (subject to termination of the licence pursuant to these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions), to duplicate the software to the extent such duplication is necessary for loading, viewing, running, transferring or saving the software contemporaneously on one (1) server for the simultaneous use by the maximum number of users as agreed in the contract ("Agreed Users"). The customer agrees to abide by the provisions relating to Agreed Use and agrees not to make the software available to additional users. In special circumstances, separate licenses can be purchased for test, backup or development systems.

 

9.2          To the extent that the Standard Software transferred free of charge has been licensed as open source software, the rights and obligations of the customer shall be those provided in the open source license which the software is licensed under. The relevant open source license agreement is included in the software.

 

9.3          To the extent that the software transferred free of charge is not open source software ("Freeware"), the customer shall have the non-exclusive, non-transferable right, not limited in time, to duplicate the software to the extent necessary to load, demonstrate, run, transfer or save the software ("Agreed Use for Freeware"). The customer shall only use the software according to this Agreed Use. The customer is not permitted under any circumstances, without Jedox’s written consent, to sell the software or to transfer the software to third parties free of charge.

 

9.4          The customer has the right to decompile, edit or duplicate the software to the extent that this is necessary to establish the interoperability of the software with other programs or to eliminate errors or bugs in the software. This applies, however, only where Jedox failed upon request to make the relevant, necessary information accessible to the customer within an appropriate time period. The customer is not entitled to decompile, translate, edit, arrange or rework the software in any other manner beyond the above authorization. The customer is not permitted to reverse engineer, decompile, copy, disassemble, duplicate the software, or use any part of the software to generate a separate application.

 

9.5          The operation of Jedox software for the customer by third party businesses due to outsourcing must only be undertaken with the prior written consent of Jedox.

 

9.6          The customer is not entitled to generate copies or partial copies of the software on other media. This does not apply to the generation of a backup copy. The customer shall mark the backup copy with the words "Backup Copy".

 

9.7          The customer is entitled to sell copies of software purchased from Jedox to third parties only if:

(a)         it fully gives up the use of the software and destroys any existing copies of the software;

(b)         it notifies Jedox of the name and address of such third party; and

(c)         such third party gives to Jedox its consent to be bound by these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions in writing.

 

If the customer violates this clause, the customer shall owe Jedox a contractual penalty of half the amount that the third party would have had to pay under Jedox’s current list of prices and conditions to obtain the software from Jedox, or half the purchase price agreed with the customer, whichever is greater. The customer and Jedox agree that the above amounts represent a genuine and reasonable pre-estimate of some of the loss Jedox will suffer if the customer breaches this clause 8.7.

 

9.8          The customer is not under any circumstances whatsoever entitled to permanently or temporarily rent, lease or otherwise make the software available to third parties. The customer's employees are not third parties for the purposes of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, as long as they use the software within their relationship of employment existing and according to the contract.

 

9.9          Upon request, the customer will allow Jedox or a third party acting on behalf of Jedox to investigate if the use of the software is within the restrictions and granted rights by Jedox. The customer will support Jedox in this investigation to its best abilities.

 

9.10       If questions regarding the use of the delivered licenses occur, customer shall in particular consult the respective documentation or the information in the Jedox Knowledge Base (https://knowledgebase.jedox.com).

 

 

10.          Lack of Conformity of the Goods or Documentation with Contract, Notice of Defects, Limitation Period

 

10.1       To the extent that Jedox transfers Standard Software, unlimited in time, against payment of a one-time fee, the following applies:

 

9.1.1     If the purchase is a commercial transaction for both parties, the customer shall inspect the product without delay and report any and all defects in writing, indicating the type and scope of the defect. The report must be received by Jedox within eight working days of the delivery in the case of obvious defects or within eight working days of the discovery in the case of concealed defects. If the report does not fulfil said requirements, the product will be deemed approved.

 

9.1.2     If, after the customer has given notice of lack of conformity, no actual lack of conformity of the product is found, the customer shall reimburse Jedox for the costs and expenses Jedox incurred in connection with the examination and inspection of the goods, provided that the unjustified report of defects is attributable to the fault of the customer.

 

9.1.3     Rights due to defects in quality can only arise if the product has a defect in quality at the time of transfer of risk. No rights due to defects in quality shall arise in the case of improper use or treatment of the product, unsuitable environment or operating conditions, defects caused by changes performed by the customer, insufficient maintenance, etc.

 

9.1.4     Subject to the provisions of clause 9.1.3, the customer may, at Jedox’s discretion, demand supplementary performance in the form of elimination of the defect (rectification) or delivery of a product without any defects (replacement). The expenses required for the supplementary performance shall be borne by the customer if they are higher due to the fact that the product has been transported to a location other than the delivery address of the customer, unless the transport corresponds to its intended use. If Jedox is unwilling or unable to provide rectification/replacement, especially if such is unduly delayed for reasons for which Jedox is responsible, the customer shall, at its own discretion, be entitled to terminate the contract or reduce the purchase price if it cannot be expected to accept further supplementary performance attempts. In the case of a minor defect, the termination of the contract by the customer is subject to Jedox’s approval.

 

9.1.5     To the maximum extent permitted by law, the limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is one year from the time the defect was discovered by the customer. In the event of injury to life, body or health for which Jedox is responsible and in cases of intent and gross negligence, the limitation period for claims due to defects in quality is two years. Each limitation period above shall begin on the date the customer is aware (or ought reasonably to be aware) of the circumstances giving rise to the claim.

 

9.1.6     Jedox’s liability for defects of the goods shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 11.

 

10.2       In case of the granting of the use of software free of charge in accordance with clause 8.2 and 8.3, to the extent permitted by law, Jedox does not accept any liability in relation to the software provided free of charge, the use of software provided free of charge or the provision of services in relation to software provided free of charge.

 

10.3       The customer is solely responsible for ensuring that its access to and use of the software and services of Jedox complies with all applicable laws.

 

18.           Legal defects

 

18.1         In as far as Jedox licenses Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

18.1.1          If the product is encumbered by a legal defect, the customer may demand a method of using the product that is not subject to any legal objection or provision of an equivalent product free of such defects. Jedox retains the right to determine which alternative product this may be.

 

18.1.2          The customer agrees to notify Jedox without delay and in writing if any third parties assert industrial or intellectual property rights (e.g. copyright or patent rights) in the product against customer. The customer authorises Jedox to pursue the dispute with the third party on behalf of customer. For as long as Jedox makes use of such authorisation, the customer shall not be permitted to acknowledge any such third-party claims without the consent of Jedox; Jedox shall defend against such third-party claims at its own expense and indemnify the customer in relation to all costs arising from such defense to the extent that such cost does not arise from of the customer’s breach of obligations (e.g. use of the product in violation of the contract).

 

18.1.3          For damages resulting from legal defects of the products, the liability of Jedox shall be subject to the limits specified in clause 11.

 

18.2         In case of software provided free of charge in accordance with clauses 8.2 and 8.3, to the extent permitted by law, Jedox does not accept any liability with regards to legal defects in respect of the software provided free of charge.

 

19.           Limitation of Liability

 

19.1         In as far as Jedox licenses Standard Software for payment of a one-time flat fee, the following applies:

 

19.2         The Standard Software, other Jedox software licensed or provided to the customer or the other products or services provided by Jedox to the customer may be subject to consumer guarantees that cannot be excluded under Singapore law. If customer is entitled to any remedy for breach of the consumer guarantees contained in any relevant Singapore law, then nothing in these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions will operate so as to exclude, restrict or modify the application of any of the provisions of such law when the exercise of a right conferred by such a provision, or any liability of Jedox for a breach of a condition, warranty or guarantee implied by such law would render it void to do so.  To the extent permitted by law, Jedox and its related entities expressly limit their liability for a breach of any condition, warranty or guarantee implied by virtue of any relevant Singapore legislation to, at the election of Jedox:

(e)         in the case of goods, any one or more of the following:

                                xiii.                    the replacement of the goods or the supply of equivalent goods;

                               xiv.                    the repair of the goods;

                                 xv.                    the payment of the cost of replacing the goods or of acquiring equivalent goods; or

                               xvi.                    the payment of the cost of having the goods repaired; or

(f)           in the case of services:

(i)               the supplying of the services again; or

(ii)              the payment of the cost of having the services supplied again.

 

19.2.1          In all other cases of liability of Jedox to the customer, all compensation claims including due to the breach of a duty by Jedox, breach of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox and due to tort by Jedox are excluded, so that, to the maximum extent permitted by law, Jedox is not liable for lost profit or other monetary damage incurred by the customer. If Jedox is found to be liable to pay any damages, compensation or other amounts to the customer under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, such liability will be limited to the amount set out in clause 5.4 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

19.2.2          Without limiting any other provisions of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, if the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’s liability in cases of negligence which results in data loss shall be limited to the recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

19.3         In case of a transfer of software free of charge in accordance with clause 8.2 and 8.3, Jedox is only liable to the customer for claims for willful misconduct or gross negligence of Jedox, with any liability of Jedox in respect of such claims limited to the amount set out in clause 5.4 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

19.4         Without limiting any other provisions of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, Jedox is not liable for any Consequential Loss (however caused) suffered or incurred by the customer in connection with this agreement or the provision of the services. This clause applies even if Jedox knew or ought to have known that the relevant Consequential Loss would be suffered.  Consequential Loss means loss beyond the normal measure of damages and further includes, without limitation, all indirect loss, all loss of revenue, all loss of reputation, all loss of profits, all loss of data, all loss of actual or anticipated savings, all loss of bargain, all lost opportunities, including opportunities to enter into arrangements with third parties, all loss of use, all cost of capital and all costs of substitute goods, facilities or services.

 

19.5         If Jedox’s liability is excluded or limited due to any of the aforesaid provisions, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

20.           Indemnity

 

The customer must indemnify and keep Jedox, its directors, employees and subsidiaries, indemnified against any loss which arises directly or indirectly out of:

(k)         any breach of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions by the customer including any breach in respect of which Jedox exercises a right to terminate;

(l)           the customer or any other person in any way accessing or using the Jedox software;

(m)        any use of the Jedox software by the customer not complying with privacy or other laws of any applicable jurisdiction;

(n)         any negligent or unlawful acts of the customer or any of its related parties or their respective employees, officers, contractors or representatives,

except to the extent the relevant loss arises as a direct result of any breach of these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox or any grossly negligent or unlawful act of Jedox or any of its personnel.

 

 

21.           Termination

 

21.1         Jedox may, by written notice to the customer, terminate the agreement with immediate effect if:

(i)           the customer fails to comply with any written notice issued by Jedox requiring the customer to remedy a breach, non-observance or non-performance of the customer’s obligations under these Perpetual Licence Terms in Business Transactions within seven business days of receiving that notice from Jedox;

(j)           the customer commits a breach of these Perpetual Licence Terms in Business Transactions which is incapable of remedy;

(k)         the customer goes into liquidation, is wound up, becomes insolvent or has a receiver appointed over all or any substantial part of its assets; or

(l)           the customer proposes or enters into any schemes of arrangements with its creditors.

 

21.2         Notice of termination must be given in writing.

 

21.3         Upon termination of the agreement taking effect:

(a)         the customer must cease all usage of the software;

(b)         the customer must remove from all storage media and destroy all copies of the Jedox software and notify Jedox of this in writing;

(c)         the customer must immediately pay to Jedox all fees, expenses or other sums payable (if any) to Jedox under these Perpetual Licence Terms in Business Transactions which have accrued or are payable as at the date of termination; and

(d)         Jedox ceases to have any obligations under these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, including but not limited to Jedox having no obligation to provide the customer with updates, maintenance or support.

 

 

22.           Reservation of Ownership Rights

 

The ownership of the products and the rights under clause 8 shall pass to the customer only after payment in full of the purchase price as specified in clause 6. For the avoidance of doubt, Jedox retains ownership of all intellectual property rights in respect of the Standard Software, other Jedox software licensed or provided to the customer and all intellectual property generated by Jedox as a result of its provision of the services and nothing in these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions grants the customer any ownership of or other rights in respect of such intellectual property (other than the licenses granted to the customer under these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions).

 

III.          Concluding Provisions

 

23.           Compliance Audit of Contract Terms

 

15.1   Jedox has the right to examine the records and IT systems of the customer to inspect the observance of the contractual conditions; Jedox shall in particular verify if the customer uses the software both qualitatively and quantitatively in accordance with the license agreements and terms ("Auditing"). The customer shall at our first request inform us on the number of visitors, the system environment used and the version number of the software used by the customer, provide access to the documents and records required in verifying the contractual use as well as to inspect the hardware and software environment used in connection with the contractual software. Jedox is authorized to commission third parties with these tasks. Jedox will give the customer corresponding written notice at least ten (10) business days before such an inspection unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software is not used as contractually agreed and that a notification would jeopardize the purpose of the audit. The inspection will be conducted during the normal business hours of the customers on his premises and shall not impede his business processes more than necessary.

 

15.2   If the audit shows that the purchased number of licenses is exceeded by more than 5 % (five percent) or if another substantial non-contractual use (in particular a non-permissible reworking or redesign of the software) has been found the customer shall bear the costs of the audit. A maximum of one audit per calendar year shall be conducted unless Jedox has concrete grounds for believing that the software has been used non-contractually.

 

 

24.           Confidentiality

 

24.1         The parties hereto each undertake to treat in strict confidence all items (e.g. software, documentation, information) received from or that become known via the other party before the conclusion of or in the performance of the contract and that are protected by law, that include business or operational secrets or that are described as being confidential, during and beyond the term of the contract, unless they become known to the public without infringement of the duty to maintain confidentiality. The parties shall keep and safeguard all such items such that third parties are completely denied access to them.

 

24.2         The customer agrees that it shall make the contractual products available only to those of its employees and other third parties that require such access to perform their respective tasks. The customer agrees to instruct such persons on the need to maintain secrecy and confidentiality with respect to such items.

 

24.3         Jedox shall process customer's data required for the transaction in accordance with any relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations (including any applicable provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012, as amended from time to time). However, customer is solely responsible for ensuring that the use of Jedox software or the services by the customer and the processing of customer’s data by Jedox as required for the transaction will comply with all applicable privacy or data protection laws.

 

24.4         Following successful provision of the services, Jedox shall be entitled to cite the customer as a reference customer, including in Jedox promotional and marketing materials.

 

 

25.           Entire Agreement

 

These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between Jedox and the customer and supersedes all previous discussions, correspondence, negotiations, arrangements, understandings and agreements between them relating to its subject matter. Each party acknowledges that in accepting these Terms and Conditions, it does not rely on, and shall have no remedies in respect of, any representation or warranty (whether made innocently or negligently) that is not set out in these Terms and Conditions.

 

 

26.           Waiver

 

No failure by Jedox to insist on strict performance of any of the terms in these Terms is a waiver of any right or remedy which Jedox may have, and is not a waiver of any subsequent breach or default by the customer.

 

 

27.           Assignment

 

27.1         The customer shall not, without the prior written consent of Jedox, assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions.

 

27.2         Jedox may at any time assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner, with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions without the consent of the customer.

 

 

28.           Place of Performance, Jurisdiction, Governing Law

 

28.1         If any provision of these Terms and Conditions is determined by a competent authority to be unlawful, invalid, and unenforceable or in conflict with any rule or law, statute, ordinance or regulation then the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not thereby affected.

 

28.2         These Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Singapore.

 

28.3         Any dispute arising out of or in connection with these Perpetual License Terms in Business Transactions, including any question regarding its existence, validity or termination that cannot be settled amicably by mutual negotiations, shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration administered by the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC") in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC Rules") for the time being in force, which rules are deemed to be incorporated by reference in this clause. The seat of the arbitration shall be Singapore. The Tribunal shall consist of a single arbitrator to be appointed by the President of the SIAC Court of Arbitration and the language of the arbitration shall be in English.

 

 

 

Q

 

Terms and conditions for the subscription of Software licences in business transactions

(as of May 2017)

 

I.             Introductory Provisions

 

2.             Application

 

2.1.        These Terms apply to all Software licensed and all Services provided by the Company. Offers, deliveries, and other services made by Jedox Pte Ltd (UEN 201626701M) ("Jedox") present or future, relating to the payable use of software within the scope of the Subscription Licence to Customers are provided exclusively on the basis of these Terms and Conditions for the subscription of standard software licences in business transactions ("Subscription Terms"). Jedox does not recognize any of general terms and conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than these Subscription Terms.

 

2.2.        In these Terms:

2.2.1.             "Acceptance of Order" means the Company’s written acknowledgment that the Customer has applied to licence the Software and that the grant of the Subscription Licence is subject to the Contract.

2.2.2.             "Company" means Jedox Pte Ltd and its successors and assigns.

2.2.3.             "Confidential Information" means all the information provided by the Company to the Customer in connection with this Contract where such information is identified as confidential at the time of its disclosure or ought reasonably to be considered confidential based on its content, nature or the manner of its disclosure and includes but is not limited to the Company’s trade secrets, confidential business and technical information, know-how, customer and supplier lists (whether in electronic or hard copy form),  and other information not generally known to the public but for a breach of these Terms.

2.2.4.             "Consequential Loss or Damage" means loss of profits, revenue, use or opportunity, loss of reputation, loss of access to markets, loss of goodwill, re-installation costs, removal costs and any remote, indirect, abnormal or unforeseeable form of loss or damage whether arising from a breach of Contract or tort (including negligence) or under statute or any other basis in law or equity.

2.2.5.             "Contract" means the agreement between the Company and the Customer constituted by these Terms and, if issued, will also comprise and include the Acceptance of Order, the Licence Proposal, the Terms and the Order and if there is any inconsistency between them, then the Acceptance of Order will prevail over the Licence Proposal, the Terms and the Order, the Licence Proposal will prevail over the Terms and the Order, and the Terms will prevail over the Order.

2.2.6.             "Customer" means the person or entity with whom the Company has contracted under the Contract and his, her or its successors and assigns. These Subscription Terms shall only apply to persons or organizations who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity at the commencement of the agreement.

2.2.7.             "Intellectual Property Rights" means all intellectual property rights including but not limited to all copyright, patents, trademarks, design rights, trade secrets, domain names, know-how and other rights of a similar nature throughout the world, whether or not now existing and whether or not registered or registrable, and any applications for registration or rights to make any such application as well as all renewals and extensions of such rights. 

2.2.8.             "Licence Proposal" means the Company’s written offer to licence the Software to the Customer and includes any written amendments issued by the Company prior to or simultaneous with issue of the Order.

2.2.9.             "Order" means the Customer’s written response to the Licence Proposal.

2.2.10.          "Services" means all services provided by the Company from time to time.

2.2.11.          "Software" means all Standard Software programmes, Software Content and other products supplied by the Company from time to time.

2.2.12.          “Standard Software” means the Jedox Suite (including programs, program modules, tools, etc.) based on common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users, including the respective and corresponding documentation. It constitutes a standardized platform which can be adapted for individual requirements of different customers through configuration. Jedox provides the respective and then current version of the Jedox Suite.

2.2.13.          “Software Content” means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

2.2.14.          "Subscription Fee" means the fee payable for the temporary use of the licensed Software.

2.2.15.          "Subscription Licence" means the non-exclusive, non-transferable right to use the Software during the Subscription Period, where the Software is hosted on the Customer’s premises and/or a hosting company chosen by the Customer. The rights under this Subscription Licence shall only be granted for the duration of the Subscription Period.

2.2.16.           "Subscription Period" means subject to the payment of the Subscription Fee, the period for which the Customer has been granted a licence to use the Software.

2.2.17.          "Support & Maintenance" means the performance of support and maintenance services as contractually agreed and defined in the "Terms and Conditions for Software Support Contracts in Business Transactions“ ("support terms“); warranty rights of the Customer according to clause 8 shall remain unaffected; the installation, operation and maintenance of the Software however lies within the sole responsibility of the Customer.

2.2.18.          "Terms" means these Terms and Conditions, as amended from time to time.

 

2.3.        All provisions of the Contract are set out in these Terms, the Licence Proposal, the Order and the Acceptance of Order and the Contract contains no other express or implied terms.

 

2.4.        No amendment, alteration, waiver or cancellation of any of these Terms is binding on the Company unless confirmed by the Company in writing.

 

2.5.        Particulars on the Jedox website, in leaflets, catalogues, drawings, brochures and other printed material are illustrations only and form no part of the Contract and are not binding on the Company unless specifically referred to in the Contract. 

 

2.6.        The Customer acknowledges that no employee or agent of the Company has any right to make any representation, warranty or promise, whether express or implied, in relation to the Software or the Services other than as contained in these Terms.

 

 

3.             Technical Documents

 

3.1.        All technical documents such as drawings, illustrations, descriptions as well as test programmes and quotation documents are the exclusive property of the Company.  They must not be made available to third parties or copied, duplicated or used for reproducing any part of the Software. Jedox reserves all ownership, copyrights, and commercial property rights (including the right to register these rights) to all offer documents of Jedox, including test programs, illustrations, and cost estimates.  If a quotation is not accepted then all documents must be either returned to the Company or destroyed. 

 

3.2.        The Company reserves the right to make technical changes and updates to the Software provided that the changes do not affect the ordinary use of the Software by the Customer.  

 

4.             Time for Delivery and Performance

 

4.1.        After conclusion of the agreement we will make the software available to the customer via download (On- Premises Subscription) or integrated in an external Cloud (Subscription as a Service). The respective version of the Software Content is available in the Jedox Marketplace.

 

4.2.        Delivery times are estimates only unless the Company has agreed in writing to be bound by the delivery date.

 

4.3.        The Company will not be liable to the Customer for any breach of contract due to any matter or thing beyond the Company’s control (including but not limited to transport stoppages, fire, flood, earthquake, acts of God, strikes, lock-outs, work stoppages, wars, riots or civil commotion, intervention of public authority, explosion, accident or power outages).

 

4.4.        The Company will notify the Customer of any delay as soon as practicable.

 

4.5.        If the delay is likely to be longer than three months then Jedox as well as the Customer can terminate the Contract immediately on providing written notice of termination to the other party.  

 

 

II.                Terms of Subscription Licence Provision

 

5.             Customer’s Rights and Obligations During the Subscription Period

 

5.1.        In consideration of payment of the Subscription Fee by the Customer to the Company, the Company grants the Customer a Subscription Licence during the Subscription Period subject to these Terms.  The Customer acknowledges that the Company retains the ownership in the Software whether in its original form or as modified during the term of the Contract.

 

5.2.        The Customer is granted the right during the Subscription Period to make copies of the Software to the extent necessary to run and operate the Software on one server respective hosted by one network of remote servers for use by the maximum number of agreed users.  The Customer is not permitted to have more than the agreed number of users.  Additional Subscription Licences can be acquired for testing, backup and development.

 

5.3.        The Customer may not reproduce, make error corrections, decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise modify or adapt the Software or create any derivative works based on the Software unless it is necessary for the Software to be compatible with the operation of other programmes used by the Customer or to rectify mistakes in the Software and the Company has failed to provide the Customer with the necessary information within a reasonable period after being requested to do so by the Customer.

 

5.4.        The Customer may not sell, rent out or otherwise grant sub-licences of the Software.
