5.5.        The Customer may not authorise the use or copying of the Software by a third party or subcontractor without the written consent of the Company.

 

5.6.        The Customer is not permitted to copy or partially copy the Software on to another disc or USB stick or other storage device apart from for the purpose of making a backup copy. Any backup copies must be clearly marked “Backup Copy”.

 

5.7.        The customer is not allowed to undertake actions that jeopardize the data security or data integrity of our products. In particular, our software licenses must not be used for spamming, illegal manipulation of data or any other form of cyber-attack.

 

5.8.        In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software, Software Content or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

5.9.        Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

5.10.     The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

5.11.     If the Customer breaches any of the above sub-clauses then the Company is entitled to immediately terminate the Contract and cancel the Subscription Licence. Where the Contract is terminated by the Company, the Customer must immediately remove the Software from its computer system and destroy all copies of the Software from its systems as well as all backup copies.

 

6.             Terms of Payment for Subscription Licence

 

6.1.        Unless otherwise agreed in writing, payment for the Subscription Licence for the initial Subscription Period is to be made in accordance with the current price list and is calculated based on a minimum term of twelve months.  After the expiry of the initial Subscription Period, unless otherwise agreed in writing, and where a further Subscription Period has not been specifically agreed between the Parties, payment for any further Subscription Period will be calculated in accordance with the prices current at the time of renewal based on the Subscription Fee for a twelve (12) month Subscription Licence.

 

6.2.        Payment, unless otherwise agreed in writing, is due within three (3) working days from the start date of the Subscription Period and is payable one year in advance.  After the initial Subscription Period has expired, if not otherwise agreed in writing, payment for the following Subscription Period falls due on the third working day after the commencement of the further Subscription Period.

 

6.3.        Interest is payable on all overdue accounts calculated on a daily basis at the rate of interest equivalent to the prime lending rate of DBS Bank, Singapore, plus 8% until full payment is received by the Company.

 

6.4.        Payment must be made in full, without any set-off, deduction or discount other than as agreed by the Company, as stated in these Terms, the relevant invoice or statement to the Customer, or where there is a binding judgement in favour of the Customer against the Company and all rights of appeal have been exhausted.

 

6.5.        Payment by cheque will only be accepted by prior agreement and will only be applied against any outstanding invoices after it has been credited as cleared funds in the Company’s bank account.

 

6.6.        The Customer is liable for all charges associated with the payment of the invoice, including but not limited to bank charges, account charges and other expenses.

 

7.             Termination

 

7.1.        Unless otherwise agreed in writing, the Contract is for the Subscription Period agreed between the Parties.  In the absence of any other written agreement, and if the Contract is not terminated in writing by either Party not less than three (3) months prior to the end of the Subscription Period, on expiry of the Subscription Period, the Contract will automatically renew for a further twelve (12) month period.

 

7.2.        The Company has the right to terminate the Contract immediately at any time by giving written notice to the Customer in any of the following events:

 

7.2.1.         if the Customer fails to make payment when due and payable and the Customer fails to rectify such failure within fourteen business days of written notice to do so;

 

7.2.2.         if the Customer commits a breach or non-observance of any non-essential term of the Contract and the Customer fails to rectify such breach or non-observance within twenty-one days of written notice to do so;

 

7.2.3.         if the Customer enters into liquidation or compounds with its creditors or has a receiver or manager appointed to all or any part of its assets or takes any similar action in consequence of debt or any similar event in respect of the Customer under the law of the jurisdiction;

 

7.2.4.         if the Customer or, if the Customer is a company, any principal officer of the Customer becomes bankrupt or insolvent or enters into any arrangement with its creditors or takes any similar action in consequence of debt or any similar event in respect of the Customer under the law of the jurisdiction;

 

7.2.5.         if there is a change in the shareholding of the Customer, its parent company or its ultimate holding company or in the composition of the board of directors of the Customer, its parent company or its ultimate holding company which, in the opinion of the Customer, adversely affects the interests of or is otherwise unacceptable to the Company.

 

7.3.        If the Contract is terminated or expires for any reason then, in addition and without prejudice to any other rights or remedies available:

(a)         the Customer’s right to use the Software immediately ceases;

(b)         the Customer must immediately remove the Software from the Customer’s server and/or cloud platforms, destroy all copies of the Software, including all backup copies and notify the Company in writing that this has been done;

(c)         the Customer must immediately pay all outstanding fees, if any; and

(d)         provide Company with written confirmation that it has completed its obligations under this clause 6.3.

 

8.             Intellectual Property and Other Warranties

 

8.1.        Nothing in this Contract constitutes a transfer or assignment of any of the Intellectual Property Rights in the Software owned by the Company to the Customer.

 

8.2.        The Customer:

(a)         acknowledges and agrees that the Company owns all the Intellectual Property Rights in and to the licensed Software; and

(b)         will not directly or indirectly do anything that would or might invalidate or put the Company’s Intellectual Property Rights in or to the Software and Services in dispute.

 

8.3.        If any person makes any claim alleging that any of the Software and Services (or any use of the Software and Services) infringes any Intellectual Property Rights of any person, the Customer must:

(a)         promptly notify the Company in writing;

(b)         not make any admissions or take any actions in relation to the claim without the Company’s prior written consent;

(c)         permit the Company to have complete control over any and all investigations, negotiations, settlement and dispute resolution proceedings relating to the claim; and

(d)         cooperate with, assist and act at all times in accordance with the reasonable instructions of the Company in relation to the claim and any consequent investigations, negotiations, settlement and dispute resolution proceedings. 

 

8.4.        The Customer acknowledges that the Intellectual Property Rights in and to any content created by the Customer while using the Software and Services in accordance with the terms of the Contract remain the property of the Company.

 

8.5.        The Company warrants that it holds the Intellectual Property Rights to the Software during the Subscription Period and that no third party holds any Intellectual Property Rights in the Software which prevent the Customer from using the Software in accordance with the Contract.

 

8.6.        Unless the Customer has inspected the Software or Services and given written notice to the Company within eight business days after receipt of the Software or provision of the Services that the Software or Services are defective, did not comply with the relevant specifications or descriptions, or that the Software or Services are faulty or damaged, the Software and Services are deemed to have been accepted in good order and condition and compliant with those specifications and descriptions.

 

9.             Support & Maintenance

 

9.1.        The Company warrants that the contractually agreed quality of the Software is maintained over the duration of the subscription use agreement and that no third-party rights conflict with the contractual use of the Software. The Company shall remedy defects in quality and defects in title that may arise within a reasonable time period after receipt of the Customer's notice of defects.

 

9.2.        The Customer must immediately notify us in writing in the event that Software defects have been discovered. In the case of quality defects time and circumstances of the occurrence of the defects must be indicated.

 

9.3.        If, within eight (8) working days, the Customer does not notify us of defects that are known to him or obvious, the Customer's rights to a reduction of the remuneration or to terminate the Contract on account of the defects are excluded.

 

9.4.        Warranty rights of the Customer are excluded if the Customer makes changes to, or commissions, changes of the Software without our consent unless the Customer provides evidence that the changes have consequences for the analysis and removal of the defect which are acceptable for us and did not cause the defect. The Customer rights due to defects shall remain unaffected on condition that the Customer is entitled to make changes, in particular in exercising the right to correct defects on his own accord, that the changes are made adequately and appropriately, and that they are traceably documented.

 

9.5.        The Company is entitled but not obliged to continuously develop the Software and to make additional features or extensions of the Software available to the Customer by way of updates. The Company is entitled to adjust the technical requirements correspondingly. Prior to the installation of updates the Customer has to make sure that his systems meet the updated system requirements.

 

9.6.        The Company will make its best effort to inform the Customer prior to the provision of updates, whose installation is required for a smooth operation of the Software, about the update, system requirements and the date of the provision. The Customer is obliged to install updates himself within a period of four weeks from the provision of the update. This may also require an update of the required third-party software including the operating system. The Company undertakes to inform the Customer accordingly.

 

9.7.        The support agreed in accordance with the support terms and conditions pursuant to clause 1.2.15 of these Subscription Terms does not restrict the warranty rights of the Customer according to this clause 8.

 

10.           Limitation of Liability

 

10.1.     The Customer acknowledges and agrees that:

(a)          the Customer has determined that the Software is fit for the purpose for which the Customer requires it; and

(b)          the Customer has not relied on the Company’s skill and judgement in selecting the Software.

 

10.2.     Except as provided in clause 9.3., the Company is not subject to, and the Customer releases the Company from any liability (including but not limited to Consequential Loss or Damage) arising from any delay in delivery of or any defect or fault in the Software to the full extent permitted by law.

 

10.3.     Any liability of Company for any loss, however caused (including by the negligence of Jedox), suffered by the Customer in connection with any delay by Jedox in providing the Jedox Subscription services, other services of Jedox or any contractual item is limited to an amount equivalent to 3% per annum of the total value of the subscription services (with the total value of the subscription services being the total amounts paid to Jedox by the customer for the provision of the relevant subscription services). The limitation of liability in this clause 9.3 shall not apply in the event of delay due to gross negligence, or in the event of death or injury to life, body, or health.

 

10.4.     If the Terms, despite clause 9.2, or the provisions of any Singapore law imposes on the Company a liability for a defect or fault in the Software then, to the extent to which the Company is entitled to do so, the Company’s liability is limited, at the Company’s option, to:

(a)          replacement or repair of the Software;

(b)          providing the Services again;

(c)          supply of equivalent Software; or

(d)          payment of the cost of replacing or repairing the Software or of acquiring equivalent products or having the Services provided by a third party,

 

and in any case:

10.4.1.      the Company will not be liable for any Consequential Loss or Damage or any other loss or damage; and

10.4.2.      unless specified otherwise in these Terms, the Company’s total liability to the Customer is limited to the invoice value of the Software or Services, as the case may be.

 

10.5.     The Company is not liable under any circumstances for the loss of the Customer’s data.  If the Customer has failed to carry out regular backups of its data, the Company’s liability is limited to the reinstallation of the Software only.

 

10.6.     If Company’s liability is excluded or limited due to any of the aforesaid provisions, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Company’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

11.           Company’s right to sub-contract

 

The Company may subcontract any of the Services provided under this Contract, provided that the subcontractor carrying out the work has the required skills and experience in the relevant Jedox products.

 

 

III.              Miscellaneous Terms

 

12.            Indemnity

 

The customer must indemnify and keep Jedox, its directors, employees and subsidiaries, indemnified against any loss which arises directly or indirectly out of:

(a)          any breach of these Subscription Terms by the customer including any breach in respect of which Company exercises a right to terminate;

(b)          the Customer or any other person in any way using the Subscription Licences;

(c)          any negligent or unlawful acts of the Customer or any of its related parties or their respective employees, officers, contractors or representatives,

except to the extent the relevant loss arises as a direct result of any breach of these Subscription Terms by Company or any grossly negligent or unlawful act of Jedox or any of its personnel.

 

13.           Audit

 

The Customer must permit the Company (or its nominated auditor) to audit the records and premises of the Customer at any time during the Term and for three (3) years following the end of the Term, on at least ten (10) days written notice for the purpose of confirming the Customer’s compliance with the Contract provided that such audit will not unduly interfere with the conduct of the Customer’s business.  If the audit reasonably establishes that the Customer has breached the Contract then the Customer must pay the reasonable cost of the audit.

 

14.           Confidentiality and Privacy

 

14.1.     The Customer must not, without the prior written consent of the Company, use or disclose the Confidential Information unless expressly permitted to do so by these Terms or required to do so by law or any regulatory authority.

 

14.2.     The Customer may:

(a)          use the Confidential Information solely for the purposes of complying with its obligations and exercising its rights under this Contract; and

(b)          disclose the Confidential Information to its personnel or advisors to the extent necessary for them to know the information for purposes related to this Contract, but only if reasonable steps are taken to ensure that the confidentiality of the Confidential Information is retained.

 

14.3.     The Customer must implement and maintain effective security measures to prevent unauthorised use and disclosure of the Confidential Information, including by ensuring that all employees, subcontractors or other third parties who have access to the Confidential Information agree to be bound by this clause, whilst it is in the Customer’s possession or control.

 

14.4.     The Customer must return or, at the Company’s option, destroy all Confidential Information of the Company in the Customer’s possession or control on the earlier of the Company’s request or on termination of the Contract for any reason.

 

14.5.     The Customer acknowledges and agrees that the Company may collect, store and use personal information in relation to the Customer or, if the Customer is a company, its directors and officers, for the purposes of considering any credit application from the Customer or any other purpose related and incidental to the business relationship between the Customer and the Company in accordance with any obligations under the Personal Data Protection Act 2012, as may be amended from time to time, and any related act and/or regulations.

 

14.6.     The Company agrees that it will not disclose any personal information of the Customer or its directors or officers to any third party except to obtain credit information concerning the Customer, make an entry of the Customer’s credit report, or to enforce these Terms in accordance with any obligations under the Personal Data Protection Act 2012, as may be amended from time to time, and any related act and/or regulations.

 

14.7.     The Customer agrees that the Company may use the Customer as a trade reference.

 

15.           Governing Law

 

15.1.     If any provision of these Terms is held by a competent authority to be unlawful, invalid, and unenforceable or in conflict with any rule or law, statute, ordinance or regulation then the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not thereby affected.

 

15.2.     These Subscription Terms and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Singapore.

 

15.3.     This Contract for the supply of Software and the provision of Services is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Singapore. Any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Contract, including any question regarding its existence, validity or termination that cannot be settled amicably by mutual negotiations, shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration administered by the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC") in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC Rules") for the time being in force, which rules are deemed to be incorporated by reference in this clause. The seat of the arbitration shall be Singapore. The Tribunal shall consist of a single arbitrator to be appointed by the President of the SIAC Court of Arbitration and the language of the arbitration shall be in English.

 

16.           Waiver of Breach

 

No failure by the Company to insist on strict performance of any of the terms in these Terms is a waiver of any right or remedy which the Company may have, and is not a waiver of any subsequent breach or default by the Customer.

 

17.           No Assignment

 

17.1.     The customer shall not, without the prior written consent of Jedox, assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms.

 

17.2.     Jedox may at any time assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner, with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions without the consent of the customer.

 

18.           Severability

 

If any provision contained in these Terms is held by a court to be unlawful, invalid or unenforceable, the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not affected.

 

19.           GST Matters

 

19.1.     For the purposes of this clause:

19.1.1.          "GST" means the goods and services tax as imposed by the GST Law together with any related interest, penalties, fines or other charge;

19.1.2.          "GST Amount" means any Payment (or the relevant part of that Payment) multiplied by the appropriate rate of GST (currently 7%);

19.1.3.          "GST Law" has the meaning given to that term in the Goods and Services Tax Act, or, if that Act does not exist for any reason, means any Act imposing or relating to the imposition or administration of a goods and services tax in Singapore and any regulation made under that Act;

19.1.4.          “Indirect Tax” means any goods or services tax, value added tax, consumption tax or tax of a similar kind;

19.1.5.          "Payment" means any amount payable under or in connection with this Contract including any amount payable by way of indemnity, reimbursement or otherwise (other than a GST Amount) and includes the provision of any non-monetary consideration;

19.1.6.          "Tax Invoice" has the meaning given to that term by the GST Law; and

19.1.7.          "Taxable Supply" has the meaning given to that term by the GST Law.

 

19.2.     The parties agree that:

 

19.2.1.      unless specifically stated otherwise, all Payments have been calculated without regard to GST. The prices quoted in the applicable list of prices and conditions of Company are subject to Indirect Taxes or any other relevant taxes and shipping costs which amounts will be payable by the Customer in addition to the prices;

 

19.2.2.      each Party will comply with its obligations under the GST Law when calculating the amount of any Payment and the amount of any relevant Payments will be adjusted accordingly;

 

19.2.3.      if the whole or any part of any Payment is the consideration for a Taxable Supply, the payer must pay to the payee an additional amount equal to the GST Amount, either concurrently with that Payment or as otherwise agreed in writing;

 

19.2.4.      any reference to a cost or expense in this Contract excludes any amount in respect of GST forming part of the relevant cost or expense when incurred by the relevant party for which that party can claim credit for an input tax; and

 

19.2.5.      the payee will provide to the payer a Tax Invoice.

 

 

 

R

 

Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software via Internet (Software as a Service, abbreviated SaaS) in Business Transactions

(as of December 2017)

 

I.             Introductory Provisions

 

18.           General, Applicability

 

18.1              Offers, deliveries, and other services made by Jedox Pte Ltd  (UEN 201626701M) ("Jedox") present or future, relating to the payable use of software within the scope of the Jedox SaaS License to the persons or entities specified in clause 1.2 herein are provided exclusively on the basis of these Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software via Internet (Software as a Service, abbreviated SaaS) in Business Transactions ("SaaS Terms in Business Transactions"). Jedox does not recognize any of general terms and conditions of customers, regardless if these conditions are contrary to, diverging from or otherwise different than these SaaS Terms.

 

18.2              These SaaS Terms in Business Transactions shall only apply to persons or organizations who are conducting commercial or independent professional activity at the commencement of the agreement ("entrepreneurs"). They do not apply to natural persons who enter into the agreement or acquire services from Jedox for personal, domestic or household purposes or another purpose not attributable to their commercial or independent professional activity.

 

18.3              Within the contractually agreed term, the performance of support and maintenance services are included as defined in the "Terms and Conditions for Software Support Contracts in Business Transactions" ("support terms"). The provision of Software Content is regulated in the “General Terms and Conditions for the on-premises subscription use (“Jedox Subscription”) of standard software, whereas Software Content means standardized applications of programs, modules of programs, tools etc. of the Jedox Standard Software (Jedox Suite) for defined critical areas, for defined solutions and fields of application (corresponding documentation included). Jedox Software Content is developed according to common requirements of the market and for recurrently arising, comparable and standardized tasks for different users. It speeds up deployment and time to value for Jedox customers and allow to adapt to individual structures, processes, instructions, course of actions etc. through configuration and parametrization. In particular Jedox Models, Connectors and Building Blocks are considered as Software Content.

 

18.4              Where other products or services are acquired from Jedox, such Jedox training services, Jedox software licensing or Jedox business transaction services, other Jedox terms and conditions may apply to the provision of those services. 

 

 

19.           Agreement Content, Agreement Conclusion

 

19.1              The details and information contained on the Jedox website and in product catalogs shall only become legally

binding components of the agreement if expressly referenced in it.

 

19.2              By accepting an offer from Jedox or placing an order with Jedox in respect of SaaS services, the customer agrees that it has read, understood and will be bound by these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, together with the written order confirmation of Jedox and any notices posted by Jedox on its website from time to time pursuant to these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions. If you are entering into these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions as an agent, officer, employee or other representative of the customer, you warrant to Jedox that you have full legal authority to bind the customer to these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions.

 

19.3              The content of the agreement relationship and the scope of delivery and services shall be governed exclusively by these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions and the written order confirmation of Jedox or, in the case of a binding offer of Jedox and its due acceptance, by these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions and the offer. To be valid, any side agreements, verbal declarations by employees or representatives of Jedox or any related entity of Jedox and amendments to confirmed orders (including changes to items to be delivered) must be confirmed by Jedox in writing; transmission by telecommunications shall be sufficient. The SaaS services to be provided by Jedox to the customer are as set out or referred to in the written confirmation of order or as otherwise agreed by the parties in writing.

 

20.           Product descriptions

 

20.1              To the full extent permissible by applicable law, product descriptions on the Jedox website or in catalogues, brochures, etc. do not represent guaranteed features.

 

20.2              The customer acknowledges that nothing in these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions grants the customer any ownership of or rights in respect of the intellectual property in the SaaS services provided by Jedox, the software or other technology or materials created or used by Jedox to provide the SaaS services or any improvements to the SaaS services, software, technology or materials of Jedox created in connection with the provision of the SaaS services.  Any intellectual property in respect of the SaaS services provided by Jedox which is created by or vests in the customer is assigned to Jedox immediately upon the intellectual property being created or vesting in the customer and the customer agrees to do all things and execute all documents as is reasonably necessary to effect such assignment.

 

20.3              Jedox reserves all ownership, copyrights, and commercial property rights (including the right to register these rights) to all offer documents of Jedox, including test programs, illustrations, and cost estimates. If an offer is not accepted or otherwise on written demand by Jedox, the listed documents shall be returned to Jedox without delay.

 

20.4              Jedox reserves the right to implement technical changes in respect of the Jedox SaaS services or any other aspect of the Jedox services or contractual item, provided that the usual or contractually intended use of the service or contractual item is not significantly impaired.

 

20.5              Nothing in these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions grants the customer any ownership of or rights to use the trade marks of Jedox.  The customer will not adopt, register or attempt to register or use any trade marks which are identical or deceptively similar to the trade marks owned by Jedox.

 

21.           Customer responsibilities and obligations

 

21.1              The customer will be responsible for:

(q)         uploading all of its data to the SaaS infrastructure offered by Jedox;

(r)          the day to day use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(s)         obtaining all consents, permits or approvals necessary to upload its data to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, store its data on the Jedox SaaS infrastructure and otherwise use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(t)           ensuring that the use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure by the customer and the uploading and storage of its data complies with all applicable laws, regulations or codes of conduct;

(u)         satisfying itself that the Jedox SaaS infrastructure is compatible with its own hardware, software and internet and network capabilities and maintaining all hardware, software, third party applications and other technology necessary to be able to access and use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(v)         any acts or omissions committed by the employees, officers, contractors or representatives of the customer or any of its related parties in relation to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure.

 

21.2              The customer must:

(a)         use the SaaS services only for its internal business purposes;

(b)         only use and copy the documentation and other materials provided by Jedox in connection with the SaaS services to the extent necessary to use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(c)         comply with all policies regarding the SaaS services offered by Jedox which Jedox notifies the customer of from time to time (which notification may be provided by Jedox making the relevant policies accessible via its website);

(d)         not use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure in any way or for any purpose other than as contemplated by these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions;

(e)         not modify, adapt, reverse engineer, translate, de-compile, disassemble or copy all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox;

(f)           not attempt to circumvent or break any encryption, decryption or other security device or technological protection measure contained in the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(g)         not distribute any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services for commercial purposes or otherwise sub-license or resell the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services;

(h)         not create derivative works from all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, SaaS materials or any other services offered by Jedox;

(i)           not transfer, assign, rent, lease, lend, sell or otherwise dispose of all or any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or the SaaS services; and

(j)           not make any part of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services or SaaS materials offered by Jedox publicly available.

 

21.3              The customer undertakes not to publish content which violates third-party rights or statutory regulations. The customer is in particular not permitted to spread and/or put images, texts, graphics and links or other data or content online which violate legal regulations or third-party copyrights, intellectual property rights or any other third-party rights. Storage and/or disclosure to third parties of extremist content, or content which is against public policy or of texts or data depicting violence or contain pornographic, discriminatory, racist, defamatory or other illegal content or illustrations are not permitted. Jedox is entitled to block the customer account in case violation of the above. The same shall apply if the customer discloses content to third parties which offends their honor, or insults or disparages persons or certain groups of people. The same applies even if an actual legal claim is not given. The customer bears the sole responsibility for data and content provided by him and shall keep Jedox indemnified in full against all costs, expenses, damages and losses, including any interest, fines, legal and other professional fees and expenses awarded against or incurred or paid by Jedox as a result of or in connection with any claim brought against Jedox for actual or alleged infringement of a third party’s rights arising out of, or in connection with, the customer’s use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure. Jedox does not examine the content for its correctness, or lack of viruses or to determine whether it is technically possible to examine it for viruses.

 

21.4              The customer is prohibited under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions:

(a)         to store or forward infringing, defamatory or other illegal and/or illicit content;

(b)         to use services and systems provided under this agreement to store or forward malicious codes or other sabotage programs;

(c)         to impair or disturb the integrity or performance capacity of the services and system provided under this agreement;

(d)         to use the services provided under this agreement to gain illicit access to systems or networks which are interconnected with these services; and

(e)         to send spam, mass e-mails or other unwanted messages in violation of applicable laws and regulations.

 

21.5             In the event that the customer violates any of the aforementioned provisions Jedox may temporally deny the access of customer to the Software or Jedox Marketplace. Further claims of Jedox remain unaffected. We inform the customer of every suspension.

 

21.6             Should the customer purchase a “Connector” from Jedox for the data exchange between Software and a third-party Software, the customer is obligated to license the third-party Software accordingly.

 

21.7              The use of a license for Software Content is only permitted in connection with Standard Software. Standard Software Licenses are always “Named User” Licenses.

 

22.           Delivery Time, Default of Acceptance

 

22.1              Delivery and performance periods (including any timeframes, milestones or delivery dates in relation to services) shall be binding only if expressly confirmed by Jedox. Any delivery or performance periods expressed by Jedox as being a target or estimate will not be binding on Jedox.

 

22.2              Even if a state of default has already started, the delivery or performance period shall be duly extended in the event of force majeure and any unforeseeable hindrances that occur after the conclusion of the agreement and for which Jedox is not responsible, provided that such hindrances affect the performance of the services owed. This shall apply even if these circumstances occur at upstream suppliers. Jedox shall notify the customer as soon as possible of the beginning and end of such hindrances. If the hindrance lasts longer than three months or it is obvious that it will last longer than three months, either the customer or Jedox may terminate the agreement by providing written notice of termination to the other party.

 

22.3              Any liability of Jedox for any loss, however caused (including by the negligence of Jedox), suffered by the customer in connection with any delay by Jedox in providing the Jedox SaaS services, other services of Jedox or any contractual item is limited to an amount equivalent to 3% per annum of the total value of the delivery or performance (with the total value of delivery or performance being the total amounts paid to Jedox by the customer for the provision of the relevant service) prorated by the length of the delay. The limitation of liability in this clause 5.3 shall not apply in the event of delay due to gross negligence, or in the event of death or injury to life, body, or health.

 

23.           Prices

 

Unless agreed otherwise, the prices quoted in the applicable list of prices and conditions of Jedox are subject to Indirect Taxes or any other relevant taxes and shipping costs which amounts will be payable by the customer in addition to the prices.

 

24.           Payment Terms, Doubts concerning the Creditworthiness

 

24.1              Unless agreed otherwise by Jedox in writing, invoices shall be due for payment without any deductions within 30 days of the invoice date. The payment will be deemed made as soon as Jedox has the entire amount at its disposal without recourse ("Receipt of Payment").

 

24.2              Checks will only be accepted by special agreement between the Parties and will only be deemed as payment after they have been unconditionally credited to Jedox. All costs and expenses incurred in this connection, especially banking, discount, and other fees plus Indirect Taxes or other relevant taxes shall be borne by the customer and shall be due immediately for payment.

 

24.3              Offsetting, set offs or retention of payments that has the effect of offsetting is only permitted if Jedox provides prior written consent to the offsetting, set offs or retention (which consent may be given or withheld in the sole discretion of Jedox).

 

24.4              If the customer fails to pay any amounts payable to Jedox in respect of any services provided by Jedox then, without limiting the other rights of Jedox in respect of the non-payment, from the onset of the default until such time as the unpaid amount (together with all interest) is paid in full, Jedox may require payment of interest on all unpaid amounts at the rate fixed from time to time under the Rules of Court promulgated by the Supreme Court of Judicature Act (Cap. 322).

 

24.5              If it becomes evident after the commencement of the agreement that the entitlement of Jedox to payment or the ability of Jedox to recover payment (including a future payment) from the customer is endangered by the lack of ability to pay on the part of the customer, Jedox may refuse the performance and the actions in preparation of the performance. The right to refuse performance shall cease if the payment is made (including, in the case of a future payment, by the customer making that payment in advance) or collateral or other security is furnished by the customer (which security is acceptable to Jedox in its sole discretion). Jedox may set a period for the customer to pay/to furnish collateral or other security. If this period passes without payment or collateral being provided, Jedox may terminate the agreement by providing written notice of termination to customer.

 

24.6             Unless expressly stated otherwise, all fees and other amounts payable by the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions have been calculated without regard to any goods or services tax, value added tax, consumption tax or tax of a similar kind ("Indirect Tax").  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, if Indirect Tax is imposed upon or is payable by Jedox under or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, the customer must pay to Jedox an amount equal to the Indirect Tax upon demand by Jedox.

 

24.7             All payments by the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions shall be made in full, without any deduction or withholding in respect of taxes unless the deduction or withholding is required by law. If the customer is required by law to make any deduction or withholding for any taxes from any payments to Jedox under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions such that Jedox would not receive the full amount of the fees or other amounts payable, the customer agrees to:

(m)  deduct or withhold the amount for taxes from the payment;

(n)    promptly pay the amount deducted to the relevant government authority on time and otherwise in accordance with the relevant law;

(o)    provide to Jedox an original receipt, certificate or other evidence of payment of the deducted or withheld amount; and

(p)    pay an additional amount to Jedox at the same time as the affected payment is due so that, after making the deduction or withholding and any further deductions or withholdings on the additional amount payable under this clause 7.7(d), Jedox receives an amount equal to the amount it would have received if no deductions or withholdings had been made.

 

II.            Terms and Conditions for the Payable Use of Standard Software within the Scope of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure

 

25.           Rights of the Customer, Use

 

25.1              The customer is granted the non-exclusive right for the term of the agreement to use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox defined in the offer by way of remote access via the Internet. The customer may only use the software and process and store the data for its own internal business purposes.

 

25.2              The customer is not granted any further rights, e.g. the right to modify the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox, to reproduce it, and/or to use it for other purposes not specified herein. The customer is not permitted to reverse engineer, decompile, copy, disassemble, or reproduce the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox or to use any part of it for the purpose of creating a separate application. Moreover, the customer is prohibited from creating any other derived works based on the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox, especially from developing a competing product or service or from copying features, functions, or images.

 

25.3              Furthermore, the customer is not permitted to market, sell, let, sublicense, license, or otherwise make available the rights granted herein to any third parties, unless the party is a designated user. Designated users are all persons that have been approved by Jedox as being users of the relevant service.

 

25.4              The router port facing the Internet of the data center used by Jedox is the point of handover for the contractual services and Jedox ceases to be responsible for providing the contractual services once the contractual services are available from that router port.

 

25.5              The software, the computing power required for the use, and the needed storage space for data (RAM and HD) shall be made available by Jedox or a sub-contractor engaged by it. The individual performance parameters shall be governed by the respective offer.

 

25.6              Jedox will send the customer the login details required for the use of the software and authorization. The customer is not permitted to give the login details to third parties, unless the party is a user designated to Jedox who was taken into consideration in the calculation of the fee. The customer shall be responsible for all activities that take place due to unauthorized use of the login details. In the case of such unauthorized use by third parties, Jedox shall be notified without delay. The customer shall report new additional users to Jedox before the commencement of their work in order to enable an adjustment of the fee calculation.

 

25.7              The connection of the customer to the Internet is not part of the subject matter of this agreement. The customer alone shall be responsible for the operability of his Internet connection, including the transmission routes and his own computer.

 

25.8              The customer alone shall be responsible for the permissibility of the collection, processing, and use of the data entered by the customer within the scope of the use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox.

 

25.9              Operation of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services or any other services offered by Jedox for the customer by third-party companies by way of outsourcing must only be undertaken with the prior written approval of Jedox.

 

25.10           All trademark rights, copyrights, rights to business secrets, and/or other intellectual property of Jedox shall belong exclusively to Jedox. The customer shall notify Jedox without delay in writing in case third parties assert property rights to the software against it.

 

26.           Obligations of the Customer

 

26.1              The customer shall only use the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services, materials or any other services offered by Jedox and the provided storage and computer space in accordance with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions. The installation of further software is not permitted. The same applies to the storage of data not directly associated with the use of the contractual software.

 

26.2              The customer shall duly assist Jedox in the service performance.

 

26.3              The customer shall observe the usual and accepted security standards. Among other things, this includes regular backups by the customer.

 

26.4              The customer must protect all login details in order to prevent third-party access. Code words and passwords shall be changed prior to initial use and thereafter at regular intervals. Code words and passwords shall be changed without delay if it is suspected or there are indications that they have become known to third parties.

26.5              The customer guarantees that the information it sends to Jedox is true and always up to date.

 

26.6              The customer shall check in due time whether the contractual services performed meet the contractual requirements. If this is not the case, Jedox shall be notified without delay. In this case, the customer must give Jedox all relevant information. Moreover, the customer shall ensure that the minimum requirements for the hardware and software as well as the Internet connection utilized by the customer, which are required for the contractual use of the services, are fulfilled. The customer shall observe all specifications of Jedox that concern the contractual services.

 

26.7              The customer is solely responsible for ensuring that its access to and use of the software and services of Jedox complies with all applicable laws. The customer shall bear all costs, such as customs duties, taxes, other levies, or fees that may be incurred for the use of the software.

 

26.8              In the event of a breach of the obligations under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions that the customer must comply with, Jedox may block the customer's access at its expense. This does not relieve the customer of its payment obligations toward Jedox.

 

26.9              Any disadvantages and additional costs resulting from the obligations listed herein shall be borne exclusively by the customer.

 

27.           Availability

 

27.1              Unless expressly agreed otherwise between the parties, an availability of 99 percent in respect of the contractual service is ensured on annual average.

 

27.2              Failures and impairments in connection with the availability and/or provision during a normal maintenance window and/or during maintenance and support, installation, or implementation work coordinated with the customer as well as scheduled downtimes that have been coordinated with the customer or decommissioning during these times shall not be construed as non-availability times.

 

27.3              Moreover, times during which the contractual service is not available or is only available to a limited extent due to technical or other circumstances outside the realm of influence of Jedox (e.g. force majeure, malfunction in telecommunication lines, third-party faults) shall not be construed as non-availability times.

 

27.4              Times of non-availability are also time periods during which Jedox temporarily restricts the access to the contractual service due to:

(g)         an acute threat to the data, hardware, and/or software infrastructure or data, hardware, and/or software infrastructure of the customer due to external threats (e.g. viruses, port hacking, attacks via Trojans); or

(h)         a significant threat to the security of the network operation or the network integrity.

 

27.5              In the specified times of non-availability, Jedox shall take the legitimate interests of the customer into consideration as far as possible. Jedox shall without delay inform the customer of measures taken, as far as possible. Jedox shall take all steps that can reasonably be expected in order to restore the availability.

 

27.6              The customer shall without delay report any availability malfunctions to Jedox. The availability will only be deemed impaired insofar as a malfunction is actually on hand. Impairment of the data transfer that originates from the customer's local IT system or malfunction of the customer's connection to the agreed point of handover (e.g. line failure or malfunction at other providers or telecommunication operators) does not represent a malfunction as defined above.

 

 

28.           Defects

 

28.1              Jedox shall not be liable for any defects that exists prior to and at the point in time the agreement comes into effect.

 

28.2              The customer shall report any detected defects of the software to Jedox without delay in writing. In the event of defects in quality, the report shall contain a description of the time of occurrence of the defects and precise details.

 

28.3              A customer must report to Jedox defects that are known to it or obvious defects within eight workdays. Failure to report the defects will cause the customer to lose its rights to a reduction in fees or termination of the agreement due to these defects. The same applies to concealed defects that are not reported within eight workdays of their discovery.

 

28.4              If no breach of the agreement can be found following a defect report of the customer, the customer shall refund the costs incurred in connection with the inspection if the unjustified defect report was caused by a fault of the customer.

 

28.5              For damage due to defects, Jedox shall only be liable up to the limits specified in clause 12.

 

29.           Liability, Exclusion of Liability

 

29.1              The products and services provided by Jedox may be subject to consumer guarantees that cannot be excluded under Singapore law. If customer is entitled to any remedy for breach of the consumer guarantees contained under any relevant Singapore law, then nothing in these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions will operate so as to exclude, restrict or modify the application of any of the provisions of such law when the exercise of a right conferred by such a provision, or any liability of Jedox for a breach of a condition, warranty or guarantee implied by such law would render it void to do so.  To the extent permitted by law, Jedox and its related entities expressly limit their liability for a breach of any condition, warranty or guarantee implied by virtue of any relevant Singapore legislation to, at the election of Jedox:

(a)         in the case of goods, any one or more of the following:

                              xvii.                    the replacement of the goods or the supply of equivalent goods;

                             xviii.                    the repair of the goods;

                               xix.                    the payment of the cost of replacing the goods or of acquiring equivalent goods; or

                                 xx.                    the payment of the cost of having the goods repaired; or

(b)         in the case of services:

(i)               the supplying of the services again; or

(ii)              the payment of the cost of having the services supplied again.

 

29.2              In all other cases of liability of Jedox to customer, all compensation claims including due to the breach of a duty by Jedox, breach of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox and due to tort by Jedox are excluded, so that, to the maximum extent permitted by law, Jedox is not liable for lost profit or other monetary damage incurred by the customer. If Jedox is found to be liable to pay any damages, compensation or other amounts to the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, such liability will be limited to the amount set out in clause 5.3 (which amount is the maximum, aggregate liability of Jedox to the customer for all damages, compensation, loss, claims or other amounts Jedox is liable to pay to the customer under or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions).

 

29.3              Without limiting any other provisions of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, Jedox is not liable for any Consequential Loss (however caused) suffered or incurred by the customer in connection with this agreement or the provision of the services. This clause applies even if Jedox knew or ought to have known that the relevant Consequential Loss would be suffered.  Consequential Loss means loss beyond the normal measure of damages and further includes, without limitation, all indirect loss, all loss of revenue, all loss of reputation, all loss of profits, all loss of data, all loss of actual or anticipated savings, all loss of bargain, all lost opportunities, including opportunities to enter into arrangements with third parties, all loss of use, all cost of capital and all costs of substitute goods, facilities or services.

 

29.4              Without limiting any other provision of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, if the customer failed to make backup copies in order to protect itself from loss of data, Jedox’s liability in cases of negligence which results in loss of data shall be limited to the recovery expenses that would have been incurred if backups had been made.

 

29.5              If Jedox’s liability is excluded or limited due to any of the aforesaid provisions, this shall also apply to the personal liability of Jedox’s employees, staff members, representatives, and agents.

 

30.           Statute of Limitations

 

To the maximum extent permitted by law, all claims against Jedox by the customer under or in respect of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions shall expire after one year ("limitation period"). The limitation period shall begin on the date the customer is aware (or ought reasonably to be aware) of the circumstances giving rise to the claim. 

 

31.           Privacy and Data Protection

 

31.1              The parties must comply with their respective obligations under the Personal Data Protection Act 2012, as amended from time to time. 

 

31.2              Jedox shall process customer's personal information or data required to provide the services to the customer in accordance with any obligations imposed on Jedox under relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations.

 

31.3              The parties acknowledge that, with respect to all personal information or data that Jedox has access to in relation to the provision of the services by Jedox:

(d)         the customer will be responsible for determining and monitoring its compliance with the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations, including ensuring that the access to and use of the services by the customer complies with the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations;

(e)         Jedox will not have obligations to monitor compliance by the customer with the Personal Data Protection Act 2012 or other relevant privacy or data protection laws and regulations; and

(f)           the customer will obtain all consents, permissions or authorisations required in order for Jedox to be able to access, use, store, process, disclose and otherwise manage personal information or data of the customer as contemplated by these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions.

 

31.4              Jedox undertakes to ensure that access to customer data is restricted to technical support, cloud operations and consulting teams, and only if they directly require access to the data in order to fulfill Jedox’s obligations in accordance with this Agreement and the relevant data protection laws. Jedox shall ensure that the confidentiality obligations stipulated in this Agreement are enforced. 

 

 

 

32.           Published Contents

 

32.1              The customer shall mark the contents it uploads to the Internet as their own or third-party contents and present his full name and address.

 

32.2              The customer undertakes not to publish any contents that violate the rights of third parties or any applicable laws. Storage of extremist or immoral content or any other content that Jedox reasonably determines to be unacceptable is not permitted. Jedox may block the customer's access in case that this rule is breached. The same shall apply in case the customer publishes contents that could offend third parties or insult or denigrate persons or groups of people. This shall apply even if no actual legal claim is on hand. Jedox is under no obligation to review the contents of the customer.

 

32.3              The customer is prohibited (a) from storing or transmitting contents that breach rights, that constitute slander, or that are otherwise unlawful and/or prohibited within the scope of the rights granted under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, (b) from using provided services or systems for storing or transmitting malicious code or other malware, (c) from impairing or disrupting the integrity or performance of the provided services, (d) from gaining unauthorized access to the systems or networks  associated with the provided services, and (e) from transmitting spam mail, mass mail, or other unsolicited mail in breach of applicable laws.

 

32.4              In the event of non-compliance, Jedox may block the access.

 

33.           Fee, Due Date, Late Payment

 

33.1              Unless agreed otherwise, the fee for the use of the standard software within the scope of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure during the minimum term shall be governed by the current list of prices and conditions of Jedox plus value-added tax. Unless agreed otherwise, after the end of the minimum term, the fee quoted in the current list of prices and conditions of Jedox for the minimum term shall apply plus any GST or other relevant taxes, unless a new minimum term is agreed.

 

33.2              Unless agreed otherwise, the fee for the agreed minimum term shall be due in advance on the third workday of the agreed minimum term. After the end of the minimum term and if the agreement is not terminated, the fee for the minimum term shall always be due in advance on the third workday of the respective minimum term.

 

33.3              With respect to the default interest to be paid by the customer in the case of late payment, clause 7.4 shall apply analogously.

 

34.           Term and Termination

 

34.1              The term of the agreement depends on the period determined in the offer (hereinafter referred to as "minimum term"). Thereafter, it will automatically be extended by the period of the determined minimum term, unless it is terminated by either party with three months' written notice, effective at the end of the minimum term or of an extension term. If no minimum term is determined in the offer, a minimum term of 12 months will be deemed agreed.

 

34.2              The agreement shall commence upon transmission of the login details to the customer.

 

17.8         The agreement may be terminated in writing by either party with immediate effect for good cause. For the customer, good cause will consist of a material shortfall of the agreed availability of the software; being a shortfall amounts to availability of more than 10 percent less than the agreed availability percentage.

 

17.9         Without limiting clause 17.3, Jedox may terminate the agreement at any time and without cause by providing the customer with no less than 30 days’ written notice of termination.

 

17.10       Without limiting clauses 17.3 and 17.4, Jedox may, by written notice to the customer, terminate the agreement with immediate effect if:

(m)        the customer fails to comply with any written notice issued by Jedox requiring the customer to remedy a breach, non-observance or non-performance of the customer’s obligations under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions within seven business days of receiving that notice from Jedox;

(n)         the customer commits a breach of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions which is incapable of remedy;

(o)         the customer goes into liquidation, is wound up, becomes insolvent or has a receiver appointed over all or any substantial part of its assets; or

(p)         the customer proposes or enters into any schemes of arrangements with its creditors.

 

17.11       Notice of termination must be given in writing.

 

17.12       Upon termination of the agreement taking effect:

(e)         the customer must immediately:

(i)               cease all usage of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure and software; and

(ii)              remove from all storage media and destroy all copies of the Jedox software and login data for the Jedox SaaS infrastructure; and

(iii)             pay to Jedox all fees, expenses or other sums payable to Jedox under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions which have accrued or are payable as at the date of termination; and

(iv)             provide Jedox with written confirmation that it has completed its obligations under this clause 17.7(a); and

(f)           Jedox ceases to have any obligations under these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions with respect to the provision of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure, SaaS services or any additional services.

 

For the avoidance of doubt, following termination of the agreement taking effect, Jedox will be entitled to retain any fees paid by the customer, even if such amounts were paid in advance.

 

 

III.          Miscellaneous

 

24.           Indemnity

 

The customer must indemnify and keep Jedox, its directors, employees and subsidiaries, indemnified against any loss which arises directly or indirectly out of:

(a)         any breach of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions by the customer including any breach in respect of which Jedox exercises a right to terminate;

(b)         the customer or any other person in any way accessing or using the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or SaaS services;

(c)         any unacceptable content being uploaded to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure;

(d)         the uploading of the customer’s data to the Jedox SaaS infrastructure or use of the Jedox SaaS infrastructure by the customer which does not comply with privacy or other laws of any applicable jurisdiction;

(e)         the customer’s data being stored or displayed on the Jedox SaaS infrastructure; or

(f)           any negligent or unlawful acts of the customer or any of its related parties or their respective employees, officers, contractors or representatives,

except to the extent the relevant loss arises as a direct result of any breach of these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions by Jedox or any grossly negligent or unlawful act of Jedox or any of its personnel.

 

 

25.           Third Parties

 

25.1              No one other than a party to these Terms and Conditions, their successors and permitted assignees, shall have any right to enforce any of its terms.

 

25.2              Should a third party assert property rights concerning the contractual services against the customer, Jedox may, at its own discretion and at its own expense, either modify the contractual services or replace them so that the customer is no longer in breach of a property right.

 

25.3              The customer shall notify Jedox without delay in writing in case third parties assert property rights (e.g. copyrights or patent rights) to the contractual services against him. The customer authorizes Jedox to conduct the dispute with the third party by itself. As long as Jedox makes use of this authorization, the customer shall not take the initiative to acknowledge the claims of the third party without the approval of Jedox; in this case, Jedox will defend the third-party claims at its own expense and indemnifies the customer against all costs associated with the defense against these claims, unless they are based on conduct of the customer in breach of obligations (e.g. use in breach of the agreement) or any wrongful conduct, negligence or deliberate acts or omission by the customer.

 

26.           Sub-Contractors

 

Jedox may perform the contractual services (or any part thereof) through third parties as sub-contractors, provided that the respective sub-contractors are adequately qualified.

 

27.           Non-Disclosure

 

27.1              The customer undertakes not to disclose any confidential information that becomes known to him during this agreement relationship and not to use this knowledge, especially not for its own business purposes. Confidential information is all information that is only known to a small group of people and that is not publicly known, that is to be kept secret according to the (express or implied) will of Jedox, and in whose non- disclosure Jedox has a legitimate or economic interest.

 

27.2              The non-disclosure obligation does not apply to knowledge that is publicly accessible or whose forwarding would obviously not result in any disadvantage for Jedox.

 

27.3              The non-disclosure obligation shall continue to apply for 5 years after the end of the agreement.

.

 

28.           Right to Audit the Compliance with the Contractual Terms and Conditions

 

Jedox may inspect the records and IT systems of the customer in order to verify the compliance with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions. For this purpose, Jedox may also commission a third party. Jedox shall inform the customer of such an inspection in writing at least ten (10) workdays in advance.   As far as possible, the audit shall not impair the business operations of the customer more than necessary.

 

29.           Reference Customers

 

Jedox may refer to the customer as a reference customer including in Jedox promotional and marketing materials.

 

30.           Entire Agreement

 

These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between Jedox and the customer and supersedes all previous discussions, correspondence, negotiations, arrangements, understandings and agreements between them relating to its subject matter. Each party acknowledges that in accepting these Terms and Conditions, it does not rely on, and shall have no remedies in respect of, any representation or warranty (whether made innocently or negligently) that is not set out in these Terms and Conditions.

 

31.           Waiver

 

No failure by Jedox to insist on strict performance of any of the terms in these Terms is a waiver of any right or remedy which Jedox may have, and is not a waiver of any subsequent breach or default by the customer.

 

32.           Assignment

 

26.1     The customer shall not, without the prior written consent of Jedox, assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions.

 

26.2     Jedox may at any time assign, transfer, charge, subcontract or deal in any other manner, with all or any of its rights or obligations under these Terms and Conditions without the consent of the customer.

 

33.           Place of Fulfillment, Applicable Law, Jurisdiction

 

33.1              If any provision of these Terms and Conditions is held by a competent authority to be unlawful, invalid, and unenforceable or in conflict with any rule or law, statute, ordinance or regulation then the validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions are not thereby affected.

 

33.2              These SaaS Terms in Business Transactions and all legal relationships between Jedox and the customer are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Singapore.

 

33.3              Any dispute arising out of or in connection with these SaaS Terms in Business Transactions, including any question regarding its existence, validity or termination that cannot be settled amicably by mutual negotiations, shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration administered by the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC") in accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC Rules") for the time being in force, which rules are deemed to be incorporated by reference in this clause. The seat of the arbitration shall be Singapore. The Tribunal shall consist of a single arbitrator to be appointed by the President of the SIAC Court of Arbitration and the language of the arbitration shall be in English.
